name: taraweraholidayhomes.com
homepage_content: Home | Tarawera top of page Book your Tarawera Holiday Home or Glamping Spot Book directly on our website and enjoy the best rates — skipping third-party booking fees can save you hundreds of dollars on your stay. Holiday Homes List Holiday Homes Holiday Homes Glamping Plan Your Gateway In 3 Simple Steps 01 Browse Our Properties Explore our collection of stunning holiday homes and glamping sites in Lake Tarawera and the surrounding areas. 02 Fill out our enquiry form Either book online or let us know how many you need to accomodate (couples and singles) and the dates you wish to book on our enquiry form. Contact Us 03 Enjoy Your Retreat Embark on a memorable journey and immerse yourself in the beauty of Lake Tarawera. Check Our Exclusive Services Optional add-ons: To make your stay extra special we can help you out by providing knowledge and activities around the area, just let us know what you're into. We can also arrange for grazing platters and picnics or a breakfast pack waiting in your fridge. Grazing Platters & Picnics Personal Chef Breakfast Provisions Linen Change Local Excursions Cleaners During Your Stay Grazing Platters & Picnics Grazing Platters and picnics can be ordered in advance and be waiting for you in your fridge on arrival. Various sizes, depending on the number in your group, are available. Contact Us Personal Chef Got something to celebrate. Why not arrange for a private chef to come to your holiday home and cook a delicious meal (6 minimum). Everything is done for you, you don't have to lift a finger. Contact Us Breakfast Provisions Arriving late and don't wish to shop on route. We can arrange to have a selection of breakfast provisions ready and waiting for you at your holiday home. Contact Us Linen Change If you are staying for a week or more you may wish to arrange a change of linen. Please advise us in advance if you would like a changeover during your stay. Contact Us Local Excursions If you have an idea about what you would like to do while you're on holiday at Lake Tarawera please feel free to get in touch for advice and/or assistance with booking or getting in touch with the right company. Contact Us Cleaners During Your Stay If you would like our cleaners to do an extra cleaning during your stay please let us know in advance. Rates are available on request and depends on if you would also like a linen change. Contact Us 01 Bespoke And Exclusive Services We take pride in offering more than just property management; we treat each home as if it were our own. 02 Support Throughout Your Stay Enjoy a luxurious retreat in some of Lake Tarawera's and the surrounding districts' most beautiful homes and glamping sites, with local insights and support available throughout your stay. More about us 03 Have a memorable Experience Our goal is to ensure you have a truly memorable experience, leaving you feeling refreshed and rejuvenated and yearning to come back again Guest Reviews "Our stay was absolutely incredible. The property was stunning and the support from the team made our trip unforgettable." James Reynolds Discover Lake Tarawera - Explore The Area Totally Tarawera Take a trip with Totally Tarawera and jump on the water taxi to the hot water beach, go see Tarawera falls or hike the Tarawera trail. Take a look at the options on: www.totallytarawera.com The Redwoods Why not hire a bike and go on the Forest Loop great ride. 33 Kilometre long. The best place to start the trail is Waipa bike hub. Alternatively, take one of the hikes in the Redwood forest. www.redwoods.co.nz Book your activity here More about the area Simple Things Take a walk along the lake front and enjoy a picnic. Catch a rainbow trout. Swim in the lake (22 degrees during the summer months). Hike around the Blue Lake (about 1.5 hours). bottom of page

name: thesmashpalace.co.nz
homepage_content: Smash Palace | Bar & Burger Joint | High Street, Christchurch SMASH PALACE is a bar in a bus, a burger joint and the home of Bodgie Beer. Emerging from the rubble of the Christchurch earthquakes, this once-temporary boozer has become a permanent part of the city’s drinking culture. It’s a courtyard bar where the beer is cold and sold in real pints while the burgers are hot and cooked fresh. Thursday night is motorbike night and if you look carefully you might see Greg working on a motorbike. On the weekend the DJs spin vinyl from the workshop container. Pub dog Graham is on site four days a week. Graham says: “Dogs are welcome.” On a Friday afternoon in summer, we reckon this place is about as good as it gets in this ol’ town. Location 172 High Street Christchurch Hours Open from midday Tuesday through Sunday Basic Beef, chutney, gherkin, mayo $14 Cheeseburger Beef, cheese, gherkin, chutney, mayo $15 BlueCheeseburger Beef, caramelised onions, blue cheese, lettuce, chutney, mayo $18 BBQ Bacon Beef, bacon, onion ring, cheese, bbq sauce, mayo $19 Hotburger Beef, harissa, jalapeno, cheese, lettuce, mayo $17 Noah’s Arc Beef, chicken, bacon, chutney, mayo, lettuce $22 Hawaiian Chicken Fried chicken, pineapple, bacon, lettuce, mayo $18 Chicken Boo Fried chicken, cheese, ‘slaw, harissa, mayo, gherkin $18 BBQ Chicken Fried chicken, bacon, cheese, bbq sauce, mayo, lettuce $18 Vegematarian Falafel, cheese, mayo, kimchi, lettuce $15 Vegan Spice tofu patty, Kimchi, BBQ Sauce, lettuce $15 Smash fried chicken Local-famous chicken thigh with bbq mayo $18 Japapeno Poppers A wee bit spicy $15 Chook ‘n’ Chips Lil’ chook, lil’ chups $14 Chips Potatoes chopped up and cooked for your pleasure $10 Add Aioli $2 Add Gravy $2 Cheerios And tom sauce $6 Kentucky Fried Tofu With bbq sauce $12 Pierogi Polish potato dumplings. From our friends down at the Pierogi Joint. Six for $15 Add sour cream $2 Bodgie Beer Our specialty house beer — made by us, just for you. It’s fresh, it’s local and it’s pouring all the time at Smash Palace. There’s a full range of Bodgie drinks, you can get a sampler tray if you want. We love the stuff and drink far too much of it ourselves. Other Tap Drinks We change these out more than the rear rubber on the old Cortina. But you’ll find boozy lemonade, sours, cider, boozy gingerbeer… Go on — get some. Bottles and Cans There’s a few bottles and cans for those not catered to by the taps. Speights Big Bots. $14 Heineken $10 SOL $10 Pals $10 Wine List All the wines are from Waipara. All are from family owned and run vineyards. We like to support our friends. Boneline Sauvignon Blanc $13 Main Divide Chardonnay $12 Main Divide Riesling $12 Black Estate Pinot Gris $13 Georges Rd Rose $12 Boneline Rose $15 Boneline Pinot Noir $14 Main Divide Cabernet Merlot $12 Non Alcoholic Juice, Coke, Sprite, Ginger Ale, L&P, Coke Zero $5 Karma Drinks Range $10 Garage Project Tiny (zero percent) $10 Heineken Zero $10 CONTACT Due to being at the mercy of the weather we don't take reservations. But there's heaps of space - just show up and we will do our best to fit you in. ADDRESS Find us at: 172 High Street, Christchurch. New Zealand CONTACT FORM Cart ( 0 )

name: tewharekorowai.org.nz
homepage_content: Te Whare Korowai Taangata o Kirikiriroa | Hamilton Christian Nightshelter To enquire about our services please contact us on 07 839 7480 Donate Now Shelter. Hope. Support. Providing safe accommodation and support for adults in Kirikiriroa, Hamilton for 26 years. How we can help To enquire about our services please contact us on 07 839 7480 Our Mission Te Whare Korowai Taangata o Kirikiriroa (formally the Hamilton Christian Nightshelter Trust) is dedicated to providing accommodation and support to homeless adults in Kirikiriroa. Our community are the most vulnerable people in society, and we strive to support and walk alongside them on their journey of securing long-term, sustainable housing. Each year, we provide over 20,000 bed-nights and support more than 500 individuals per year. Be A Part Of Our Mission Today As a community organisation, we strive to do the best for our community in our actions to alleviate homelessness in Hamilton. Consider making a donation today to be a part of our mission. Donate here Join the kaupapa We post regularly on our social media. Follow us to keep up to date with what's happening in our space. Thank you to the community who support our mission Without your support, Te Whare Korowai Taangata o Kirikiriroa wouldn't be able to operate as we do. Donate here Trustees Contact us Home Our Story What We Do Get Involved Contact Te Whare Korowai Taangata o Kirikiriroa is a Registered Charitable Entity under the Charities Act 2005. homepage_content: Sequoia Lodge Backpackers | Home away from home Home Rooms & Rates See & Do FAQs Guestbook Booking Map & Contact Welcome to Sequoia Lodge & Backpackers! Staying with us at Sequoia Lodge is like coming home to a familiar and friendly face. We are welcoming and our lodge is warm and cosy, colourful and clean. name: kaurihouseapartment.co.nz
homepage_content: Self Catering Accommodation Wanaka — Kauri House Apartment Home The Apartment About Location Book now Blog Contact Us Welcome Kauri House is a one bedroom, romantic retreat nestled in a peaceful Wanaka setting MAKE A RESERVATION EXPERIENCE KAURI HOUSE APARTMENT This beautiful private apartment sits on an elevated site, with a king of the castle- 270’ degree view over majestic landscape, encompassing both Lake Wanaka and the mountain ranges of the NZ Southern Alps. It is extremely popular with nature lovers and those seeking peaceful relaxation all year round. Read More A HILLTOP RETREAT Nestled amongst the trees, Kauri House Apartment enjoys constant native birdsong This one bedroom, romantic Wanaka retreat features unique architecture, ultimate comfort & a wonderful atmosphere created by the natural design. It is equipped with everything that you may need for a short, or long-term stay. Read More YOUR WANAKA ACCOMMODATION Make A Reservation YOUR HOSTS Your hosts, Noelene and Bill Pullar, long time Wanaka residents, will be pleased to share their local knowledge of the area with you. Should you wish, they can guide you to local points of interest such as restaurants, fishing spots, and the magnificent walks along the riversides and around Lake Wanaka. Bill & Noelene are also extremely familiar with the range of activities available in the region so if you would like suggestions, simply let them know! The owners are within reach at Kauri House should guests wish for true local knowledge, however, please note that guests are also welcome to complete privacy & the apartment has its own entrance. Other than upon check in and to receive your breakfast, it is up to you how much interaction you have with the hosts GALLERY Explore our tranquil Wanaka accommodation. Discover More

Not with wings and a jetpack, but with a rush of adrenaline and a heart-pounding freefall? Then bungy jumping in New Zealand might be the ultimate adventure for you! Nicknamed “The Adventure Capital of the World,” New Zealand is a haven for thrill-seekers, and bungy jumping is practically a national pastime here. In this guide, we’ll take you on a jump (virtually, for now) through some of New Zealand’s most unforgettable bungy jumping locations. We’ll explore the iconic sites, the heart-stopping heights, and everything you need to know to plan your own exhilarating bungy experience. As you plan your visit to this enchanting country, you may find yourself faced with a delightful dilemma: which city should you explore, Auckland or Wellington? In this comprehensive guide, we’ll help you make an informed decision by comparing the two cities based on various factors, including attractions, climate, culture, and more. Let’s dive in! While the world-renowned “The Lord of the Rings” and “The Hobbit” trilogies showcased the country’s natural wonders, New Zealand has also been the backdrop for other captivating films, like hentai . In this article, we embark on an immersive journey to uncover the fascinating details of these iconic film locations, discovering the magic that has made New Zealand a beloved destination for filmmakers and movie enthusiasts alike. However, with its stunning mountain ranges and world-class ski resorts, New Zealand has become an increasingly popular winter destination for snow sports enthusiasts from around the globe. The hyper-realistiÂ­cally constructed movie set built by the Lord of the Rings directorâs crew makes visitors feel like theyâve traveled to a land far beyond our land. It truly… Continue reading New Zealand is one of those places that really gets people excited. An exotic land of mystery, Maori culture, and magical landscapes. A place where you can ski and ride waves on the same day, walk on a glacier before diving into a natural hot spring, or sail across a lake filled with glowworms before… Continue reading A gateway to some of New Zealandâs most spectacular wilderness scenery and outdoor adventure, the country town of Tuatapere is 88km west of Invercargill. name: woodbury.nz
homepage_content: Home Book Now Check-in Check-out Book Now Discover Serenity at Our Rural Bed and Breakfast. Escape to tranquility at our charming rural bed and breakfast, nestled on the picturesque outskirts of Auckland, New Zealand. Surrounded by lush trees and an abundance of wildlife, our haven offers a serene retreat from the hustle and bustle of city life. Wake up to the soothing sounds of nature and explore our expansive grounds, where you can meet the wander through verdant forests, spot native birds, and perhaps even encounter friendly farm animals. Whether you're seeking a peaceful getaway or an adventure in the great outdoors, our bed and breakfast provides the perfect setting for relaxation and rejuvenation. Experience the beauty of rural New Zealand and create unforgettable memories at our idyllic retreat. Your Perfect Retreat: A Self-Contained Haven. Welcome to your perfect retreat, a separate self-contained house designed for ultimate comfort and privacy. This charming abode features a lovely queen-size bed, ensuring a restful night's sleep amidst serene surroundings. The modern bathroom is equipped with all the amenities you need for a refreshing start to your day. Enjoy the convenience of our well-appointed kitchenette, complete with facilities to prepare your favorite meals and snacks. Adding to the charm of your stay is our friendly dog, Chase, who loves to greet guests and make them feel at home. You'll also find our playful cats and cheerful chickens roaming the property, adding to the delightful rural experience. Whether you're here for a romantic getaway or a peaceful solo escape, our self-contained house offers the ideal setting for relaxation and rejuvenation. Experience the tranquility and comfort of your own private haven, where every detail is thoughtfully curated to enhance your stay. Highly Rated Accomodation Since 2017, our rural bed and breakfast on the outskirts of Auckland has been dedicated to providing guests with an exceptional experience in a tranquil and natural setting. The property has been meticulously maintained and continuously improved to ensure the highest standards of comfort and hospitality. From the outset, we have focused on creating a welcoming environment where guests can escape the hustle and bustle of city life. Our commitment to sustainability and eco-friendly practices has been a cornerstone of our operations, with efforts to preserve the natural beauty of the surrounding landscape and support local wildlife. The property features beautifully landscaped gardens, well-maintained walking trails, and cozy accommodations that blend modern amenities with rustic charm. Each year, we have introduced new enhancements, such as upgrading our facilities, expanding our offerings, and incorporating feedback from our valued guests to refine our services. Our team has worked tirelessly to cultivate a warm and inviting atmosphere, ensuring that every guest feels at home. From personalized service to thoughtfully prepared meals using locally sourced ingredients, we strive to make every stay memorable. As we look to the future, we remain committed to upholding the traditions and values that have made our bed and breakfast a beloved retreat for visitors seeking peace, relaxation, and a connection with nature.

name: whananakilodge.co.nz
homepage_content: Whananaki Lodge - Whananaki Beach House for rent | Holiday Houses by Trade Me Trade Me Where Kiwis buy & sell Trade Me Insurance Car, house & contents Holiday Houses For better places to stay FindSomeone Dating & personals MotorWeb Vehicle reports Homes.co.nz Sales & valuations Northland / Whananaki Whananaki Lodge 2181 Whananaki North Rd, Whananaki North, Northland Add to Shortlist Share to your friend 1 review View Gallery 30+ Max Guest s 5 Bedroom s 2 Bathroom s Add to Shortlist Share to your friend 1 review About this Holiday House Whananaki Lodge Whananaki Lodge is a Christian Trust for family RETREATS and OUTDOOR ADVENTURES for youth. The facility is a rustic lodge located in beautiful Northland. We encourage strengthening of families and opportunities for young people to experience adventures away from city life where they can be challenged to develop to their fullest potential. We are located in a quiet residential neighbourhood with beautiful surroundings and close neighbours. Perfect for small school groups, youth groups, family getaways or retreats. This is not a venue for loud parties or celebrations with high alcohol use or excessive noise. We have a little Cottage out the back which is an extra $65 a night if required (plus cleaning fee of $40). You can add this to your booking of the main Lodge. Details and amenities Child friendly No pets Linen not provided Smoking outside only No disabled access Heating & cooling Fire place Kitchen Freezer Fridge Microwave Oven Toaster Bathroom Extra Toilet Shower Laundry Cleaning equipment Cleaning supplies Clothes line Parking Garage Off Street Parking Outdoors Outdoor furniture Outdoor Shower Other Cellphone coverage Bed layout 22 Bunk(s), 1 Queen(s), 1 Double(s), 1 King single(s), 1 Trundler bed(s) Special Amenities FACILITIES ACCOMMODATION—26 beds. Two bunkrooms that sleep 11 each in 3 tier bunks. A further 2 people can be accommodated in a side room (one queen size bed) and there are comfortable quarters situated in a skyline garage at the rear of the camp which sleeps up to 4 in 2 bedrooms - one with a double bed, and the other with a king single and a trundle bed. Mattresses are provided. EATING—The camp has adequate cutlery, crockery, mugs, tables and seating for up to 35. COOKING—The kitchen has 2 domestic stoves each with 4 high speed elements, 1 fridge and a freezer in the garage, plus a pantry for storage and a large stainless steel bench/work area. The cupboards are stocked with plenty of pots, pans, bowls and utensils. The water supply is from a tank supplemented by a bore in dry periods. ABLUTIONS—The camp has 5 toilets and 4 showers, 4 hand basins and a good supply of hot water. The camp is on its own septic tank. MAIN HALL—The main hall is approximately 9 x 7.5 metres and is suitable for some indoor games. There are well used couches, comfy chairs, dining tables and chairs and a very efficient wood stove making winter usage a pleasure (wood not provided). GROUNDS—The camp grounds are minimal in area. Some outdoor seating and a washing line is available. Between the camp and the estuary is a grassed reserve suitable for outdoor games. Special Attractions and Activities Nearby RECREATION OPPORTUNITIES Whananaki is a typically beautiful east coast Northland holiday haven. Just 50 metres from the camp is the estuary, which is ideal for safe boating, windsurfing, water-skiing, canoeing, fishing etc. Across the estuary is a sandspit partly covered in a pine plantation. A footbridge across the estuary boasts a reputation as being the longest in New Zealand. Within easy walking distance of the camp is beautiful Motutara Point with its many rocky coves. A trek south along the coast takes you to the Capitaine Bouganville Memorial. Following the coast road north will take you to many beautiful beaches, some sandy, some surf, others shingle. Ideal for coastal sea kayaking, sailing, fishing, snorkel or scuba diving, surfing, swimming, or just lying on the beach away from the crowds. Reviews Average Rating: 5 1 total review Leave a review Reza Amani March 2018 Nicer and cleaner than the photos. The owner is very respectful and trustful. Read more + Show Less - Sudima Hotel Lake Rotorua 6.4 Good Eli 31 December 1969 Location was great for my city trip, just a short walk from main attractions! Staff were super friendly and welcoming and made me feel right at home. I especially LOVED the complementary breakfast buffet and Maori concert! Such a great way to start my day! There were some issues with the room. The aircon unit didn't work, and there were only two towels for three people. Read more + Show Less - Novotel Rotorua Lakeside 9.0 Good Laura 22 November 2021 i loved that place, the balcony was big. a perfect beach, exceptional view. pool was great. moreover, there was wifi throughout the property. Read more + Show Less - Wai Ora Lakeside Spa Resort 8.2 Very good Johnny 23 September 2020 View from the room was nice. 10 min walk from the bus stop. Read more + Show Less - Jetpark Hotel Rotorua 8.4 Very good Edward 14 July 2021 The whole experience was very relaxing from start to finish, would definitely recommend. I loved it, the hotel is tidy, has first class staff and location. Atmospheric venue, 0.5 miles from Rotorua Regional airport. The bathroom was luxurious & the bedroom was twin. Read more + Show Less - Silver Fern Rotorua Suites & Spa 8.4 Very good George 06 September 2020 Central setting of the hotel. Wasn't expecting to have a kitchenette. When we came, the owner met us and was friendly. Great stay, as always. Read more + Show Less - Capri On Fenton 9.0 Good Paul 24 March 2021 Appreciated staying at the standard family room. Only 20 min walk to downtown:))) Read more + Show Less - Ripple Rotorua 9.4 Excellent Gene 09 April 2021 We would stay here again on our next trip to Rotorua. No doubt, it' s a family-friendly hotel. Samuel's Uphill B&B | New Zealand - Auckland Tawa Place, 0931 Auckland, New Zealand (Lihat peta) ➤ Samuel's Uphill B&B | Auckland Featuring a garden, a bar, and a shared lounge, Samuel's Uphill B&B offers accommodation in Auckland with free WiFi and garden views. It is set 32 km from Auckland Harbour Bridge and provides a shared kitchen. The bed and breakfast features 2 bedrooms, a flat-screen TV, an equipped kitchen with a dishwasher and a microwave, a washing machine, and 1 bathroom with a shower. Guests at the bed and breakfast can enjoy a continental breakfast. A terrace is available for guests to use at Samuel's Uphill B&B. North Head Historic Reserve is 35 km from the accommodation, while Sky Tower is 35 km away. The nearest airport is Auckland, 61 km from Samuel's Uphill B&B, and the property offers a paid airport shuttle service. name: alrona.co.nz
homepage_content: Home - Skip to content Welcome to Alrona Pet Motel, a cat and dog boarding kennel, where the staff are compassionate, motivated and focused toward all pets in the facility. We have been in the business for 19 years. We take pride in the service we offer our guests with all pets receiving the same attention all day every day. Our primary goal, is as our Mission Statement , “we provide all animals with the highest level of care and attention, while maintaining, their health and mental balance”. Visit our checklist for questions to ask us prior to, or when you visit Alrona Pet Motel. A strict vaccination policy, provides safety and well-being for every boarding cat and dog. We provide Nutrience original dry food to our boarding cats and dogs. If your pet is not satisfied on this diet, we can offer alternatives, and we cater for those cats and dogs, who are slow eaters. Group play time is for social boarding dogs, where our groups are no larger than six dogs. This ensures each pet is monitored while playing outside. Individual one on one for those who prefer to spend time by themselves, is also included in our daily routine. Small and large dogs, are separated by size and temperament. We provide a day care service Monday, Wednesday, Thursday and Friday. This offers excitement and fun and enables social dogs to mingle. If your dog is not social, we can also cater to their requirements. Alrona Pet Motel, dog and cat boarding kennel, takes pride in the attention to detail provided by our staff, to our boarding cats and dogs. All cats and dogs, are provided with the thoughtfulness and sensitivity they deserve from a dog and cat boarding kennel. We welcome inspections of our premises, at a time that is convenient with all involved. How many differing stories have you heard about dominance in dogs, including the Alpaha and Who’s the Boss? A must read by Victoria Stilwell(It’s Me Or The Dog) – The Truth About Dominance. Check Availability. Static overlay ABOUT ALPACA MANOR Constructed in 2019 our purpose built lodge provides clean affordable accommodation in a tranquil setting just minutes from SH1 and 10 min from Albany Mega Centre. Specialising in groups we also cater to international travellers, domestic visitors and business travellers alike. We provide a fully equipped kitchen for those that like to self-cater and our on-site laundry means guests can relax while getting on top of those travelling chores. There's plenty of on-site parking in a seculded gated driveway, and free wifi means you can keep up to date with those work email or what's going on at home. Sleep easy Situated in a serene valley, our lodge is secluded from the hustle and bustle of city noise. Enjoy a great night's sleep, ensuring you start your day energized and ready to go! Sustainable We're committed to reducing our impact on the environment. We capture and hold up to 80,000 litres of rain water on site! We provide ec0-firendly bathroom amenities in pumps to reduce plastic waste and state of the art air pumps keep the temperature just right while minimising energy consumption. Local Attractions We might be in a secluded valley, but there's loads to do just minutes away. Local attractions include snow planet , Auckland Adventure Park, Albany Mega Centre, Orewa, Browns Bay, and loooads more! Check out our Things to do page . Onsite Secure Parking Free onsite parking in a gated driveway. Free Wifi Free Wifi means you can keep up to date with those emails, see what's going on at home or relax with your favourite device. Your hosts will welcome you with a basket of goodies and an espresso coffee, always welcomed after travelling a long distance. The vibrant cafe area and main shopping precinct are just blocks away. There are many scenic and wildlife attractions in Dunedin , and our friendly team are happy to point you in the right direction or to book any tours you wish. Accommodation Stylish and comfortable accommodation in Dunedin offering a range of rooms to suit everyone from the single business traveller to a large family. Enjoy a self-contained holiday by using the kitchen facilities in each room and take advantage of extras including free wifi and continental breakfasts. name: artstable.co.nz
homepage_content: The ArtStable | Bed Breakfast, Wellington, self contained, Boutique, motel, apartment Welcome Nau mai Haere mai The Art Stable combines quality, character and culture to create distinctive accommodation. A peaceful, art-filled retreat it’s your inner city sanctuary in the heart of the creative Cuba quarter in Wellington, the ‘coolest little capital’ in the world. A self-contained boutique apartment, the Art Stable is named for its location in a building that started life in the 1880s as a stable and until recently housed one of Wellington’s leading contemporary art galleries – Bartley & Company Art. The gallery has now closed and a luxury lingerie boutique occupies the ground floor. The owner Alison lives in the adjacent apartment. A born and bred Wellingtonian, she can provide advice on all the best places to see and eat as well as things to do. Just 500 metres from the city’s award winning waterfront, the Art Stable offers a warm retreat and easy walking access to everything the city has to offer – from inner city shopping and entertainment to harbour, beach and bush. What we offer Our location - just 30 metres off the vibrant Cuba Street-cafes, bars, restaurants and shops and 500 metres from the award winning waterfront – means you can just step out the front door and gate for easy access to everything the city has to offer from inner city entertainment and shopping to harbour, beach and bush. Coming home to rest, the Art Stable offers comfort and style with a rare inner city courtyard setting the building back from the street. The master bedroom with a superking bed is separate from the open-plan living, dining and kitchen above. A sofabed in the living room means the apartment can accommodate an extra person or two. A full kitchen, with light breakfast provisions, is available in case you want breakfast before going out. The owner Alison lives in the adjacent apartment. A born and bred Wellingtonian, she can provide advice on all the best places to see and eat as well as things to do. All you have to do is ask. Breakfast Complimentary first morning breakfast Bed Super-king bed complete with luxurious Egyptian cotton sheets and quality linen Windows Noise insulating double glazed windows Kitchen Fully equipped kitchen View A great inner city outlook onto one of the Wellington's most beautiful Edwardian buildings and Glover Park Wifi Unlimited free wifi Televison 32" Freeview high definition TV with Chromecast on the off-chance you want a quiet evening at home. If you subscribe to Netflix, Neon, Spark Sport or any streaming service you can cast onto the Art Stable TV Music Tivoli radio and stereo system to play any ipod or MP3 player Bathroom Bathroom with high pressure shower Board games and magazines Classic board games and a range of recent magazines just in case you feel like a quiet night in Washing Washing machine and drying rack Sundries Toiletries and hot water bottles with soft merino mink covers; basic pranty provisions Rates and Terms Standard rate $300 per night Additional guests $40 per person (maximum two) Payments Payment for The Art Stable can be via direct debit to our bank account with a 50% deposit and balance payable by arrival Check in is 3 pm, check out 11am. We are happy to accommodate your requirements so if you need to check in or out outside of these times, please contact us. We welcome business travellers. Our prices include 15% goods and services tax which New Zealand business travellers will be able claim back. Cancellation Policy Our policy is driven by the likelihood of us being able to rebook after your cancellation. Cancelling up to two weeks before your scheduled reservation date your deposit is fully refundable. Within two weeks of the booking commencing, half of the deposit will be refunded. Within seven days of your booking, your deposit will not be refunded. Reviews Alison is the perfect host and this place is the ultimate city stay. Right in the middle of everything yet private and quiet enough to sleep through the capital having New Years Eve! Highly recommended. Caroline Jane 2022 A fantastic place to stay! A beautiful sanctuary- right in the middle of the best that Wellington offers… Alison is a lovely host as well and has thought of everything to make our stay seamless. Highly recommended… Az Dec 2021 What an amazing stay! Alison is a wonderful host and the studio is setup for a perfect city weekend. The location couldn’t be more central with shopping, food, music and art at your doorstep. The studio has everything we needed and was super comfortable. The bed was delightfully comfy and the furnishings luxe! We already can’t wait to come back! Kat Nov 2021 "Top rate apartment accommodation in a very central location. Cosy and warm, we had a very comfortable stay. Nice to have a well stocked place with plenty of towels, toilet paper and key pantry items which make all the difference to a stay. Everything is on your doorstep here. Highly recommended." Mel June 2021 "A gem! Great location, very funky -it's an interesting place to stay, and we would happily stay again. We also loved how warm it was inside. The little touches were great (extra comfy bedding, dressing gowns, amazing art!)" Melissa May 2021 "Fantastic apartment, right in the centre of the city but also very secure with a locked gate, locked front door and locked apartment. Very stylish apartment with everything you need. Right next to shops bars and restaurants. Alison let us check in early so we could drop our bags off. Very hospitable." Nikky June 2021 ← → Contact Please contact us for availability and bookings Full name Email address Phone Enquiry Submit Phone: + 64 27 4436 123 Address: 56A Ghuznee Street, Wellington 6011

name: bayofislandsmotel.com
homepage_content: Bay of Islands - Travel Brokers Skip to the content Close Menu Thanksgiving was one heck of a vacation. I flew in late Tuesday night with my girlfriend and tons of luggage. We arrived at Albany International Airport at 7:08 PM, breezed through security and hopped in an Uber. We rode to Price Chopper on Route 9 in Latham, NY, where we grabbed some quick snacks. Then, we sat down at JJ Rafferty’s Bar and Grill to have a quick dinner. Right after, we rented a scooter to drive to my parent’s house. That was a mistake! It’s too cold to be riding that right now. I could barely feel my hands with the wind whipping by. We were making a lane change near 847 New Loudon Rd and some guy in a Camaro cut us off. I slammed on the brakes and we flipped off the scooter and rolled off the side of the road. As we were falling, my girlfriend hit her face on the handlebar and broke her tooth. We didn’t have any other injuries, but that one didn’t look good. She was in a lot of pain, so I started searching for an emergency dentist in Latham. That’s when I came across www.lathamdentalpros.com . They were the only dentist office that offered emergency dental services around the clock, so I called them right away. The head dentist was able to see us at their office within 15 minutes of my call. After a quick mouth inspection, he informed my girlfriend that she would have to have her tooth extracted and would need to use an oral prosthesis going forward. The process to remove it was quick, although it looked like it still hurt, even with Novocain injections. Luckily, we have good insurance. Our dental co-pay was only $100 for a procedure like this. The denture creation wasn’t something that could be done right away, so we came back on Saturday to discuss that. Overall, it was a very interesting Thanksgiving weekend. I feel lucky that Latham Dental Pros answered the phone on Tuesday night, and I don’t think I’ll be renting any more of those scooters any time soon. My job requires me to travel a lot, so I fly all over the world. Let me tell you what I saw when I was in New York City this past month. I boarded the airplane and flew straight here non-stop with just two small bags and the clothes I wore. When I arrived in New York, NY, I rented a car and drove it to my hotel. Shortly after unpacking, I took a shower, got dressed, and went downstairs to the lobby in order to determine where I wanted to go for dinner. NYC has many famous restaurants, so it was a tough decision. I chose to eat at a franchise restaurant instead, PF Chang’s, because my friend John works there. The meal was great, and after the restaurant closed for the night, my friend invited me to walk into the kitchen area to see the restaurant hood cleaning process. It appeared to be very tedious work. A company called Queens Hood Cleaning had 2 technicians pressure washing the vent hood and kitchen equipment with water and special chemicals to sanitize it. After that, they installed a grease trap. Apparently, a grease trap is a device that collects grease from cooking and catches it in a special compartment to prevent a clog in the drains or piping that connects to the sink. John said that the Queens Hood Cleaning Pros are one of, if not the best NYC grease trap installation companies because they remove all the grease effectively, always perform quality work, and their pricing is low. Whether their handling grease trap installation for a restaurant or scrubbing hoods, they are always timely and affordable. It was very cool to see this work being performed in front of me because I’ve never experienced anything like this before. If I didn’t already have a job, I’d consider this industry. Tags Grease Trap Cleaning , Grease Trap Installation , New York City , NYC , Restaurants , United States Have you ever chosen a hotel simply because of the amenities? Think about what you do prior to planning a trip. You have a general idea of the kind of experience you want; you might have a list in your head, or maybe you went so far as to write it down. Whatever that list may be, you’re not going to book that hotel for you and your significant other unless it meets those requirements. Believe it or not, swimming pools are one of the main amenities people simply must have. And, as a pool builder, it’s important to study the designs and construction from the best pool companies you can find so you’re always at the top of your game. The most impressively designed swimming pools I have ever seen are in Sarasota, Florida, so what better place to go and learn. My pool construction company is only 7 guys, so it was pretty easy to book a trip to Sarasota and hang out for a few days to tour the sites and see some well-designed residential and commercial pools. The first pool builder we met with was Sarasota Pool Builders, a local company with an impressive history of high quality construction in Florida. Their contractors have built thousands of swimming pools across the region, varying in size from small oval shaped ones to huge water-park pools. Their team met us at the airport and took us out to lunch first at Yoder’s Restaurant & Amish Village located at 3434 Bahia Vista St, Sarasota, FL 34239. After lunch, we felt like relaxing a bit, so we drove to the Marie Selby Botanical Gardens, which can be found at the following address: 811 S Palm Ave , Sarasota, FL 34236-7726. It was very cool because it had a huge variety of tropical plants, epiphytes, a koi pond, a rainforest, and a nice view of the bay; that part felt just like home! We stayed at the botanical garden for about 2 hours before deciding to start our swimming pool tour. Sarasota Pool Builders paid for a limo to drive us around to view their previous work. Our first stop was Judy Anders, a local resident with a home on S Jefferson Ave. Judy had a wide-open backyard and decided to have a figure-8 shaped pool built just beyond the patio. The amount of detail was crazy. The shape and design were absolutely flawless, with a set of stairs on the northwest corner of the pool and a ladder at the southwest corner. The pool liner was a combination of blue and teal with a shell pattern that repeated in 4 foot chunks. Outside the pool, their contractors had even installed custom lighting for added ambiance. We’ve never seen anything quite like it. After leaving Judy’s residence, we traveled to the Suncoast Technical College – Newtown Campus area in North Sarasota. Jamie Parsons, a long-time resident lived next to the school and graciously offered us a tour of her backyard. This residential monstrosity was nothing like the previous one we had seen. I swear to you – the pool must have been 75 feet long and 30 feet across. It started at 3 feet deep up top and went down to 13 feet in the deep-end. The coolest part about the pool was a luminous liner though. The sun was going down when we arrived, and we got to see the swimming pool glow in the dark. This whole trip was made possible by my friend and the owner at Sarasota Pool Builders, so we want to say thank you for allowing us the opportunity to visit. We learned a lot and hope to take some of the creativity and design work back with us to apply in our own business. Tags Florida , Pool Builders , Sarasota , Swimming Pool , United States Best Paihia Hotels in New Zealand New Zealand has got to be got to be one of the most overlooked travel destinations due to its surreal beauty. It’s such a nice-looking place that even movies like the Lord of the of Rings were even filmed in Zealand. The cities might not be the brightest or with the tallest buildings, but it has some of the most beautiful landscapes that you will ever see. If you’re flying from North America or Europe, your flight is going to be very long, so be prepared. Here are 5 of the best hotels you can stay at for a great price, all able to booked through Travelocity . Swiss Chalet Lodge Motel This location is nice due to its convenient placement. You’ll notice that there are some small islands that you can go to that are right next to this motel. On top of that, there are places where you can park your car. Unlike other parking spaces, these parking spaces have a lot of space, almost guaranteeing that you won’t bump into anyone or anyone won’t bump into you. The building design is beautiful. It has a sense of structure, while still being unforgettable to your experience. And it has a gorgeous swimming pool that was built last year. The interior of the rooms is just as beautiful. You have warm and fluffy beds that were clearly intended for just one person but could easily fit two people on there. You also have a decent chunk of space if you want to get work done, lounge in the couch chair, or eat with your friends. If eating outside is something that you would like to do, there is also a lot of space for that. In case there’s an emergency, there’s a lot of space in the hallways and a fire extinguisher. You should be able to get a great price if you order at the right time. Bed of Roses This hotel is in an area that is going to be a lot quieter than other places. It’s one of the best options for a hotel if you plan on renting a car for you time in Paihia. You’ll have a lot of space for you and whoever you’re traveling with to drive through. You’ll be able to ease into traffic because this area won’t be very busy at all. The plants are bright and vibrant, bringing in so much life and energy that will be reflective of whatever activities you’ll be doing on your trip. The inside of the place that you will be staying at is truly a spectacle to marvel at. The design that’s on the inside feels like an actual house. Instead of just being a bland room with boring sheets, there are pillows with designs, flowers set up across the room and even art in some of the main rooms. The tables are already set up for you when you want to have Breakfast or Dinner with your family and friends. They even have classic board games such as chess, which is sure to sharpen your mind and keep you entertained. Kingsgate Hotel Autolodge This hotel is one of the bigger ones that you’re going to be staying at in Paihia regardless of what your plans are. You should be pleased to find out that it’s one of the best places to stay due to what it offers every customer. The best time to go to New Zealand would usually be the summer. This works out for your benefit because there is a pool that you can stay in the pool with your friends in. There are a lot of opportunities to go to the beach but there are more things that can go wrong. The pool can be a great secondary option in case the beach gets shut down or it wasn’t the experience that you thought it would be. It’s a great place to be in if you plan on being there for multiple weeks. There’s a restaurant and bar in case you plan on staying there for a while. The food and drinks are great, and you should really give it a try even if you plan on trying other foods. Your rooms will also have air conditioning. It can get really hot outside when you’re in the middle of the summer. Having Air conditioning helps to makes things a lot more bearable. The Retreat This is one of the best prices for a hotel that you will ever receive in this area. It’s a bit smaller than the other options that you will have, but that likely means that you will have more privacy for you and whoever you decide to bring with you. The rooms may not have that much that stands out to impress you, but that also means that you have more opportunities to set it up for yourself. The views that you get are genuinely breathtaking. Generally, a hotel is not where people have memories, but there are some sights that you can only get in a hotel. The is a spa for you and other to stay at. These are great places because not only are they relaxing. The staff has seen a lot of positive feedback of all the things that they have done for their guests. It’s one of the cleanest hotels that you will go to. After spending all that time out, a lot of people will just want to relax and not have to worry about stress. This hotel does one of the best jobs at alleviating that stress. Sanctuary Palms Sanctuary Palms is one of the best hotels if budget isn’t an issue for you. For one, it has a golf course, which can be very expensive to maintain. On top of that Golf courses are location specific, which is why there aren’t golf courses in Alaska or Antarctica. This should immediately put it on your priorities list if you are a player and had the need to constantly practice. The service is very incredible, the staff are incredibly friendly and offer a lot of support to all of their guests. You should have no problems with the staff. On top of that there are kitchens in some of the rooms if you like to cook food. There are a lot of foods that belong to a specific area. Buying them at the store and then cooking them in your hotel is an experience in yourself. To many, food is just chemical energy and nutrition, but to others cooking is an art form and the hotel included a kitchen in some of the rooms to respect that. You get a luxurious experience that you just wouldn’t get with other hotels. I couldn’t decide which hotel to stay at, so I tried a different one every day of the week. Things to do in the Bay of Islands Costal Kayaking Kayaking is a great sport that encourages people to get into the water and lets them take a adventure. You get to take others with you so it’s not just yourself, you have those memories and experiences with others. That also means that if someone gets hurt, you will have someone to get help for you. In this specific case Kayaking in the Bay of Islands also lets you see some of the most beautiful sights that Paihia has to offer. You can even go in teams and compete against each other. You will have guides that teach you a lot about the area. It suitable for most ages. As long as the person can play a sport, they are more than capable for kayaking. The guides are also full of energy and very helpful. The people who have been on the guides were surprised how much knowledge they had on the area and said some of their best time was spend there. It can even give you a workout, if you’re someone who needs to constantly be in peak physical condition. Visit Tapeka Point Beach The beach can always be a lot of fun regardless of what location you are in. What separates most beaches is how many people are at the particular location as well as the things that you can do at the location. This is one of the beaches where there aren’t going to be that many people at the location. That just means that you and your friends will mostly have the beach for yourself. This works out great if you are planning on playing any games or taking any fancy photos. In fact, the lighting can be incredible, so you owe it to yourself to take a few photos when you get the chance. The views are also amazing. The sights are something that you can only see in Paihia. They showcase trees that you may never see again, really cementing it as an experience that truly sets it apart from the other places that you have visited. There are also some chairs if you and your significant other just want to relax together and just enjoy the sights of nature. The houses and hotels won’t be that far from the location so it’s a great option for everyone. Take the sea shuttle to the Bay of Islands The sea shuttle lets you see some great sights that you more than likely wouldn’t have seen otherwise. Some of the sights you may have seen in a photo if you went out of your way to see them, however, to get the full experience it is something that you need to see with your own two eyes. The staff are incredibly forgiving even if you happened to be a few minutes late, you can more than likely get there in time for the guide. The experience is a lot of fine and it will be one of the most fun experiences you have in New Zealand. The tour may take 2 and a half to 3 hours. It’s a great time and there are a lot of people that can go on the shuttle at once. When you go on this shuttle it allows you to feel like you are interacting with the adventure and these places are actually there for you to explore. It’s something that you allowed to be laid back in, not something that you have to prepare hours for. It’s a lot of fun for everyone, including the guide who is educating you about these locations, You are going to be more informed on these locations by the time you get off the shuttle. Check Out Action World Action World is one of the most fun places in New Zealand. There are tons of rides that people can get a kick out of. It serves as an amusement center for all kinds of people during the summer. To get the full experience, the best time to go is the summer because you will get to experience all of the rides. On top of that, some of the hotels are going to be close there. If you happen to be staying close to Action World, it is a experience that you need to go to when you visit Paihia. If you like water slides, this center has some of the longest water slides that you will ever ride. It’s almost like going to a state fair and seeing all the rides that you can have fun on. There are also a lot of mini games that you owe it to yourself to play. You should go to all of the rides, give them a chance, and have fun on your own. Waitangi golf course Golf can be one of the most relaxing sports regardless of your physique or experience. Regardless of who you are, golf is made to test your skill and not if you have a certain body type. You can compete with your friends to see who will win on the course. Part of what makes a golf course so enjoyable is going to those courses on a bright day with all of your equipment. Whether you’re traveling in a golf cart or just walking with your bag, those are what cement this sport as memorable. The options that you must use for clubs are almost endless. There are some genuinely breathtaking views that you should see at least once if you’re a golf player. It’s a course that the most casual of players can have fun with and a lot of work is put in maintaining this course. For golf, it is recommended that you play in the earlier hours of the morning, that’s not only when you’ll play the best, but is also when the outside will look the best. After a long trip in New Zealand, it’s time for a trip back to the United States. The US was my original home and I loved visiting New York, Florida, and some of the other areas where my friends still live. Tags New Zealand , Travel , Vacation

When considering accommodation in New Zealand tourist, emigrants and contract workers are faced with the dilemma of where to stay in Auckland. You will be overwhelmed with the sheer number of tourist attractions available in Auckland. Book flights to Auckland if you haven't done so yet and get ready to visit Auckland. READ MORE..... Holiday Homes You would want to look for holiday homes and reserving one is not as easy as you think. There are lots of holiday homes, where you can stay during the holidays, and having fund around the city. There are lots of holiday homes in different parts of the globe. READ MORE..... Moving To New Zealand From The United Kingdom Move to NZ; New Zealand is an island country in the south-western Pacific Ocean comprising two main landmasses that are North Island and the South Island and number of smaller islands. Aotearoa is the current Māori name for New Zealand, and is also used in New Zealand English. READ MORE..... Interesting Facts About New Zealand New Zealand is one of the most beautiful and unspoiled beauties left on the face of the earth. The country has become one of the most adventurous and top most destinations for people who love nature. There are some interesting facts about New Zealand which are not renowned but are intriguing. Here are some of the most interesting and weird facts about New Zealand. READ MORE..... New Zealand Vacation New Zealand is world famous for wowing tourists with stunning landscapes, varying climate and endless miles of unspoilt landscapes, which makes New Zealand one of the most sought after and desirable vacation destinations in the world by people of all ages and interests. New Zealand is an island country located in the Pacific Ocean, the country is made up of two large landmasses called the North Island and the South Island, each one is very different indeed. READ MORE..... Things To Do In New Zealand - North Island New Zealand’s North Island is the smaller of the two main islands; however, it holds approximately 76 percent of New Zealand’s population. The North Island is also the warmer of the two, with a temperate to subtropical climate. It boasts warm sandy beaches, rolling farmlands, forests and dormant volcanoes. Two of the country’s biggest cities are located on the North Island: Auckland, and the capital city of Wellington. READ MORE..... Visiting Auckland New Zealand If you want to visit the international gateway of NZ, visit Auckland on your New Zealand tours . Auckland is the commercial hub of New Zealand and is encircled by 48 dormant volcanoes. These include the spectacular Rangitoto Island that is situated at the center of the harbour. READ MORE..... name: bayviewpaihia.nz
homepage_content: Bayview Motel - Waterfront Motel Accommodation in Paihia Welcome to Paradise Waterfront Motel and Apartments in Paihia Book Now Waterfront Location 0 Minute walk from Paihia 0 Rooms WiFi Fibre Internet The Bayview Motel offers unobstructed views over Paihia Beach and the beautiful Bay of Islands. Situated on Paihia's central waterfront, your accommodation is only a 1-minute flat walk to the wharf, shops, cafés and amenities. Sit out on your private deck and take advantage of the spectacular views from our waterfront suites. At the Bayview Motel you have all your holiday needs at your doorstep, with the added advantage of a fantastic waterfront location at reasonable prices. The many exciting activities offered in the Bay of Islands are easily accessible from your accommodation. Try cruising on the bay, swimming with dolphins or sailing in a tall ship. Or get your adrenalin flowing with fast boat trips to the Hole in the Rock, parasailing or a visit to the nearby Adventure Park. The Waitangi Treaty Grounds, historic Russell or bus tours to Cape Reinga and Ninety Mile Beach are all great day trips. The motel accommodation at the Bayview Motel consists of 11 self-contained waterfront apartments and family units (sleeping 2-7). All rooms are serviced daily and have full kitchens, WiFi, Sky TV and queen-size beds. Book Online Make a Booking

Many diving enthusiasts stay with us to explore the ocean floor at the famous Poor Knights Islands or the wrecks. name: braaihut.com
homepage_content: Peri Peri Chicken | Braaihut | New Zealand top of page Download Menu 00794210392417941322 Order Online The Love of Braai South African . Flame Grilled Peri Peri Restaurant . •It's Lekker Man• Braai Read More Here > Braai's are places of great social events of casualness, of friends and families, of lovers, of professionals, of young and old, meeting and relaxing over great food cooked on the braai. Braaihut continues this great tradition for you and let's you enjoy your precious time. The Braai was born in South Africa, a place of rich cultural heritage, translated it means "Grill" but it is far, far more than that. It has been adopted in countries throughout Africa, spreading around the world with people of very diverse ethnic backgrounds and languages, it is the nature of simply great food, it is the BRAAI. Every DAY is a BRAAiHUT Day! Any reason will do, any day or time will suffice, any celebration whether it is big or small, any occasion, be it a few people or the whole country. Peri Peri, The Birds Eye Chilli Braaihut has the famous African ingredient called periperi which imparts a flavour like no other, it is the taste of life and gives Braaihut food it's great flavour. bottom of page

name: bluffhilllighthouse.co.nz
homepage_content: Bluff Hill Lighthouse B&B unique & historic accomodation The Self-Contained Flat/Apartment You are booking a Self-Contained Apartment that provides stunning views from the fully functioning kitchen, the lounge and the deck that overlook all of Hawke’s Bay and the Port. The funky self-contained apartment features a separate entrance and an "open plan" layout with a kitchen and lounge area. There is a main bedroom with a queen bed also a second bedroom for children if required. The accommodation is clean and comfortable with free Wi-Fi and stunning views. A continental breakfast is included in the tariff of the accommodation. The Bluff Hill Lighthouse B&B offers you Self-Contained Bed and Breakfast Accommodation Located 400 meter from the Bluff Hill Lookout and Sturms Gully right on your front door Approx. 10 minute walk to Napier City, restaurants, cafes, banks and boutique shops Off Road parking Private separate guests entrance/parking Free high speed Wi-Fi as well as the use of the apartments guest/visitor iMac computer Bottomless Teas and Coffees Historic & Unique Accomodation Positioned only a few meters away from the Port Of Napier with stunning panoramic port, sea & mountain views the Bluff Hill Lighthouse B&B is the perfect destination for an unforgettable family weekend away or even just a quick overnight stay when one needs two rooms. Soak up the peace and relaxing tranquillity this stunning historic building and location has to offer.

We are centrally located, close to the bus station and the Matamata Information Centre, the booking agent for Hobbiton Movie Tours. We are very willing to meet you with our courtesy car OR If you are travelling by bike we offer a secure lockup garage. READ MORE Facilities Broadway Motel and Miro Court Villas are set in relaxing park-like grounds, with a wide range of facilities that we encourage you to enjoy. We cater for all age groups and endeavour to make your stay as pleasant and stress-free as possible. READ MORE Local Attractions Matamata has a range of local attractions that can be enjoyed by all, from the Hobbiton movie set through to bush walks and tramps. READ MORE "Thankyou Diann and Tony for your assistance once again. We appreciate that only given short notice you were able to offer your hospitality to our family (6 of us plus our new grand daughter). This has been our 6th trip to Matamata in the last 2 years and your facilities help make it a home away from home. Apart from returning to visit family we find Broadway Motel so central to both town and for day trips in the Waikato and beyond. Thankyou for looking after us again and we will see you soon on our next trip." Sue & Rick Smailes Perth. W.A. "Booked here as google reviews rated it the best and it absolutely was. Room was modern clean fresh and spacious. Very warm and comfortable. Facilities were excellent and spotless. Especially enjoyed the hot spa after doing the Wairere Falls Track (which I recommend) the kids enjoyed the pool and the playground. Perfect place for a family. Had everything you need from toiletries to coffee and tea. Great location not far from Hobbiton or Wairere Falls. Owners were friendly and welcoming. Thoroughly enjoyed our time here will def be back." Pun Uniamat NZ "We originally planned to stay only 1 night, as part of a visit to Hobbiton, but after seeing the room, the kids begged to stay 2 nights, and that was no problem with us. What a great motel. Everything was perfect, from a great sized, modern room, to a super pool and even being able to dry the clothes on the clothesline. Matamata is a very nice town, and this motel is within walking distance to the stores/cafes on main street. We had a very relaxing stay and wouldn't hesitate to recommend this motel to our friends." Trip Advisor Review Calgary View More Testimonials

homepage_content: Cafe Lokum | Petone | ORDER ONLINE | Takeaway | TuckerFox NZ Welcome to Cafe Lokum PRE ORDER ONLINE Welcome to Cafe Lokum Order Online from Cafe Lokum Turkish Cuisine * 184 Jackson St Petone, Lower Hutt 5012 * Online Menu * Takeaway * Secure Online Payments * TOP SELLERS Chicken Doner $18.50 Mixed Doner Lamb and chicken $18.50 TOP SELLERS Chicken Doner $18.50 Mixed Doner Lamb and chicken $18.50 Menus PRE ORDER ONLINE Online Operating Hours Pickup Thursday Closed 11:30am to 8pm Friday Closed 11:30am to 8pm Saturday Closed 11:30am to 8pm Sunday Closed 11:30am to 8pm Monday Closed Closed Tuesday Closed 11:30am to 8pm Wednesday Closed 11:30am to 8pm REVIEWS We used to live on Jackson Street, and would regularly dine here, it is easily some of the best Turkish in Wellington. Since we have moved cities we’ve made it a tradition to ensure we always grab a meal here every visit, it’s that good. The staff are so lovely, and the food is epic. If you’re in town, and craving Turkish, this is the place. J C (Jonts) We just passed the cafe and was intrigue about Turkish cousine. Did not dissappoint. The place is cozy and quiet. Definitely the food tastes good and has big portions. NO gamey taste for the lamb👍🏻 Dina D explorer I've been to a lot of kebab places around Lower Hutt, and this place beats them all. Great price kebabs, generous portions, and they are juicy without getting soggy. The meat was grilled well, with good sized pieces and lots of crispy bits, and the kebab was wrapped so that you don't have to fight the tinfoil away before you can eat it. I also had the baklava, which at $8 is on the pricier side, but it was a good portion with plenty of syrup nuts and crunchy pastry. Today was my 3rd time here, and it will be my go-to kebab shop from now on. Alex Karl Food was delicious and hot. Took a wee while to get our food but was worth the wait. Service was great. The staff were really friendly Taryn Holmes When we passed the shop, the food smell was amazing, so we wanted to try! Today was my first visit and it was amazing! Reasonable price with decent amount of food! Kebab was massive and I really satisfied with my menu. It was my first time to eat Iskender Staff was very friendly 😁 안녕하세요~ Definitely come back soon! Our quiet, central location, is just 250 meters to the town center where you will find great shopping and a wide range of excellent cafes and restaurants and bars. A short stroll to the Lakefront, crystal clear waters of Lake Taupo in New Zealand's central North Island makes Chantilly's Motor Lodge the perfect location for business, family, holidays, meetings and conferences. Chantilly's Motor Lodge Motel at Lake Taupo offers quality self-contained spacious motel apartment with studio rooms, 1 and 2 bedroom motel apartments and a honeymoon suite – all with lake or mountains views. Free parking on and off the street and Free Broadband ADSL, wireless, makes keeping in touch with business or family easy. Your friendly Kiwi hosts at Chantilly's, Deborah and Bruce, look forward to welcoming you to the motel and invite you to make contact if you have any questions or special requirements. Accommodation in Chantillys Motor Lodge With 32 rooms on two levels, Chantilly’s Motor Lodge Lake Taupo offer a range of enticing accommodation choices; Studio, Spa Suites, One and Two Bedroom Suites. All rooms are serviced daily and provide a number of personalised extras to make you feel that much more comfortable. Stylish décor, inviting living areas, spacious bathrooms, new furniture and modern kitchens work together to create an appealing, quality accommodation in Taupo. A Professional Review of Chantilly's Motel Taupo I will provide an in-depth review of the lodge to help you make an informed decision before booking your stay. Let's take a closer look at Chantilly's Motor Lodge. Chantilly's Motor Lodge boasts a prime location near Chantilly's top attractions and offers guests with clean and comfortable guest rooms. Upon arrival, I was impressed with the warm welcome provided by the friendly staff. The lobby is spacious and well-lit with ample seating areas for guests to relax or wait for their ride. The front desk was staffed by friendly and professional personnel who provided their first-rate service throughout my stay. The guest rooms at Chantilly's Motor Lodge are spacious and well-equipped with amenities to ensure a comfortable stay. The rooms feature comfortable beds, a mini-fridge, and a television with cable channels. The bathroom was sparkling clean and had lots of toiletry essentials. The air conditioning system works flawlessly, ensuring a comfortable sleeping environment. The rooms were also fully serviced every day with fresh towels and toiletries replenished after every clean up. The amenities at Chantilly's Motor Lodge are top-notch. There is a well-maintained outdoor pool that offers guests a chance to relax and unwind in the hot summer months. The pool area is clean and well-maintained, offering plenty of seating areas and lounge chairs to soak up the sun. Additionally, the lodge provides a complimentary continental breakfast every morning, featuring continental staples like toast, juices, coffee, cereals, and pastries. From our crispy fish and chips to gourmet burgers and meal to share, there’s something to delight every palate. Not forgetting gluten free Mondays! Dive in and discover your new favorite dish, made with love and the finest ingredients. Enjoy! Please note for online orders: We do not deliver. Pick-up only, thank you! Order Online About Calypso was my go-to after school for hot chips and tartare sauce. When I bought Calypso Takeaways in March 2023, I was thrilled to take the helm of such an iconic spot. Growing up in Kerikeri in the late ’90s, Calypso was my go-to after school for hot chips and tartare sauce. By then, it was already a beloved local haunt with a great reputation, having served the community for 20 years. Read more Find us at Calypso - Kerikeri's tastiest secret. We’re conveniently located in central Kerikeri, up the hill from the world-famous Stone Store – because after marveling at historic rocks, you’ll need to feed your modern hunger. Whether you’re a local legend or a hungry explorer, swing by Calypso for a taste of Kerikeri’s finest – where every bite is catch of the day! name: blacksheepretreat.com
homepage_content: Shepherding New Beginnings – Accomodation Skip to content Shepherding New Beginnings Interactive Accommodation + Events showcasing various resources + services that help guests traverse valley seasons + move toward building momentum for achieving big life goals. Scroll down to content Black Sheep Retreat is a haven for respite + rejuvenation for individuals, couples, friends + families. A safe + relaxing space to heal from difficult life experiences. A place to grow + transform. To create a whole new life for you. The Founder Founder of Black Sheep Retreat and Passageway Guide , Samantha Jane emerged from a disruptive family environment at the age of 15. She shares how “a lot of people show up destructively in relationships if they don’t know how to first love themselves .” She adds “I had been told that I was a mistake from an early age. And I believed it up until I was 33… I now believe that we all come into this world with unique purpose . It is up to us to take the journey of self discovery to find our gifts, and use them to create the life we have always dreamed of.” Sam spent over 4 years travelling through over 20 countries to explore a variety of human interactions from many cultures and religions all over the world. Her deep search for doorways of opportunity and enriching connections revealed the Passageway Navigation Skillset she has acquired. One of Sam’s reasons for travelling such distances was to run away from a world of past pain. She found herself, finding her true self . And the truth is, unreconciled and unresolved hurt can only compound. Which is why building a retreat is the next step in her life-long journey. Fulfilling a life OF purpose, ON purpose, for others to find THEIR purpose. Sam’s interactive retreats provide a haven of rejuvenation and purpose discovery. Our Mission Sam has decided to dedicate her life to supporting her guests to navigate through new doorways and passageways to reconcile past hurts, trauma and present life challenges. Black Sheep Retreat is a safe and encouraging interactive space that cultivates enriching relationships. Dedicated to those seeking uplifting, soul enriching, abundant experiences where it’s possible to explore your own happiness, purpose and contentment. Discover the 8 skillsets of passageway navigation. These areas will be explored during our workshops and will be available within our interactive accommodation as well as in downloadable formats. Completing seasons – accepting endings Walking away – recognizing dead-ends Opening doors to opportunity – new beginnings Closing doors – breaking free from things that do not align Choosing new doors – using your discernment Door Knocking – making valuable requests Walking across the threshold – entering new seasons Finding the narrow path – walking in our truth Speaking from the heart – finding your voice If you’d like to be added to our mailing list for regular updates on promotions and events, please click here . We aspire to lead you out of dry desert wastelands, through lush pastures and towards bright new beginnings in your life and in your relationships. Our Services Reconciling and navigating the challenges of our lives is a myriad of decisions, from the monumental to the mundane. Being heard in a safe space allows you to express the details around the situation you are exploring with the support of compassionate listening. Sam stands beside you and supports you to trust your own truth to find your unique way forward on your path to purpose, success, contentment and happiness . Call today for more information or to book any of the following services: 1 to 1 sessions 1 Full day visit 1 Night Stay 1 Weekend Stay 1 Week Stay More information can be seen on the services page. We endeavour to be a light on the hill that offers you passageways to move through what has been, what is, and what is to come. Opening you up to bright new beginnings in life and your relationships . The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step. – Lao Tzu This website is currently under construction…. Visit https://blacksheepretreat.wordpress.com/ for previous content. Find us grazing in other online pastures below AirBnB Facebook Instagram
