name: temahiavillage.co.nz
homepage_content: Home Home Welcome to Te Mahia Community Village. Te Mahia Community Village is an emergency accommodation and transitional housing village located in Conifer Grove, Auckland. Accommodation Our cabins fall under two categories - 'Emergency Accommodation' and 'Transitional Housing.' Emergency Accommodation We provide cabins which are for short-stay emergency accommodation of 7 days at a time. Some cabins come fully furnished, but all cabins are self-contained with a kitchenette and bathroom (shower, toilet, and vanity). A chattel list for fully furnished cabins is available here . Transitional Housing These cabins are for medium term stays and are for stays of 12 weeks at a time. Depending on your circumstances, you may be eligible for emergency or transitional accommodation. Power and water are included in the cost of accommodation. All those who stay in the Village have access to our communal facilities. You are here: Home

name: thejetty.co.nz
homepage_content: The Jetty : Great Barrier Island General Info Accommodation The Cottage The Chalets Contact Us Kaiarara Bay Great Barrier Island General Info The Jetty is located approximately 2 kilometers from Port Fitzroy, overlooking Kiaaraara Bay. Vehicle access from Kaiaaraara Bay Rd on sealed driveway to parking area. Grass driveway gives access to all tide jetty & beach inviting swimming, fishing and boating amongst other activities. Moorings are available on request. There is a general store & liquor outlet at Port Fitzroy. Accomodation Rates Low Season from $160 per night per couple. High Season $180 per night per couple. Children under 5 years old free. Discounts for group bookings. Getting here Daily flights from Auckland & North Shore. Fullers ferries (in season) Sealink Ferries (Runs weekly, can ferry your car) Transfers available from airports (Claris and Okiwi) Car rentals available (Booking essential in season)

name: thesquarerestaurant.co.nz
homepage_content: The Square Restaurant & Bar 0 Our Story Welcome to The Square, where dining takes place amidst the timeless beauty of Cathedral Square. Nestled in the heart of the city, our restaurant offers sweeping views of the historical landmark, providing a picturesque backdrop to your culinary experience. With a menu meticulously crafted from 100% local ingredients, each dish is a masterpiece that pays homage to the region's rich gastronomic heritage. Whether you're planning an intimate soirée or a lavish gathering, our classic Kiwi hospitality and captivating vistas ensure an unforgettable dining experience. Join us at The Square as you indulge in fresh and seasonal dishes, all while basking in the splendor of Cathedral Square. Book your table now

name: therabbithole.co.nz
homepage_content: The Rabbithole - Rabbithole Accommodation Upper Hutt Home "Me time" retreats Goal setting and vision boarding CTRL-ALT-DEL Feel good any day Down the Rabbithole Get it done Your health, your wealth Relationship reset Contact Menu Home "Me time" retreats Goal setting and vision boarding CTRL-ALT-DEL Feel good any day Down the Rabbithole Get it done Your health, your wealth Relationship reset Contact Welcome to the Rabbithole... At the Rabbithole you'll find the better world your heart knows is possible. Come and stay in one of our accommodation options or book your personalized getaway retreat! Dreamed of staying in a treehouse as a child? Keen to get away from the city? LOVE a 'wild and wonderful' lifestyle? -- Come and stay with us!! We offer a range of accommodation and personalized retreat options for short and mid-term stays. What is your flavour of accommodation? The treehut (yes, it's warm!) At only 4 sqm the treehut is our 'nest in the tree'. Perfect for an overnight adventure or short getaway. Wake up to bird song and the sound of the wind in the treetops around you and indulge those childhood fantasies. BRAND NEW DECEMBER 2024: Guests now have access to a separate guest-only lounge, bathroom and kitchenette, providing additional space to relax and enjoy. You can now also book up to 2 additional guests (to stay in the main house guest area) - come as a family and have the kids sleep in the treehouse while you enjoy the comfort of the ensuite bathroom! The Treehut - book now Wild and wonderful guest house (self contained) Get a taste of art and simple luxury in our newly renovated guest house. Suitable for up to 6 guests it's a perfect base from where to explore nearby Wairarapa, Kapiti and Wellington areas and coming home to river swims. Wild and wonderful guest house - Book now Come and be part of the Rabbithole experience - whether you're seeking simple serenity and privacy - or want to join us for animated conversations, music or games in the lounge - you are welcome!! And while you're there - why not upgrade your stay and make it a structured retreat? Whether you're feeling stuck in the Matrix or whether it's time to grow (or shrink!) - follow the white rabbit and check out our 3 and 5 day immersive programs. ​ Book now so you don't miss out!! Our mission is to provide a memorable dining experience with traditional Indian cooking using the freshest ingredients. Enjoy watching your meal come to life in our open kitchen. Whether you crave curry, biryani, or tandoori dishes, we promise an unforgettable culinary journey. Thank you for choosing Star of India. We look forward to serving you. Pete Sharpe 7 months ago Really good takeaway only food, at very reasonable prices. Good quantity and full of flavor. Currys have a good amount of meat as well...not just sauce and rice, like some others. Staff are friendly and helpful. Can order online or at the shop. ... name: thecanyonslodge.com
homepage_content: The Canyons B&B Queenstown The Canyons Country Lodge Book Now Rates / Availability Exclusive boutique accommodation and superb venue in stunning Queenstown location Home The Canyons B&B The Canyons B&B Venue Hire Accommodation Deluxe Room Superior Rooms Weddings Activities Sightseeing Tours Hunting and Fishing Skiing & Snowboarding Golf Tours Gallery General Weddings 1 Weddings 2 Suppliers Canyons B&B movie Specials Lodge Features Set amidst majestic mountains on sweeping lawns overlooking the Shotover River Canyons with Coronet Peak in the background, The Canyons B&B offers guests a fantastic lodge in Queenstown. We are only 4 kilometers from Queenstown's abundance of cafes, restaurants and shops allowing you to be close to the action, while still being in country and serene surroundings. Accommodation B&B Accommodation : We have two Superior Double Rooms and a Delux Chalet Room. Each room has alpine views and French style doors that open onto private patios. All rooms offer queen beds, tiled ensuites which feature a slipper bath, quality linen, bathrobes, toiletries, TV, wireless internet and access to tea/coffee making facilities. B&B guests do not have access to the main house or kitchen. Holiday Home Hire: When hiring the property as a holiday home the entire lodge is available for use. Weddings Take your wedding vows against the magnificent backdrop of mountains and the Shotover River Canyons. Dine and entertain guests on the expansive deck and lawns, with its designated marquee site. Create your own setting and continue into the night. Or choose a Romantic Escape Wedding. Specials Enjoy great value add-ons with our unique specials for your wedding , event or even if you just need some time away together. Specials are available during various seasons. The Lodge is available as a Self Catered Holiday Home accommodating up to 8 Adults - the perfect base for your Queenstown ski holiday. homepage_content: The Willows Wanaka | The Willows Wanaka WELCOME TO THE WILLOWS WANAKA Arrival Arrival calendar Departure Departure calendar Guests Guests calendar Book Now Our rooms Triple bedroom Apartment - Mountain view This spacious three-bedroom apartments with great mountain views features a Queen bed, two Long Single beds and an extra Queen bed with ensuite and separate living area. It also features free Wi-Fi, smart TV, a heat-pump and air conditioning, a dishwasher, oven, and on-site parking. A washer/dryer is situated in the kitchen. All linen including towels are provided. Learn More Double bedroom Apartment - Mountain view This spacious two-bedroom apartments with great mountain views features a Queen bed and two Long Single beds. It also features free Wi-Fi, smart TV, a heat-pump and air conditioning, a dishwasher, oven, and on-site parking. A washer/dryer is situated in the kitchen. All linen including towels are provided. Learn More Triple bedroom Apartment - Garden view This spacious three-bedroom apartments features a Queen bed, two Long Single beds and an extra Queen bed with ensuite and separate living area. It also features free Wi-Fi, smart TV, a heat-pump and air conditioning, a dishwasher, oven, and on-site parking. A washer/dryer is situated in the kitchen. All linen including towels are provided. Learn More Double bedroom Apartment - Garden view This spacious two-bedroom apartments features a Queen bed and two King Single beds. It also features free Wi-Fi, smart TV, a heat-pump and air conditioning, a dishwasher, oven, and on-site parking. A washer/dryer is situated in the kitchen. All linen including towels are provided. Learn More Triple Bedroom House with private garden Adjoining The Willows Apartments, the newly renovated 3 bedroom Willows House is a warm and sunny home equipped with all the modern comforts. The master bedroom features a King bed and private ensuite. The second bedroom has a Queen bed and 2 single beds (bunk), and the third bedroom a Queen bed. The main bathroom has separate bath and shower and the kitchen is fully equipped with modern appliances plus an adjoining laundry with washer and dryer. The Willows House also features a BBQ and outdoor seating area plus an indoor fireplace, all in the heart of Wanaka town. Learn More Double Bedroom House with private garden Adjoining The Willows Apartments, the newly renovated 2 bedroom Willows House is a warm and sunny home equipped with all the modern comforts.The first bedroom has a Queen bed and 2 single beds (bunk), and the second bedroom a Queen bed. The bathroom has separate bath and shower and the kitchen is fully equipped with modern appliances plus an adjoining laundry with washer and dryer. The Willows House also features a BBQ and outdoor seating area plus an indoor fireplace, all in the heart of Wanaka town. Learn More Previous Next About The Willows Wanaka Enjoy an authentic Wanaka experience in our newly renovated, fully contained holiday apartments right in the heart of town. Contemporary and comfortable home-away-from-home and centrally located in Upton Street so you can walk to Wanakaâs shops, restaurants, bars â and of course, the lakefront! Renovated in December 2018, our apartments have brand new interiors whilst still retaining their classic Wanaka holiday charm. Warm and cosy after skiing or hiking, and cool and breezy in summer, The Willows Wanaka Apartments are situated on a large 2000 square metre block in the middle of town with spectacular mountain views. The main shopping streets of Wanaka are a 1 minute walk away, and the lake only a few extra minutes. Our sunny apartments are equipped with all the modern comforts you need for the perfect holiday, including new kitchens for those keen to cook at home. Suitable for couples, families and groups of up to 6 per apartment, the complex sleeps 30 people in total. Adjoining The Willows Apartments, the newly renovated 3 bedroom Willows House is a warm and sunny home equipped with all the modern comforts you need. The master bedroom features a King bed and private ensuite. The second bedroom has a Queen bed and 2 single beds (bunk), and the third bedroom has a Queen bed. The main bathroom has separate bath and shower and the kitchen is fully equipped with modern appliances plus an adjoining laundry with washer and dryer. The Willows House also features a BBQ and outdoor seating area plus an indoor fireplace, all in the heart of Wanaka town. name: valmaihouse.co.nz
homepage_content: Cambridge Accommodation Menu About Us Valmai Villa Motel Units Book Now Contact Us Gallery Welcome to Valmai House & Motel Cambridge Book Now Valmai House is a Grand Heritage Villa built in 1901 of solid NZ Kauri timber and is situated in the heart of Cambridge, New Zealand. Valmai House Villa can accommodate a total of 18 guests including couples or a total of 14 guests if single occupancy per room is required with a mixture of ensuite rooms and rooms with shared bathroom facilities. The four self contained motel units which sit along side the Villa and sleep another 16 people, so we can accommodate a total of 34 people in our complex at any one time so we can accommodate large groups. Handy to all Cambridge venues including Grass Roots Velodrome, St Peters, Cambridge Racecourse, Hobbiton,Waitomo Caves, Cambridge Town Hall, Lake Karapiro, Don Rowlands Centre, Mystery Creek and The Red Barn Wedding Venue. © Copyright Valmai House Cambridge - Site map Phone: 07 8270237 Cambridge New Zealand Website Builder - Website World

name: thecastle.co.nz
homepage_content: The Castle Pamela Tirau - New Zealands largest collection of dolls, toys and teddy bears. Introduction Location Pam and Kelvin Photo Gallery Tirau attractions Education Contact us Welcome to thecastle.co.nz A great view of the Castle Located in the beautiful town of Tirau, The Castle combines the atmosphere of a traditional castle with the marvel of one of New Zealands largest collections of dolls toys and teddy bears. Relive your child hood; experience the wonder of over a hundred years of childhood delights housed in an awesome building. If you can imagine it, then you have already under estimated it! Open seven days a week (9:30am till 4:30pm) and situated two hours from Auckland on route to Rotorua or Taupo. The Castle Provides tourists with a quiet place to stop and enjoy the splendor of the countryside. Guests can enjoy a bite to eat from the tea rooms and then spend time exploring New Zealand's largest toy, train and doll museum. Visitors to The Castle will enjoy some of the most creative displays ever, as Pam and Kelvin Baker show just what 18 years experience in doll expo's and production's can do.

name: thewaters.co.nz
homepage_content: WATERS – Luxury B&B Suites KIA ORA Welcome to A unique Destination Book your stay with a pristine beachfront setting We welcome you to the Waters at the edge of our olive grove, just meters from the beach, and perfectly located to explore Nelson to the East, Abel Tasman and Kahurangi National Parks to the North, and the Vineyards of the Moutere to the West. Location The Waters is a luxurious boutique Bed & Breakfast dramatically set above the turquoise Tasman Bay in the heart of the Nelson Wine region on the South Island of New Zealand. This region and especially the Kina Peninsula where The Waters is located, is lucky to receive on average the most sunshine hours of the South Island and is called the ‚Provence of the Southern Hemisphere’. Vineyards and olive groves like the one at The Waters are conveying a mediterranean feeling. The Suites are slightly elevated and only a few meters from the beach, which guarantees fantastic views of the Abel Tasman National Park – easily accessed for hiking or more adventurous trips. Boutique Suites ARIA* ORIWA MOANA TAHUNA The three Suites ARIA*, ORIWA and MOANA Each of our three 40m2 Suites feature the same level of comfort and furnishings. Entertainment is top notch too, with a flat-screen TV and DVD, as well as an MP3 player system. Super King sized beds ensure your nights sleep is deep and restful. Double glazed windows and well insulated walls ensure your privacy and warmth. Two terraces, one with beautiful sea view and one facing Mount Arthur Mountain Range, cantilevered over a pond, are appointed with a table and two chairs each. *Disabled accessible The Suite TAHUNA is the one offering both, a bathtub and a shower. The view towards Abel Tasman National Park is just amazing. Airconditioning & Reverse Heating in all Suites, bathrobes & all natural toiletries supplied. Our Suites have been individually decorated and have their own style and charm. We have added lots of luxurious extras to make our guests feel at home and ensure they enjoy their stay. More information ⟶ AUMOANA Beach Bach Your small celebrations venue or day use playroom at the beach More information ⟶ The Beach Bach Wheter if you plan a romantic day, a family BBQ at the beach, an intimate wedding or anniversary celebration - this is the place to be! For a minute there I lost myself... AUMOANA Your Personal Service We make your stay unique With a manager’s residence on-site, you’re never far from a friendly helpful “KIWI” face. We are happy to recommend tours, excursions, suggest itineraries, and generally share our local knowledge. Customized Adventures Inquire about customized tours, pick-up service and a private boat tour with your host. We can cook for you delicious local fare - please book ahead of time. Darren, USA      Tripadvisor "Rob and his daughter Luna were the nicest hosts. We met his youngest daughter Willow and their puppy as well. Luna brought us a breakfast plate each evening that was delicious. Fresh eggs, juice, bread and cheeses. Local beer in the refrigerator when we returned from the day’s adventures. Very special people indeed. The views from our unit were incredible. The Tasman Sea to the east and a beautiful pond out our bedroom balcony. Top notch B&B Highly recommend. Great way to end our kiwi journey." Nikki, NZ      Tripadvisor "The Waters" was a perfect getaway retreat for a weekend away. Very private, clean, modern and self contained apartment in a great location to explore beautiful Nelson! The homemade breakfast was delicious with lovely fresh local produce. We definately plan to return one day! Savage      Tripadvisor A fantastic place to stay, a great place to relax. The hosts were great. We saw dolphins in the ocean right outside our room, which was very special. We can only recommend it. Cookie-Zustimmung verwalten The safety of your data is important to us. name: yamatojapaneserestaurantrotorua.com
homepage_content: Home | Yamato Japanese Restaurant top of page Tucked away in the heart of Rotorua, Yamato delivers an authentic taste of Japan with remarkable precision. The focus here is firmly on quality ingredients and traditional techniques: sushi is delicately crafted, sashimi boasts impeccable freshness, and seasonal dishes highlight our chefs' deep respect for Japanese culinary tradition. Service is attentive yet unobtrusive, creating a serene and intimate dining experience. Yamato’s commitment to purity and balance makes it a rewarding stop for lovers of classic Japanese cuisine. name: waikiwitavern.co.nz
homepage_content: Waikiwi Tavern – Invercargill’s real Kiwi Pub! about us Welcome to Waikiwi Tavern – your go-to kiwi pub for a fantastic time and mouthwatering eats! Our extensive menu is jam-packed with crowd pleasers, from the irresistible Open Steak Sandwich to the classic Bangers & Mash and the much-loved Chicken Parmi – there’s something to satisfy every craving. But the fun doesn’t stop there – we’ve got a wide selection of drinks to choose from and always something happening. Join us for a round of Jingo (musical bingo) during the week. Catch your favourite sports or races on our multiple TVs and make the most of our convenient self-service TAB facilities. We’ve got plenty of parking available, but if you’d rather not worry about the drive home, our courtesy coach service has got you covered – ensuring you reach your doorstep safely. For an authentic Kiwi Pub experience swing by the Waikiwi Tavern. We can’t wait to welcome you! GET IN TOUCH Cnr Gimblett Street & North Road, Waikiwi, Invercargill P 03 215 9080 HOURS Open 7 days 10am – late

The air-conditioned bed and breakfast consists of 1 separate bedroom, 1 bathroom with bathrobes, a seating area, and a living room. A private entrance leads guests into the bed and breakfast, where they can enjoy some wine or champagne and fruits. This bed and breakfast is allergy-free and non-smoking. The area is popular for hiking and pub crawls, and free use of bicycles is available at the bed and breakfast. Guests at 340 deg Alps & Sea can enjoy skiing and cycling nearby, or make the most of the sun terrace. Hagley Park is 13 km from the accommodation, while Christchurch Railway Station is 14 km away. The nearest airport is Christchurch International Airport, 21 km from 340 deg Alps & Sea. name: topor.co.nz
homepage_content: Topor Restaurant – Toporsown Are You Over 18? This Website requires you to be 18 years or older to enter. Yes I am No I am not Topor Awards Wellington's favourite Polish restaurant! We can match vodka to compliment your dishes, with an extended list of Polish vodkas, as well as imported Polish, Russian, Czech, Dutch and Italian beers. Check out our features board every week for new Polish and Kiwi specials. We can tailor a menu for your needs if you call ahead with any special requirements! Look forward to seeing you soon. At Topor Bistro we know good food and great wine are best served with a large helping of atmosphere, which is why you won’t soon forget your evening at New Zealand’s only Polish restaurant. We specialise in making your night unforgettable, so come in and find out why Topor Bistro is the first restaurant Wellington calls when they want to a perfect night out.Our chef serves up only the best and freshest modern Polish fusion dishes and our staff makes sure it reaches you in style. Our Menu Chicken Salad $22 Served with mushrooms, mandarin oranges, house ranch, and toasted almond slices. GF DF. Vodka Match – Topors Own Beetroot KIELBASA / GRZYB $19 Polish sausage on a balsamic roasted mushroom with pepperdew, caper, and sauerkraut concasse. GF DF. Vodka Match – Topors Own Cherry Reuben $20 Shaved corned beef sautéed with sauerkraut. Served on rye bread with hot mustard and melted Swiss cheese. Vodka Match – Topors Own Ginger BARSZCZ $14 A clear beetroot soup with uszka. Served chilled or hot. Vodka Match – Topors Own Peppercorn BIGOS ‘N’ BREAD $34 Poland’s National dish - a stew of sauerkraut, cabbage, and Polish meats. Slow cooked for hours for immense flavour. GF DF. Vodka Match – Topors Own Ginger BEEF TENDERLOIN $47 Pan-seared tenderloin steak (300g) served with new potatoes and roasted pumpkin. Topped with sautéed onions and mushrooms. Accented with beetroot relish. GF DF. Vodka Match – Topors Own Peppercorn Kielbasa on a bun $20 With fried onions and sauerkraut. Topped with a tangy mustard and horseradish aioli. Vodka Match – Topors Own Blueberry KASZANKA $18 Polish black pudding on a jacket mash with plum chutney. GF. Vodka Match – Topors Own Blueberry KIELBASA HASH $35 Tasty Kielbasa sausage on a new potato & sauerkraut hash, topped with a Blueberry compote. GF DF. Vodka Match – Topors Own Peppercorn MAZUREK $18 Flat cake topped with mango puree, candied fruit, and pistachios. Served with candied orange rinds. United Kingdom Anonymous 7,0 Good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Addington bed and breakfast Very friendly & helpful host. Finland Anonymous 9,0 Very good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Addington bed and breakfast Good sized room, comfy bed, good breakfast (a choice between cooked and continental brekkie), nice host Bathroom and toilet shared between three rooms. Worked out well for us but can imagine it can get busy sometimes. Australia Bruce 10,0 Excellent Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Addington bed and breakfast We had a cooked breakfast which was excellent, with perfectly cooked poached eggs. Facilities comfortable and all you needed. Terry was very friendly and helpful. Onsite parking available. New Zealand Karyn 7,0 Good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Addington bed and breakfast Great host, even picked us up from train station AND the train was an hour late :( Also dropped us off to car rental as it was raining - too wet for us to walk. Hong Kong John 7,0 Good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Addington bed and breakfast Picked up from our arrival point, and taken to our departure point next morning. Nicely looked after, comfortable room and bedding, with a decent breakfast. Ireland Petya 10,0 Excellent Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Addington bed and breakfast Terry was a great host! Very clean place, we were greeted warmly, he has given us map of the town and told us where to go for a walk around the center. Breakfast was very nice and generous in portions. Terry was great to take us to the airport next morning as well. Highly recommended place to stay. Campervans and large trailers are welcome too. All apartments ranging in size from 34m2 to 90m2 are equipped with an air-conditioner, a 32inch LCD TV, a DVD player (on request). All units have a well equipped kitchen including a full-sized fridge and freezer. 7 units have lovely sea views. A self-service laundry is available to all guests free of charge. The iconic 300m offshore New Brighton Pier, famous beachside New Brighton Library and Countdown Supermarket are only 3-minute drive or 15-minute walk along the beach. New Brighton is a great choice for travellers who are interested in beach walks, bird watching and feeding, jogging, cycling, surfing, golfing and other outdoor activities. The 18 km long sandy beach has no rocks or sharks. Perfect for people that enjoy exploring nature. There are also 3 large playgrounds nearby. Hello there Are these apartments used to house emergency accomodation? Am considering booking but need to know this first Thank you Regards Christine Our apartments are suitable for people need short-term accommodation. We'd like everyone staying with us to enjoy a good time in our spacious apartments with easy access to the beach and fantastic recreation facilities nearby. Hi do you have free wifi ? Needing it as I am travelling for study 😃 Hi there, Yes, we will provide free and unlimited WIFI for our guests. Hi do you have car park as we need to park our car with the trailer Hi there, Yes, we do have a lot of parking spaces. And we have more parking for your trailer at the back of our main building Hi, my wife and I will be travelling with our two year old daughter who still sleeps in a port a cot. Do you have port a cots available for use? Yes, certainly. We have 3 port-cots for use. Also have 1 or 2 high chairs. Are there ground floor apartments or to you have elevators to upper floors? Hi there, we do have ground-floor apartments but no elevators. Please advise us of the check-in & out date and we could check the availability and keep the room for you. Thank you Hello, is there a sea view from the living/dining area in the penthouse and is it possible to book for 60 nights? Thank you Yes. It's possible. Please check availability. is the bathrooms accessible for wheelchair users We have 2 apartments with accessible bathrooms suitable for wheelchair guests. Hi, Can the double beds go into singles as it is 8 males? Regards Dave Mitchell All 2 bedroom apartments can accommodate up to 6 people. The 3-bedroom apartment can handle 8 people, but has only 1 bathroom. Suggest to book 2 x 2-bedroom apartments. 100% real reviews of BeachLife Apartments Check the opinions of our clients New Zealand Susan 6,0 Good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about BeachLife Apartments Tired but it did the job Great location. Unit had everything we needed. Lovely big fridge/freezer. Shower pressure and water temperature was great. Check-in was an eye-watering experience - it took a long time (30 minutes plus), Eftpos was down, they attempted to charge double the agreed rate and the two units we had requested to be together (and assured they would be) were on complete opposite ends of the complex, one upstairs and one downstairs. Room was not child-friendly with an unsecured glass top coffee table that moved when touched. Very tired building. New Zealand Jacqueline 7,0 Good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about BeachLife Apartments Good Location! Value for money! Not quite as clean as it could be. New Zealand Lorraine 5,0 Good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about BeachLife Apartments Fair I booked the room at the last minute, and received a phone call from the place within 10 minutes which was great. The room was very large which was great, but I felt the furnishings were sparce, would have benefited from some floor rugs maybe. But was pleasant enough. New Zealand Ryan 7,0 Good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about BeachLife Apartments Would stay again Nice and close to the beach Not enough towels, someone took the hdmi cable so we couldn’t watch tv New Zealand Low 6,0 Good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about BeachLife Apartments Beachlife I loved how the walk to the beach was just across the road. Cool playgrounds nearby and a cool destination. The pier is beautiful especially at night. An awesome tourist place. I loved that this place catered to our needs with heat pumps and electric blankets so was definitely warm. Some things were wear and tear but overall we were Greatful. Loved that there were cooking facilities but no oven. It was clean but a little worn. Although language barriers are there they are nice and respectful. The blankets were beautiful soft and cozy which was definitely an upside for our stay. Thank you again. I would have loved more knowledge about cleaning facilities as our stay was longer than a night with children so a vacuum or cleaning utilities would have been nice. I would have loved new towels daily but there were drying racks so we dried and reused our towels. Mopping and floors should be done daily or offered. English is not these people's first language so there were barriers in that area which was a little frustrating because we didn't know there were other facilities such as washing machines and probably other things we were unaware of. I didn't want to look around for anything. I wasn't able to see the BBQ area or garden but I did see there was an area available on the website but I wouldn't know where to look. A bit on the pricey side however I do have 4 children and 2 adults so $110 per person for 3 nights was ok. Wifi is not the greatest but is available. It also seems everyone showers during the day so hot water can be scarce at those times. The reception isnt always available but contact numbers are visible on the windows. The TV did not work and made our stay a little difficult as our children were abit unsettled at times mainly night times after our tiki touring it would have been nice to relax but I had to entertain them after a whole days activities. As a parent a TV would have been much appreciated. I'm unsure if you have to hire them or not. But there are tvs that are in the rooms. I didn't read the reviews until after our stay and this place is not the worst but it does need improvements for the price they offer. name: book.bookit.co.nz
homepage_content: Height of Dunedin Farm Stay Cottage Description 0 reviews Check In: 15:00 | Check Out: 10:00 Hours: Relax in the warmth of a newly renovated 1-bedroom cottage in the misty clouds and experience the unique and homely semi-rural lifestyle nestled below awesome pine trees with a well-appointed courtyard garden to enjoy the rural outlook. In a private setting on a 6-acre farm the clean, comfortable and friendly hospitality of Height of Dunedin suits a couple or up to 5 guests. Height of Dunedin boasts a sunny, 44 square metre detached guesthouse in a lovely peaceful and tranquil hideaway. Perfect for honeymooners or a small family yet only 6 minutes away is Roslyn with an award-winning restaurant, cafes, day spa, pharmacy, winebar, artisan shops and supermarket. All this at 350 metres above sea level guarantees some snow falls during winter and beautiful picturesque surroundings. You can hand-feed pet animals on a self-guided wander. Awaken to the morning chorus of abundant birdlife: tuis, singing bellbirds, plump wood pigeons, warbling magpies, paradise ducks, hunting hawks, owls and NZ’s rare rosella parrots. A direct 10 minutes drive to The Octagon CBD yet Height of Dunedin captures a retreat of feeling miles away. Especially close to the neighbouring forest walking tracks and the Flagstaff-Pineapple Walk with its stunning views of Dunedin and the Otago Peninsula from the western hill skyline. Special Attractions and Activities Nearby - Halfway between Mosgiel and Dunedin, under 10 minutes drive to Moana Pool, Speights Brewery tours, Mercy Hospital, Otago University, Dunedin Botanic Gardens. - 15-minutes to Forsyth Barr Stadium. - 25-minutes to Dunedin Airport. - Local’s secret: 9-minutes drive to a short bush walk to a cascading waterfall by day and a magical glow worm wonderland after dark. - Spend a day on the Otago Peninsula exploring Larnach Castle, lunching at Glenfalloch Gardens and immersing yourself in the ‘Wildlife Capital of New Zealand’ at Taiaroa Head and the Albatross Colony. - On a rainy day Toitu Otago Settlers and Otago Museums are sure to keep young and old interested. - Take a scenic drive to Port Chalmers and walk Aramoana Mole to view sunning sea lions. Stop at Carey’s Bay Hotel for a famous seafood platter. - Make a day trip north to Victorian Oamaru and spot yellow-eyed penguins in nature or book to see the little blue penguins toddle home at dusk. Facilities Air-conditioned Balcony/Courtyard Barbecue Board Games Breakfast Available Clothesline Complimentary Tea/Coffee DVD Player Ensuite Families Welcome Free parking Free WiFi Freeview TV Fridge in Unit Fridge/Freezer Hairdryer in Room Highchair In-room DVD In-Room Ironing Laundry Facilities Library Linen Provided Luggage Storage Microwave in Unit Non-smoking property Non-smoking Rooms On-Site Parking Parking - Off street Playground Serviced Rooms Daily Shower Facilities Toilet Facilities TV Unlimited free wifi Terms and Conditions 2 Days - If a cancellation is made within 48 hours of check-in youll lose 100% of the total booking price. No refund for less than 48 hours notice or no shows. Travel cot and toddler mattress are available on request. Extra charge: infants under 2 years are charged NZD 40 per stay for this service. Auckland Takapuna B&B | New Zealand - Auckland 1 Hart Road Hauraki, 0622 Auckland, New Zealand (Lihat peta) ➤ Auckland Takapuna B&B | Auckland Located on the north shore of Auckland, this B&B offers accommodation in a 1920's style house with modern facilities. Takapuna beach is just 450 m from the property while Auckland city centre is a 15-minute drive away. Rooms at Auckland Takapuna B&B are spacious and fitted with a private bathroom with a hot tub. Extras include free toiletries and a hairdryer. There is a shared lounge at the property with a TV and Playstation. There are restaurants, cafes and supermarkets within a 20-minute walk from the property. The homestay also offers free use of bicycles. Auckland Harbour Bridge is 5 km from Auckland Takapuna B&B , while Viaduct Harbour is 5 km from the property. Auckland Airport is 34 km away. Very kind and generous host, they also help us to find good Indian restaurant in near by locality. We would like to extend our sincere gratitude and appreciation to property owners for being such a great host, cheers! nothng United Kingdom Alison 9,0 Sangat bagus Tujuan perjalanan: Perjalanan rekreasi Apa yang akan Anda soroti dari Auckland Takapuna B&B Lovely welcoming hosts. Comfortable home with everything supplied that we needed. Unfortunately on the evening we stayed there was a lot of noise from the neighbours across the street. I’m sure this was a one off but it did impact on our stay. However this was not the hosts responsibility! United Kingdom Diana 8,0 Sangat bagus Tujuan perjalanan: Perjalanan rekreasi Apa yang akan Anda soroti dari Auckland Takapuna B&B Cathy and Sean were good hosts. As someone else mentioned, they are friendly and helpful without being too much. We enjoyed playing with the dog too! The house was located near the beach and as we had returned our hire car had easy access to buses. Help yourself breakfast was fine. Being near everything unfortunately meant there was some traffic noise as the main road was close by. China Laura 10,0 Bagus sekali Tujuan perjalanan: Perjalanan rekreasi Apa yang akan Anda soroti dari Auckland Takapuna B&B It is absolutely great location to stay, close to beach, bus stop, shops and plenty of restaurants. The room and whole house are very clean. Breakfast is just everything we need. Non New Zealand NZ_Drea 9,0 Sangat bagus Tujuan perjalanan: Perjalanan rekreasi Apa yang akan Anda soroti dari Auckland Takapuna B&B The owners were absolutely lovely. Gave me a tour of the house and gave me the wifi password, along with an extra key. The house is beautiful, hard wood floors, tall cielings and quite open. They have a super friendly dog and cat. The room also had a cieling fan wich was incredibly convenient given how hot it was at the time. I think $160 for a night is quite expensive. The weather at the time was swelteringly hot. It felt like they had a winter duvet and flannel sheets on the bed. Australia Sharon 5,0 Bagus Tujuan perjalanan: Perjalanan rekreasi Apa yang akan Anda soroti dari Auckland Takapuna B&B No television either in room or working in lounge area - did have DVD's. Bathroom separate from the room. No signage outside to identify it. Sean was very pleasant and tried hard to rectify the situation Germany Carsten 9,0 Sangat bagus Tujuan perjalanan: Perjalanan rekreasi Apa yang akan Anda soroti dari Auckland Takapuna B&B The hosts make you feel very welcomed and are very courteous. The room, kitchen, bathroom are clean. The supermarket and the beach are not far - we enjoyed our stay! Thank you We could not find something we dont like :) Netherlands Ruud 9,0 Sangat bagus Tujuan perjalanan: Perjalanan rekreasi Apa yang akan Anda soroti dari Auckland Takapuna B&B Nice location in a quite area of Auckland with a beautiful beach. We liked to ride the mountainbikes we were allowed to borrow from the owner of the B&B. Also really good WiFi. Thanks ;-) Nothing, was a nice start of the vacation. New Zealand Anonymous 8,0 Sangat bagus Tujuan perjalanan: Perjalanan rekreasi Apa yang akan Anda soroti dari Auckland Takapuna B&B The character of the B & B was lovely and the accomodation was clean and close to the beach and shopping! The only thing that could have been better was the breakfast in the morning. A choice of two or three cereals and a couple of different unflavoured toast options would have been good with futher options for spreads. A mirror in the bedrooms would be helpful. Germany Heike 9,0 Sangat bagus Tujuan perjalanan: Perjalanan rekreasi Apa yang akan Anda soroti dari Auckland Takapuna B&B Generous size bedroom, very cute bathroom, uncluttered house with friendly but not in your face hosts, just right. Nice breakfast included and thank you for the yummy little welcome in the room :-) All you can expect from a B+B, very recommendable France Isabelle 6,0 Bagus Tujuan perjalanan: Perjalanan rekreasi Apa yang akan Anda soroti dari Auckland Takapuna B&B L’endroit et les propriétaires adorables. Ce n’est pas du tout un BandB! Une chambre chez des gens on a accès au frigo pour petit dej on fait notre vaisselle et notre lit. Ils doivent renommer leur location. Polynésie française Barbara 9,0 Sangat bagus Tujuan perjalanan: Perjalanan rekreasi Apa yang akan Anda soroti dari Auckland Takapuna B&B Un accueil aimable et adapté à nos demandes specifiques, des vélos enfant tout neufs mis à disposition, literie confortable, chambres et salle de bains bien chauffés pour saison froide, des petits chaussons offerts pour ne pas se geler les pieds (!), quartier calme avec commerces et plage à proximité, un petit déjeuner un peu plus complet que celui proposé ailleurs, et... Un gentil chien discret et affectueux :-). Merci Sean! Les chambres ont des stores vénitiens qui n'obscurcissent pas beaucoup, mais sinon que du positif. name: carringtoncentral.hotelbin.top
homepage_content: Carrington Central - Hotel in New Plymouth Carrington Central 🌎 31 Carrington Street, 4310 New Plymouth, New Zealand Book a room Arrival Departure Adults 1 2 3 4 5 6 Children 0 1 2 3 4 5 6 Check Availability Carrington Central is set in New Plymouth, 2 km from Yarrow Stadium, 200 metres from Puke Ariki, and 500 metres from Len Lye Centre. The property is situated 1.6 km from Brooklands Zoo, 4.2 km from Port Taranaki and 4.7 km from Te Rewa Rewa Bridge. Free WiFi is available throughout the property and Fitzroy Beach is 1.7 km away. The spacious holiday home includes 2 bedrooms, a fully equipped kitchen with a dishwasher and an oven, as well as a kettle. The holiday home offers bed linen, towels and laundry service. Popular points of interest near the holiday home include Govett Brewster Art Gallery, Pukekura Park and TSB Stadium. The nearest airport is New Plymouth Airport, 12 km from Carrington Central. Shotover River is 1.4 km from Central Lakeview Apartment, while AJ Hackett Bungy Jumping - Kawarau Bridge is 5 km away. Guests can enjoy various activities in the surroundings, including golfing and hiking. The nearest airport is Queenstown Airport, 6 km from Central Lakeview Apartment. Home Accommodation Meal Options Oamaru About Contact Privacy Policy +64 3 434 1514 Century House Classic New Zealand B&B and holiday accommodation, only a few minutes from the town centre of Oamaru Check Availability... Century House B&B Accommodation Century House, only a few minutes from the centre of Oamaru , is a classic 1900's Villa with comfortable tasteful rooms, ornate ceilings, original features and lead light windows. The 1902 villa sits proudly in all day sun, offering a peaceful and quiet place to stay. There are 2 Bed and Breakfast rooms that can be combined to provide private holiday accommodation ideal for 2 couples or small families. Comfort and quality are combined with old fashioned hospitality to make your stay an enjoyable one. Spend time enjoying our private sunny garden and spa pool, or use us as a base to explore the beautiful surroundings of North Otago. There is so much to do around Oamaru with the Alps to Ocean Cycle Trail, Oamaru's Victorian heritage and the world famous Steampunk, to name a few. Our goal is to make you feel at home and to help you plan and enjoy your stay. Staying with us will be one of your memorable experiences in our region. If you have any questions, please contact us... B&B Waitaki Room The Waitaki B&B Room is set up with a Queen bed and your choice of full or continental breakfast... Read More... B&B Weston Room The Western Room is set up as a Twin room with extremely comfortable King Single beds... Read More... Holiday Accommodation Book both rooms together and get a private area ideal for 2 couples or a small family... Read More... Chef Of India Papakura Chef Of India in Papakura, New Zealand, is a delightful dining establishment located at 7/1 Prictor Street. This restaurant is renowned for its authentic Indian cuisine, offering a wide range of dishes that cater to both vegetarian and non-vegetarian preferences. The menu at Chef Of India features a variety of classic Indian dishes, including aromatic curries, flavorful tandoori items, biryanis, and more. Whether you're a fan of rich and creamy butter chicken, spicy vindaloo, or a hearty vegetable biryani, there's something to satisfy every palate. Chef Of India in Papakura is known not only for its delicious food but also for its friendly and attentive service. It's an excellent choice for anyone looking to experience the flavors of India in the heart of Papakura. name: egmontfarmstay.com
homepage_content: Egmont Villa Farmstay – modern countryside accommodation Skip to content Egmont Villa Farmstay is 5 minutes from New Plymouth by car, with panoramic views over the city, Tasman Sea & Mt Egmont/Taranaki. You will stay in your own spacious, self contained studio apartment which includes ensuite bathroom and fully equipped kitchen. You are welcome to order a full continental breakfast or our famous cooked breakfast. One of the single beds is suitable for children only. Please contact us directly about your booking requirements. Lesley and Graeme have been hosting guests at their peaceful countryside farmstead since 2005. They are retired deer farmers and now have a lifestyle block with cows, goats, sheep, chickens, a dog, cat and pig. There is also a large orchard with bee hives and native tree walkway. At certain times of the year there may be lambs fed by the bottle, collecting eggs from the chickens, or fresh fruit from the orchard for example. Kids love it! Their daughter Bridget has an acupuncture clinic next door and may be available at certain times for treatments. For further information http://www.bridgethunteracupuncture.com Share this: Click to share on X (Opens in new window) X Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Facebook Privacy & Cookies: This site uses cookies. name: dolphinlodge.co.nz
homepage_content: Dolphin Lodge Kaikoura Skip to primary navigation Skip to main content Skip to footer Dorm Rooms Looking for accommodation with great views and close to town in Kaikōura. then look no further... Dorm Rooms Private Rooms Looking for genuine homely style accommodation in Kaikōura. then look no further... Private Rooms Dorm Rooms Looking for relaxing and spacious accommodation in Kaikōura. then look no further... Dorm Rooms Private Rooms Looking for genuine homely style accommodation in Kaikōura. then look no further... Private Rooms Dorm Rooms Looking for accommodation that is small and comfortable in Kaikōura. then look no further... Dorm Rooms Private Rooms Looking for accommodation with spacious outdoor areas in Kaikōura. then look no further... Private Rooms Stay at Kaikōura Book your hostel accommodation at Kaikōura; Private Room or Dorm options. Private Rooms Dorm Rooms Dolphin Lodge Backpackers is a genuine homely style hostel offering Private and Dorm Room accommodation at a quiet central location in Kaikōura. Come and join us at our small snug hostel that has many home comforts and is only two mins walk from the Kaikōura town centre and beach. The lodge is situated to take advantage of the magnificent views of the Kaikōura coastline and the Seaward Kaikōura Mountain range, we have incredible sunrise and sunsets, and in most cases, you don’t even have to leave your room for the view. Dolphin Lodge is set in a private garden and has a large outdoor decking for balmy summer afternoon relaxing and enjoying the magnificent views. Dolphin Lodge Accommodation 3 Double Rooms Two rooms with ensuites and one room with shared bathroom. Double Rooms 3 Dorm Rooms One dorm sleeps four, one sleeps five and one sleeps six. Dorm Rooms 1 Twin Room Sunny sleep-out with own entrance and a little more privacy. Twin Room Dolphin Lodge Backpackers is centrally located and close to... Kaikōura i-SITE Visitor Information Centre Kaikōura West End Shopping Centre Restaurants & Bars Tours and Trips Bus Stops Happy Guests Say... I stayed here for one night but wish I had more time. Helen is an excellent host - friendly, conversational, and helpful. She picked me up from the train station and brought be back the next day. I stayed in a 5-person dorm and the room was very clean and had enough space. The bathrooms were clean and the showers were hot. They are communal unisex bathrooms, but there is plenty of privacy. There is a hot tub on the deck that Helen will open up easily - it's a great way to relax after a day of exploring and chat with the other backpackers while enjoying a great view! In the evening she lit a fire for us to gather around and continue chatting, and the next day she stored my bags while I explored Kaikoura. I wish I could have stayed here longer! Great location and perfect for making friends STEPHL Blissful spot, beautiful grounds, staff lovely and so peaceful! Views from the garden were stunning. Wonderful ROBYN Very clean small hostel. Big shared rooms with windows. Whirlpool with a great view over Kaikoura and the landscape (the sea). Perfect Hostel MATHAIS Highly recommend this Hostel for Backpacker. Cheap accommodation, everything is super clean and staff is just friendly. Helen, the owner is willing to help you if you have questions. 1 minute away from town centre. Was a pleasure staying here! Nice, quite, clean, perfect view!” FREDDY Excellent location walking distance from the town and ample parking space. Great views and an outside hot tub. Along the coast we saw a very large number of seals and their pups. Excellent location Rebecca This place is simply amazing. The people here are really nice and kind and the whole place has a very family like atmosphere. You can see the mountains and the sea from the kitchen area, the view is amazing and I can recommend getting up to see the sunrise. It's a very clean hostel and the hot pool is super cosy. They also have an adorable cat. Of all the hostels I have been to this one will always hold a very special place in my hart <3 This place is simply amazing Isabella It is really well located. small backpackers which feel more like home than a hostel. a deck and backyard with an amazing view. a short walk uphill from the bus stop, really nice! It is really well located Irene Location is really great, two minute walking to the city centre. The view is awesome, you can see the sea from the kitchen - which is nice, has a reasonable size and you can find everything you need if you want to cook. Bathroom is also good with water pressure and hot water. Showers have a small area for you to hang your stuff and change clothes. The place is really very nice and you feel like home, very quiet, clean and well maintained. Very nice place to stay PELIPE Very cool and cosy backpack. Free wifi and all clean. 2 min walking from the bus station (inter city / naked bus). The garden is cute, like home. Top Top!!! VICTORIA Great location, so close to the esplanade in Kaikoura, yet far enough away to enjoy the peace and quiet and admire the views. The rooms are spacious and tidy and the kitchen and dinning (indoor and outdoor areas) are very well set out. The hostel is surrounded by pleasant gradens and even has a hot tub. The staff were pleasant and the cost was quite reasonable. Definitely worth a look if you are planning in staying in Kaikoura. Great location Hayden 5 By far the best place to stay in Kaikoura. Friendly hosts, clean and spacious rooms, reasonable prices, close to pubs and stores and the beach, and the view from the veranda and garden is simply breathtaking. And they come with an adorable hostel cat, Maui! I lived at Dolphin Lodge for several months while working in Kaikoura and I enjoyed every single day there. Truly your home away from home. Best place to stay in Kaikoura Janine If you enjoyed your stay, we'd love you to tell us (and others) about it! Write a review...

name: dashingrocks.co.nz
homepage_content: - Dashing Rocks Bed and Breakfast - Timaru Facilities Your hosts Shirley & Michael Ussher welcome you to Dashing Rocks bed and breakfast which offers comfort & great views. We offer warm hospitality, comfortable rooms and superb attention to detail. View more info Activities We are 3 min walk to Caroline Bay, Tennis centre, and aquatic centre, 7 min walk to excellent restaurants, and town centre. We have seven Golf courses within a 30 minute drive. Things to do Booking with Us Our rates are very affordable and offer a discount for longer stays. We strive to make Dashing Rocks Bed and breakfast, Timaru an enjoyable experience. Check out our availability & rates. Book Now Dashing Rocks Bed & Breakfast, Timaru We are a retired farming couple who enjoy meeting and hosting interesting people from different cultures. Our interests are golf, skiing, gardening, reading & travel. We are located in the lovely town of Timaru centrally located in the South Island of New Zealand between Christchurch & Dunedin. A two hour drive away is Aoraki Mt Book, New Zealand’s highest mountain and beautiful lakes Tekapo, Ohau, Pukahi. Our home is conveniently located on a quiet street just a few minutes walk to Caroline Bay, tennis stadium, CBAY aquatic centre and restaurants. The guest rooms are on their own floor with their own sitting room. What our guests have to say… It’s a fascinating house with clear view to the sea. The room is very clean and with a bathroom inside which provides great privacy. The room has a big balcony and also the view to the sea and a beautiful garden full of flowers. The hosts are very kind couple. They provide really hearty breakfast. I have to say the experience staying here is even better than the 5 star hotel. 力之 What a great airbnb experience! Shirley and Michael are awesome and real super hosts! Spacious room, lounge, lovely Interieur, privacy and great view from the huge sun deck! Restaurants and Beach are just minutes walk away. The best thing in this place are the hosts! We felt like home and welcomed. Michael gave us a ride to his farm and showed us the amazing landscape. Shirley’s cookies and muffins were excellent. If you get the chance to come to Timaru Shirley’s place is a must! Christiane We had a wonderful stay at Shirley’s home and I will recommend anyone that’s passing through the area to stop here. I wish we had spent more time in Timaru and enjoy the tastefully decorated living spaces. Shirley has a beautiful garden too and the sitting room overlooks the north end of Caroline Bay… very pretty views! Rooms and bathroom are modern and clean. Catherine Fantastic experience! AirBnB at its best. Shirley was a great host and made us feel like at home. Staying at her house was like staying at friend’s place. Had lots of interesting conversations. House is located in a quiet cul-de-sac, walking distance from beach, town centre and restaurants. Perfectly well kept with all amenities and incredibly spacious. For the discerning travellers who value interaction with locals. Alexander Menu

name: hampshireholidayparks.co.nz
homepage_content: Kaikōura TOP 10 Holiday Park Welcome to Kaikōura TOP 10 Discover Kaikōura, a coastal town famed for wildlife and scenery. Kaikōura TOP 10 Holiday Park is the perfect base to enjoy this breathtaking nature paradise. Previous Next Location Kaikōura is situated in the northern part of Canterbury in New Zealand’s South Island. Apart from its majestic scenery, Kaikōura is popular with nature lovers who flock to the town for its unique animal encounters. Our TOP 10 holiday park is centrally located so you can easily discover all that Kaikōura has to offer. Kaikōura TOP 10 Holiday Park is situated on the main road of town just across from the beach. The town with its lovely shops and restaurants are an easy walk away and many of the iconic tours and attractions are within easy reach. Picton – 2 hours Marlborough – 2 hours Christchurch – 2 hours 20 min Nelson – 3 hour 20 min Kaikōura TOP 10 Accommodation Whatever your budget, Kaikōura TOP 10 Holiday Park offers an excellent range of accommodation options for every type of traveller. Choose from our range of camping sites, motels or units and cabins. View Accommodation Options Offers Stay 2, Save 25% Save 25% when you book a 2–7 night stay at Ōhope Beach, Kaikōura or Carters Beach TOP 10 Holiday Park, for travel between now and the end of November. Learn More Book Now Facilities Swimming Pool Our heated swimming pool is open from October to April, 8:30am–7:30pm (or until dusk). Games Room & Movie Room Challenge family or friends to a game of foosball or table tennis, then wind down with a family movie night. Jumping Pillow Always a hit with the kids, the giant jumping pillow is the perfect place to bounce, laugh, and burn off energy. Adventure Playground With swings, climbing frames and more, the adventure playground provides entertainment for younger guests. Private Spa Unwind in one of our private hot tubs, the ideal way to relax after a day exploring Kaikōura’s coast and wildlife. Conference Facilities Host your next conference in our modern space, equipped with a projector, TV screen and flexible seating options. Features Pedal Cart & Bicycle Hire Covered BBQ Terrace Dump Station Bathroom Facilities Kitchen Facilities Laundry Facilities Conference Facilities Tour Booking Desk Free WiFi Park Map Check pricing & availability Kaikōura Attractions Whale Watching Take part in New Zealand's ultimate marine experience & amaze in wonder at the giants of the sea - the sperm whale. Save $30 with a TOP 10 Club Membership. Peninsula Walk Walk the breathtaking peninsula walk, with clifftop vistas from sea to snow-capped peaks. You'll discover why this is the most-walked short walk in New Zealand. Dolphin Encounter A once in a lifetime trip to watch or swim with the playful, acrobatic dusky dolphins in their natural environment. Save $16 - $34 with a TOP 10 Club Membership. Albatross Encounter Kaikōura is the Albatross capital of the world. Take a trip to visit up to 14 different species throughout the year. Save $23 with a TOP 10 Club Membership. Kaikōura Kayaks Enjoy Kaikōura by kayak. There are chances of viewing dolphins, seals and many species of seabirds. Save 10% with a TOP 10 Club Membership. Seal Swimming A breathtaking activity with Seal Swim Kaikōura. You won't believe how curious and playful New Zealand fur seals can be. Save $22 with a TOP 10 Club Membership. Charter Fishing Tours Pick one of Kaikōura's many charter operators, Have fun fishing for Blue Cod, Groper, Hapuka, and enjoy the spoils of the day. Indulge in Seafood Kaikōura is renowned as the crayfish capital of New Zealand. Indulge in other fresh delicacies including groper and cod. Mountain Biking Kaikoura offers a variety of spectacular mountain bike trails to explore. Tracks range from casual family trails to challenging adventures. Testimonials “The staff/owners make you very welcome on arrival and the cleanliness and presentation of the camp is perfect. We will definitely be staying there again. Central location so can walk or cycle to your favourite cafe/bar.” Gina Kaikōura TOP 10 Holiday Park “Stayed for one night in a family kitchen cabin. We were impressed. All linen was provided, and we were definitely warm enough, especially with a good heater. Beds were comfortable, and cabin was clean and smelled fresh.” Lee Kaikōura TOP 10 Holiday Park Book Now Frequently Asked Questions What are your reception hours? Our current reception hours are 8.00am – 8.30pm. If you know you will be arriving after hours, please let us know. What time is check in/check out? Check in is from 2pm, check out by 10am. If you require an early check in or a late check out, please contact Reception and we will do our best to accommodate you. What happens if I need to check in after-hours? If you know you will be arriving after hours, please let us know. We can then talk you through our late arrival procedure. What is your pet policy? We are pet friendly. Pets must be kept on a lead at all times, they must not be left on their own and you must clean up after them. Is Wi-Fi available? Yes, we have free, unlimited Wi-Fi for guests. What is available in the kitchen? The kitchens are fully equipped with ovens, hobs, microwaves, toasters, hot water zip and fridge freezers. It has indoor seating and tv’s. Please note, cookware and crockery are not provided but kitchen sets can be hired at reception. Are there laundry facilities? Yes, we have a laundry room with tap and go washing machine and dryers. Laundry powder is available for purchase at reception for $2.50 per sachet. Is linen available? Yes, all linen is provided in our rooms. For our cabins, towels are available for hire from reception. Do you have accessible accommodation options available? Yes, we offer two specialised accessible accommodation options for guests who need them. Please contact our friendly staff for more information and to check availability on +64 3 319 5362 . Get in Touch Call : + 64 3 319 5362 Follow us on Socials Address: Kaikōura TOP 10 Holiday Park, 34 Beach Road, Kaikoura 7300 Please use the form below to contact Kaikōura TOP 10. name: hampshireholidayparks.co.nz
homepage_content: Queenstown Lakeview Holiday Park | Camping Ground All Parks You are viewing Queenstown Lakeview – A Hampshire Holidays Park Formerly Known as Queenstown Lakeview Holiday Park Welcome to Queenstown Lakeview Queenstown blends natural beauty with adventure. Hampshire Holiday Parks – Queenstown Lakeview puts you close to town, attractions, and alpine scenery. Previous Next Location Queenstown sits on the shores of Lake Wakatipu and is set against the dramatic Alps of New Zealand’s South Island. Other than its undeniable beauty, the resort town is known as the adrenaline capital of the world, popular with adventure seekers all year round. Our holiday park boasts a central location so you can easily discover all that Queenstown has to offer. Hampshire Holiday Parks - Queenstown Lakeview is just a few minutes’ walk from the town centre, lakefront and many of the local iconic attractions, including the Skyline Gondola and Luge. Lake Wakatipu – 100m Ben Lomond Walking Track – 180m Kiwi Birdlife Park – 200m Queenstown Mall – 300m Queenstown Centre – 500m Arrowtown – 20 minutes Queenstown Accommodation Hampshire Holiday Parks - Queenstown Lakeview offers a wide range of accommodation options for your holiday in Queenstown including self-contained units, one-bedroom studios and open plan studios. Our extensive camping area offers sites suitable for campervans, caravans, tenting, and are supported by modern, well serviced facilities. View Accommodation Options Offers Stay Midweek and Save 25% This spring, save 25% on 2–7 night midweek stays at Hampshire Holiday Parks – Queenstown Lakeview, for travel before November 30. Learn More Book Now Features & Facilities Tour desk Kitchen Laundry facilities BBQ facilities Luggage storage Bike/ski storage Parking Park Map Check pricing & availability Queenstown Attractions Queenstown Hikes Many Queenstown hikes start at the centre of town, some as easy as a lakefront stroll. Keen hikers will love the Queenstown Hill and the Ben Lomond tracks. Queenstown Skiing Queenstown is home to New Zealand’s best ski fields. The Remarkables is a great family-friendly resort, while Coronet Peak is great for intermediate skiers and riders. Bungee Jump Queenstown Queenstown offers some of the best bungee jumps in the world. Choose from the original Kawarau Bridge Bungy, The Ledge Bungy, or the Nevis Bungy Swing. Jet Boat Queenstown The Shotover River is favourite attraction among thrill-seekers. Fast currents make this one of the best places in Queenstown for jet boating and white-water rafting. Hot Pools Queenstown Hot pools are an excellent way to soothe the muscles and relax after a day skiing, hiking or biking. The Onsen Hot Pools and Day Spa is just a 10 minute-drive from Queenstown. Queenstown Wineries Queenstown Lakes and Central Otago are regarded as New Zealand's premier wine regions. A visit to some of the wineries is one of the best things to do in Queenstown. Queenstown Gardens You’ll find the incredibly tranquil Queenstown Gardens at the heart of town. Offering a pleasant sanctuary, the gardens are a popular place to relax or take a stroll. Kiwi Birdlife Park The Kiwi Birdlife Park is a wildlife sanctuary displaying over 20 different species of native birds and reptiles. Visitors have the chance to get up close to wildlife during shows. Queenstown Skyline Enjoy an iconic Queenstown attraction and take the gondola up 450 metres to Bob's Peak. From the top, enjoy panoramic views of The Remarkables and Lake Wakatipu. Testimonials “The million-dollar views are coupled with immaculately clean rooms, great heating and parking right outside your room. Amazing cafe for breakfast just across the road and an easy walk down into town. ” Sue Hampshire Holiday Parks - Queenstown Lakeview “We spent three nights in our motor home here and had the best time. From the first greeting at reception to our departure. Everything was so tidy and well set out. Kids were able to cruise around and feel safe. Easy to get to town and lovely all round. We will back for sure” Van Der Heyden Family Hampshire Holiday Parks - Queenstown Lakeview Book Now Frequently Asked Questions What are your reception hours? Our current reception hours are 8.00am – 7.00pm. If you know you will be arriving after hours, please let us know. What time is check in/check out? Check in is from 3pm, check out before 10am. If you require an early check in or a late check out, please contact Reception and we will do our best to accommodate you. What happens if I need to check in after-hours? If you know you will be arriving after hours, please let us know. We can then talk you through our late arrival procedure. What is your pet policy? We allow dogs in the camping area only, dogs must remain on a lead at all times, be cleaned up after and under no circumstances be left unattended or taken into any camp buildings. Is Wi-Fi available? Yes, we have free, unlimited Wi-Fi for guests staying in our rooms and 1GB per device, per day in the camping area. What is available in the kitchen? The kitchens are fully equipped with ovens, hobs, microwaves, toasters, hot water zip and fridge freezers. It has indoor seating and tv’s. Please note, cookware and crockery are not provided but kitchen sets can be hired at reception. Are there laundry facilities? Yes, we have a laundry room with tap and go washing machine and dryers. Laundry powder is available for purchase at reception for $2.50 per sachet. Is linen available? Yes, all linen is provided in our rooms. Get in Touch Call : + 64 3 4427252 Follow us on Socials Address: Hamphire Holiday Parks - Queenstown Lakeview, 4 Cemetery Road, Queenstown 9300 Please use the form below to contact Queenstown Lakeview. name: havenhomestay.co.nz
homepage_content: Home 021 0252 9145 Office: 8am-8pm Welcome to Haven Homestay Relax in our stylish rooms Deluxe room ensuite Our secluded haven welcome Haven Homestay We welcome guests to our stylish and modern Bed & Breakfast located on the quiet tree-lined Sophia Street, Glenholme. We are just minutes away to everything you need for a wonderful stay in Rotorua: - Restaurants and shops - Polynesian Spa, Wai Ariki Spa, Secret Spot Hot Tubs - Whakawerawera Living Village - Te Puia Geothermal Park & Cultural Centre, to name a few! We advise staying with us for a minimum of three nights so you get to spend time and experience this truly amazing city. Rotorua Rotorua is the heart of New Zealand's thermal area and has lots of attractions to suit everyone. There is plenty to see and do from Māori culture, thermal wonders, world renowned spas, adventure activities and more! You will be able to see volcanic landscapes, mud pools, geysers, forests, lakes and Kiwi birds. Exeperience a Maori cultural show followed by a traditional Hangi (food cooked in the ground), or try whitewater rafting, Zorbing, or ziplining! A visit to Hobbiton, Taupo or Tauranga is only an hour away making Rotorua a great place to base yourself. If you don't have a car, the local bus station is close by and some of the tourism attractions will pick you up direct from our B&B. We welcome you to our friendly, comfortable, homely B&B in Rotorua City BED & BREAKFAST TOUR DISCOUNTS FREE WI-FI SPA POOL 32" TV IN ROOM FREE PARKING We are members of the National Bed & Breakfast Association of New Zealand Home B & B Amenities rates Breakfast Guest Gallery Links Contact Availability location Map Distance Attractions Free things Thermal Pools Geothermal Adventure Recreation Maori Culture Rotorua Restaurants Bars

name: graftonoakshotel.co.nz
homepage_content: Grafton Oaks Fitness Retreat hotel - Health & Wellness Holidays Steel Mace Workout – Macebell Ladders September 18, 2024 This workout’s called mace ladders. Basically, a ladder workout is where you add one additional rep each time you go through the circuit or each time you go through the set. It’s 15 minutes continuous, try not to stop if you can. If you do need to stop, just take a rest, have a 60-second rest, grab a drink, have a quick breather, get your heart rate back down, and then continue on. As over time you get stronger and more skilled with these functional training movements, you say if you finish your first set at six minutes, next time you do this workout, try and finish it at seven minutes, and each time you finish the workout, you’re getting more and more done. You increase your time under tension each time as you get stronger, don’t worry if you can’t do the full 15 minutes. Just do as much as you can, take a quick breather, and then just continue off where you left off. There’s four exercises in total. We’re gonna do one rep of ten and two. We’re going to go each direction, one rep of Half Moon off each leg, two-handed mil each side with just one rep, and then last one, uppercut lunge again each side. We just do one rep of those four exercises, then when we go around again to start, we do two reps of ten and two, two reps of Half Moon, two reps of two and a meal, two reps of uppercut lunge. Then we go three reps of each, four reps, five reps, six reps, seven reps. We build up on the reps as we go through the workout. We’re gonna go for the exercises now. I want to start off with a ten and two. Feet are pointing forward, quads are on, glutes tight, hands and navel. Elbows are tin, shoulders down and back, down over the shoulder, watch it come around with the weight. We do our ten and twos. And then for now, we’re going to bring it down into that switch called position. I’m gonna throw it up and then catch it down on the other side, fold up, catch it down on the other side. just make sure your knees track the toes when you’re doing your lunges, your lateral lunge. And from here, we’re going to go two-handed mil. Rotate the thoracic, cast it out, forearm lock, 180. If I’m coming from my right, I’m going over my left shoulder, I’m going to switch grips. Cast it out to the right this time. If I’m coming from my left, I want to come over my right shoulder. And then last off, we’re going to finish with an uppercut lunge. We’re going to bring that hand down towards the side and then punch up with my right, step forward with my left. I’m going to throw it up, change sides and then if I punch up my left, I’m going to step forward with my right. You do one rep of each of those exercises, now go two reps, then three, then four, then five reps. get as high as you can in the 15 minutes. If you do get the 15 minutes in without stopping, say if you do, say, nine reps of each of those exercises, next time you do this workout, try and get ten. And then use that as kind of a challenge to really push yourself each time you do the workout to try and get more and more out each time. Alright guys, that’s it for today’s YouTube workout, hope you enjoyed, and I will see you in the next one. P.S. Want more mace workouts just like this? Be sure to check out this YouTube playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL2-qXZWogqiRHfyfr3WJ5CSixQ7UGlpY9 Battle Rope Workout Tips For Training at Home September 13, 2022 Can you use battle ropes at home? Battle ropes are a great way to build core strength and work on your balance. If you plan on using them at home, make sure there’s enough space for the rope since it will need some room outside its anchor point when extended away from whatever is holding up one side or both ends! Battle ropes are a great way to build strength and flexibility. You can use them in the gym, at home or on any journey-they’re perfect for traveling! Keep this equipment brief with your workout routine though – make sure you’ve got plenty of room because when extended away from anchor point will take up some space too. In order perform battle rope exercises properly it’s crucial that there is enough space available around us so we don’t get restricted creatively due lack luster surroundings which may cause injury during activity. One tip is to get properly fitted anchor mount and battling rope storage hook , this will help you keep your workout space nice and tidy. How long should a battle rope workout be? Battle Rope is an intense workout that will make you work up a sweat. You’ll be able to do it anywhere because there are no special equipment required! A battle rope circuit consists of five or six different exercises with 30 second breaks between them so choose whichever ones sound best suited for your needs above all else, then get strength training wherever possible by doing this repeating 5-8 times per session depending on how often they occur during the days schedule. Do battle rope workouts at home work? Battle rope exercises are a great way to build muscular strength , increase cardio fitness and boost athletic performance. They’re high energy but low impact so you can do them kneeling, sitting or even laying down if need be! A battle rope workout at home can be done in the garden, the garage or even inside if you have enough space. Credit: Battle Rope Australia How do beginners use battle ropes? Battle ropes can be used in many different ways to help you achieve your goals. For example, if it’s goal is simply strength training then try doing exercises such as rows or pushups with the battle rope held above head level so that both hands have something attached at all times – this will allow for better balance and stability while working out! Battleropes exercises for beginner workouts can be done by regressing the core fundamental movements, if need be, grab the the rope closer to the anchor point to decrease the weight of the rope. Is it OK to do battle ropes everyday? This is a great way to get your sweat on and simultaneously work out those muscles. With no rules for how often you should do battle rope workouts, it all depends upon what fitness goal one has in mind – whether they’re looking toward weight loss or improved athletic ability! A few intense sessions per week could be enough if this person wants something less rigorous but still challenging every day of their life (like me). Benefits of Sandbag Training July 8, 2022

name: firstbaseaccommodation.co.nz
homepage_content: First Base Accommodation – Just another WordPress site Accommodation Wellington Looking for an affordable accommodation option in the heart of Wellington. Choose from single or double rooms, each featuring central heating, unlimited Wi-Fi, ample storage and access to a variety of communal spaces. Some rooms also offer an ensuite bathroom and/or balcony. You’ll be conveniently close to numerous universities, shops, and restaurants in the vibrant Te Aro neighbourhood. We are not currently taking any bookings, however, please enquire below and we will notify you of any availabilities as they arise. MAKE AN ENQUIRY The Rooms Starting from as little as $250 per week, our well thought out rooms have everything you need to thrive in Wellington. With ample space, light and storage, its sort of a no-brainer. Room Features Double or single bed rooms Ensuite or shared bathroom options Central heating and in-room heating Ample storage Large windows and curtains Mirror Gas, Electricity and Wifi included Make an Enquiry We are not currently taking any bookings, however, please fill in below to be notified when rooms become available. Communal Spaces When you rent a room you also get access to a host of useful communal spaces, from lounges to kitchens, we have thought of all the key stuff. Reception Head to our reception for help from our friendly staff. Lounges Kick back and relax, meet other guests or just watch some TV. Kitchen Feel like cooking? our communal kitchen is stocked with all the essentials you might need. Balcony Our balcony spaces are perfect for catching a breath of that crisp wellington air. Carpark We have carpark spaces available for booking, talk to our reception about costs involved. Laundry No need to haul your socks down the road, Head to our communal laundry! For stays, we require a minimum commitment of 4 weeks, with the flexibility of providing just one week’s notice thereafter. A bond equivalent to one week’s rent is also required. Couples are welcome to stay, although we regret that pets are not permitted on the premises. Address: 21 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand. Whats Nearby Victoria University of Wellington 20 minute walk Massey University Wellington Campus 15 minute walk Te Aro Bus Stops 5 minute walk Supermarket 5 minute walk Wellington Central Library 10 minute walk CBD 12 minute walk or 5 minute bus Ad
