name: daltonsplantation.co.nz
homepage_content: Home - Daltons Plantation Please note... The Plantation Gardens & Café are closed to the public until further notice. Keep an eye on this website for future updates. Be inspired... to create garden a environment that reflects your lifestyle and passions as you wander through the many garden ‘rooms’ found on this 10 acre block that is Daltons Plantation. Dalton’s Plantation Judith Dalton and Xanthe White have grown a creative concept into one of Waikato’s most unique venues. Utilising the design skills of one of New Zealand’s leading garden designers, Xanthe White, Daltons Plantation showcases new plants, products and different garden styles in a 10 acre development adjacent to Daltons operating site in Matamata. The gardens also display Daltons comprehensive range of landscaping products, growing media, and of course, all plants will be sourced from Daltons extensive base of nursery customers. Daltons Plantation is a living, evolving representation of all the very best the gardening industry has to offer. Designed to wow and inspire, Daltons Plantation is yet another example of Daltons actively supporting the gardening industry in New Zealand. The Plantation Gardens & Café are closed to the public until further notice. Keep an eye out for future updates. Our Gardens Visit our delightful cafe set amidst up to 20 ‘garden rooms’, each highlighting different garden styles in a constantly changing and diverse mix of plants and landscaping themes. View our gardens here

name: holidaypark.net.nz
homepage_content: Queenstown Lakeview Holiday Park | Camping Ground All Parks You are viewing Queenstown Lakeview – A Hampshire Holidays Park Formerly Known as Queenstown Lakeview Holiday Park Welcome to Queenstown Lakeview Queenstown blends natural beauty with adventure. Hampshire Holiday Parks – Queenstown Lakeview puts you close to town, attractions, and alpine scenery. Previous Next Location Queenstown sits on the shores of Lake Wakatipu and is set against the dramatic Alps of New Zealand’s South Island. Other than its undeniable beauty, the resort town is known as the adrenaline capital of the world, popular with adventure seekers all year round. Our holiday park boasts a central location so you can easily discover all that Queenstown has to offer. Hampshire Holiday Parks - Queenstown Lakeview is just a few minutes’ walk from the town centre, lakefront and many of the local iconic attractions, including the Skyline Gondola and Luge. Lake Wakatipu – 100m Ben Lomond Walking Track – 180m Kiwi Birdlife Park – 200m Queenstown Mall – 300m Queenstown Centre – 500m Arrowtown – 20 minutes Queenstown Accommodation Hampshire Holiday Parks - Queenstown Lakeview offers a wide range of accommodation options for your holiday in Queenstown including self-contained units, one-bedroom studios and open plan studios. Our extensive camping area offers sites suitable for campervans, caravans, tenting, and are supported by modern, well serviced facilities. View Accommodation Options Offers Stay Midweek and Save 25% This spring, save 25% on 2–7 night midweek stays at Hampshire Holiday Parks – Queenstown Lakeview, for travel before November 30. Learn More Book Now Features & Facilities Tour desk Kitchen Laundry facilities BBQ facilities Luggage storage Bike/ski storage Parking Park Map Check pricing & availability Queenstown Attractions Queenstown Hikes Many Queenstown hikes start at the centre of town, some as easy as a lakefront stroll. Keen hikers will love the Queenstown Hill and the Ben Lomond tracks. Queenstown Skiing Queenstown is home to New Zealand’s best ski fields. The Remarkables is a great family-friendly resort, while Coronet Peak is great for intermediate skiers and riders. Bungee Jump Queenstown Queenstown offers some of the best bungee jumps in the world. Choose from the original Kawarau Bridge Bungy, The Ledge Bungy, or the Nevis Bungy Swing. Jet Boat Queenstown The Shotover River is favourite attraction among thrill-seekers. Fast currents make this one of the best places in Queenstown for jet boating and white-water rafting. Hot Pools Queenstown Hot pools are an excellent way to soothe the muscles and relax after a day skiing, hiking or biking. The Onsen Hot Pools and Day Spa is just a 10 minute-drive from Queenstown. Queenstown Wineries Queenstown Lakes and Central Otago are regarded as New Zealand's premier wine regions. A visit to some of the wineries is one of the best things to do in Queenstown. Queenstown Gardens You’ll find the incredibly tranquil Queenstown Gardens at the heart of town. Offering a pleasant sanctuary, the gardens are a popular place to relax or take a stroll. Kiwi Birdlife Park The Kiwi Birdlife Park is a wildlife sanctuary displaying over 20 different species of native birds and reptiles. Visitors have the chance to get up close to wildlife during shows. Queenstown Skyline Enjoy an iconic Queenstown attraction and take the gondola up 450 metres to Bob's Peak. From the top, enjoy panoramic views of The Remarkables and Lake Wakatipu. Testimonials “The million-dollar views are coupled with immaculately clean rooms, great heating and parking right outside your room. Amazing cafe for breakfast just across the road and an easy walk down into town. ” Sue Hampshire Holiday Parks - Queenstown Lakeview “We spent three nights in our motor home here and had the best time. From the first greeting at reception to our departure. Everything was so tidy and well set out. Kids were able to cruise around and feel safe. Easy to get to town and lovely all round. We will back for sure” Van Der Heyden Family Hampshire Holiday Parks - Queenstown Lakeview Book Now Frequently Asked Questions What are your reception hours? Our current reception hours are 8.00am – 7.00pm. If you know you will be arriving after hours, please let us know. What time is check in/check out? Check in is from 3pm, check out before 10am. If you require an early check in or a late check out, please contact Reception and we will do our best to accommodate you. What happens if I need to check in after-hours? If you know you will be arriving after hours, please let us know. We can then talk you through our late arrival procedure. What is your pet policy? We allow dogs in the camping area only, dogs must remain on a lead at all times, be cleaned up after and under no circumstances be left unattended or taken into any camp buildings. Is Wi-Fi available? Yes, we have free, unlimited Wi-Fi for guests staying in our rooms and 1GB per device, per day in the camping area. What is available in the kitchen? The kitchens are fully equipped with ovens, hobs, microwaves, toasters, hot water zip and fridge freezers. It has indoor seating and tv’s. Please note, cookware and crockery are not provided but kitchen sets can be hired at reception. Are there laundry facilities? Yes, we have a laundry room with tap and go washing machine and dryers. Laundry powder is available for purchase at reception for $2.50 per sachet. Is linen available? Yes, all linen is provided in our rooms. name: inletviewskaiteriteri.wordpress.com
homepage_content: Inlet Views Kaiteriteri Skip to content Immerse yourself in native bush, birds and beaches Perfectly positioned above Kaiteriteri inlet, surrounded by native bush and chirping birds. Only a 5 minute stroll down to Kaiteriteri beach – a gateway to the beautiful Abel Tasman National Park. Explore the extraordinary scenery and wildlife of the Abel Tasman National Park, walk bush trails, kayak, swim, mountain bike, snorkel, fish, or simply lie on a golden sand beach. Enjoy a beverage and sunset at the local resturants or on your deck adjoined to your room. name: origine.nz
homepage_content: Origine Bistro by Ben Bayly • Commercial Bay, Downtown Auckland Skip to content BOOK BOOK FOOD Origine is a modern kiwi bistro showcasing local flavours with organic food produced in our kitchen garden, featuring a menu designed by award-winning New Zealand Chef Ben Bayly. BAR Join us for a drink and take in the views, explore our cellar with its comprehensive wine list, experience our local beers or one of our famous signature cocktails. EVENTS Our versatile function spaces with stunning views can host any group, from private dining, corporate lunches, cocktail parties, to weddings and everything in between! CELEBRATE NEW YEARS EVE AT ORIGINE! WINDOW SIDE 🎉 A LA CARTE 🍽️ FEAST & CHAMPAGNE 🥂 OUR STORY Located above the waterfront in downtown Auckland, Origine offers breathtaking views across Waitemata Harbour. Our menu is driven by our organic kitchen garden and reflects our relaxed bistro style and our passion for the best local produce, showcasing our love for Kiwi cuisine. VISIT Origine is open every day of the week, serving breakfast, lunch, and dinner. We also host special events as well as drinks and snacks at the bar. You can easily find us on Level 2 of the Commercial Bay complex, right in the heart of downtown Auckland. Receive Our Updates Stay in the loop and be the first to get Origine news and exclusive event updates. Intrepid Bed & Breakfast | New Zealand - Christchurch 156 Woodham Road, 8062 Christchurch, New Zealand (See map) ➤ Intrepid Bed & Breakfast | Christchurch You're eligible for a Genius discount at Intrepid Bed & Breakfast! To save at this property, all you have to do is sign in. Offering a garden and garden view, Intrepid Bed & Breakfast is set in Christchurch, 4 km from Canterbury Museum and 4.5 km from Hagley Park. The air-conditioned accommodation is 3.6 km from Christchurch Art Gallery, and guests can benefit from complimentary WiFi and private parking available on site. Featuring family rooms, this property also provides guests with a barbecue. Some of the units feature a satellite flat-screen TV, a fully equipped kitchen with a dishwasher, and a private bathroom with a walk-in shower and a hair dryer. At the bed and breakfast, certain units are equipped with a coffee machine and fruits. There is a snack bar on-site. Christchurch Railway Station is 7.5 km from the bed and breakfast, while Orana Wildlife Park is 20 km away. The nearest airport is Christchurch International Airport, 13 km from Intrepid Bed & Breakfast. The unit offers 2 beds. × Deluxe Family Room Featuring free toiletries, this family room includes a private bathroom with a walk-in shower and a hairdryer. Guests will find a stovetop, a refrigerator, a dishwasher and an oven in the kitchen. The family room also comes with a barbecue. This family room has Smartphone, flat-screen TV with streaming services, garden views, as well as chocolate for guests. The unit has 2 beds. × Double or Twin Room The unit offers 1 bed. I am travelling with a small trailer. How is the parking in the area to accommodate both car and trailer? Good Afternoon prospective guest In response to your question about off street parking availability. I have considerable offstreet parking between my two houses in order to securely house your trailer and vehicle Regards Glen Public transport. Is it available? I would be dropping off a car on arrival, then flying out when I leave Good Evening The house is located close to the local bus route around central Christchurch. Also available are Uber taxis , together with a prompt airport shuttle service Cheers Glen Property Owner hi there can you be able to confirm that a room avaliable for tomorrow night has a private bathroom ? Thank you for your enquiry regarding possible accommodation at my premises I have two bathrooms in my house and can make the rear bathroom " sole use " ., Kind Regards Glen Owner Intrepid Bed & Breakfast Hi, I am traveling by motorbike. Do you have off-street parking maybe even a bit sheltered (e.g.under a roof or similar)? Yes I can provide safe and sheltered parking for your motor bike Cheers Glen Proprietor Hello madam/sir Please can we book a room for my family for one night? Just 2 adults and 3 kids. Many Thanks for your recent accommodation enquiry For the rest of April I only have one furnished bedroom available , It has both a King bed and a single Kind Regards Glen Proprietor Hello. Can we bring our cocker spaniel puppy? Good Evening Yes your Cocker Spaniel puppy is welcome. Hello, do you have any long term options or a single professional? I am looking for about 3 months of stay starting next month, would prefer the room with private bathroom. Thank you for your recent enquiry regarding a private long term rental of one of the bedroom's that we currently tenant through Booking.com. The short answer is YES We have 2 bathrooms You can have private bathroom however it is not an ensuite hi I need one big room 1double m one single please Good Morning prospective Guest Thank you for your accommodation reservation enquiry . The family room has both a kingsize and single bed. Private bathroom but it is not an ensuite . Kind Regards Glen Owner Intrepid Bed Breakfast Christchurch Our plane does not arrive until 1145 PM . Will this be too late to arrive at yours shortly after? Good Morning Can you please advise what date you are considering staying in order that I can establish accommodation availability Thanks Glen Proprietor Intrepid Bed and Breakfast Christchurch Maybe there is a time tomorrow (Monday) that I can go there and see the room? I live nearby, around lunch time would work for me. All Good Please contact me on my mobile 021 1000049 tomorrow morning when you have finalised your time to inspect my house . Kind Regards Glen We are looking to set up a life in Christchurch and would like to find somewhere to stay for a two week minimum. Can you offer a long term deal $250? Thankyou for your enquiry for accommodation for a 2 week period .Please telephone me to finalise matters . My mobile is 021 1000049 Cheers Glen Hiya, we have a mid sized short haired well-behaved dog. Would you allow? Good Afternoon Thank you for your accommodation enquiry Yes I would permit a short haired well behaved dog. However as I have a cat your dog would need to be on a lead when he is not actually in your bedroom Cheers Glen Proprietor do u stay in the same house? Yes the elderly owner of this residential address resides in the house hi can this room host 2 adult and two young kids 1 and under please? Good Morning The Family bedroom has both a king size and a single bed. Where as the very large deluxe bedroom has a superking bed and a single, together with a dressing table , small fridge , fan and a television . Cheers Glen Intrepid B & B Hi. Are we able to check out early, we would need to leave about 6 am. No issues with an early check-out How much extra for towels and linen 2 night stay, booking 2 rooms please??. Good Morning My apologies for my delay in responding to your accommodation enquiry. There would be NO ADDITIONAL charges for linen or towels if you were booking 2 rooms. Kind Regards Glen Can we book another night if me & Graeme like to stay another night? We plan to go Dunedin 28 July 2022. Good Afternoon Francis and Graham Thanks for your enquiry I will sort this out for when you Check in on Tuesday July 26th Cheers Glen Hi, What do you mean by Towels/sheets (extra fee) are the beds not made up? and does the private bath room have a toilet in it? Thanks All Bedrooms are fully furnished . All bedding is included in the room price which includes sheets and towels. All rooms are fully made upon a guests arrival . Hopefully this answers your queries , Many Thanks Glen Owner is it shared kitchen and bathroom Good Morning My house has a fully equipped kitchen which is shared. In relation to the bathroom facilities .I have two bathrooms and showers .The larger bathroom is shared . and the smaller bathroom is exclusive . Neither bathrooms are en suites Hi i would like to rent this room for two for the second and third of October is this possible? Good Morning As at today this family room, which has both king and single beds is available on the dates you enquired about ( October 2nd and 3rd ) . Cheers Glen 100% real reviews of Intrepid Bed & Breakfast Check the opinions of our clients New Zealand Callsen 6,0 Good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Intrepid Bed & Breakfast Pleasant It was a nice stay and if your comfortable to live very close together with the owner of the B&B it was totally fine to stay there. There was lots of stuff available for breakfast and to cool wich was nice. New Zealand Rodrigo 8,0 Very good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Intrepid Bed & Breakfast Great Glen is a great host and very kind. Nothing really. Old kitchen and many expired food New Zealand Dirk 8,0 Very good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Intrepid Bed & Breakfast Hospitable The host was warm and welcoming and we had nice chats about the city and life in general. About 30 min walk to city centre which was fine for us. Just along the road to the left when you leave the property. There is another way to walk but felt less save. There was some noise from nearby road construction work in the evening and from builder next door in the morning, but they might have finished by now. New Zealand Rod 8,0 Very good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Intrepid Bed & Breakfast good value, comfortable and friendly reasonably priced, comfortable and friendly, short bus trip to town New Zealand Jacqueline 7,0 Good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Intrepid Bed & Breakfast Good value if needing a quick stay in a shared house Was good value for money. Was really one room in a shared house with the host and his flatmates. Bathroom was shared. Would probably be best not to call it a bed and breakfast since just it's just use of the cupboard food to make your own breakfast. New Zealand Colin 8,0 Very good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Intrepid Bed & Breakfast Good stay, facilities adequete and not over the top with a realistic charge. The bedroom is in the owners house. Bed was super comfortable. Bathroom was clean. You are able to help yourself and make breakfast with the food provided. Safe parking. Good wifi. You are able to lock door. Owner is a really nice guy. Accomodating. I think it would be great if there was a little sign to say ‘Intrepid Bed and Breakfast’ outside the house. We didn’t know we were in the correct place. Could do with a new pair of curtains (very minor). name: kapitiwavesbeachretreat.hotelup.top
homepage_content: Kapiti Waves Beach Retreat - Hotel in Pukerua Bay Kapiti Waves Beach Retreat 🌎 7 Ocean Parade, 5026 Pukerua Bay, New Zealand Book a room Arrival Departure Adults 1 2 3 4 5 6 Children 0 1 2 3 4 5 6 Check Availability Kapiti Waves Beach Retreat is located right on the beach in the lovely Pukerua Bay Village, with beautiful views of Kapiti Island. Guests can go for a walk on the beach or enjoy the rock pools. Grab the kayaks and go for a paddle and get close to the Stingrays playing in the late afternoon sun, only metres away from the rocky beach. The bed and breakfast is located just off SH1, 30 minutes' drive from Wellington City and Ferry Terminal. It is 15 minutes' walk from the train station which will take you to Westpac Stadium, the shops or the ferry. Kapiti Waves Beach Retreat can arrange a picnic basket for those wanting to hike 1 of the 2 trails that start at Pukerua Bay. The train is available at the end of both tracks to return back. With over a decade of service, it has become a culinary landmark in Hamilton, attracting both locals and visitors seeking flavorful and satisfying meals. Situated in the heart of Hamilton Central, Kebabs Salateen enjoys a prime location that is easily accessible to shoppers, professionals, and tourists. Its proximity to key city landmarks and the central business district makes it a convenient dining option for those exploring the vibrant streets of Hamilton. The restaurant's central position ensures that patrons can effortlessly incorporate a meal into their daily activities. Leading onto a patio with garden views, the spacious guest house consists of 1 bedroom. Offering a terrace with mountain views, this guest house also has a flat-screen TV, a well-equipped kitchenette with a microwave, a toaster, and a fridge, as well as 1 bathroom with a walk-in shower and a hair dryer. The guest house offers bed linen, towels, and laundry service. Guests can make the most of the warm weather with the property's barbecue facilities. The guest house has a picnic area where you can spend the day outdoors. Christchurch Railway Station is 15 miles from Lincoln Country Dream, while Christchurch Art Gallery is 17 miles away. name: lochsloylittleriver.co.nz
homepage_content: Home - Lochsloy farmstay WELCOME TO LOCHSLOY FARMSTAY LITTLE RIVER +64 3 325 1954 COTTAGES Snowberry Cottage A miniature home-away-from-home, Snowberry Cottage on Lochsloy Farm contains everything you need for a relaxing stay. Views from your window or deck area are over the pond, or down to Lake Wairewa Book Now Koromiko House This is the original farmhouse. It was built during the mid nineteenth century, but has been completely modernised into bed and breakfast accommodation, with a new kitchen, log burner and twin bathrooms, one with claw foot bath. Its view is down Lake Forsythe (Wairewa). Book Now Gift Card! Give the gift of relaxation in nature. Summer (October to March) or Winter (April to September). Contact us now to buy! About Us Rob & Marie live on Banks Peninsula, in the South Island of New Zealand, husband and wife for a number of years. We write, grow vegetables, labradors, chickens, sheep and sometimes make things from wool and wood. Lochsloy is a small working farm in Little River, with a bed and breakfast, sheep, chickens, and a small forestry block. You are welcome to enjoy our eighteen acres, or to explore nearby activities, such as the Rail Trail, or the many walks and hospitality the Peninsula has to offer. CONTACT US DIRECTIONS

name: lucky-kitchen.tuckerfox.co.nz
homepage_content: Lucky Kitchen | Auckland CBD | ORDER ONLINE | Takeaway | TuckerFox NZ Welcome to Lucky Kitchen PRE ORDER ONLINE Welcome to Lucky Kitchen Order Online from Lucky Kitchen Asian & Chinese Cuisine * Mid-City Arcade, Unit 2d/239 Queen St Auckland CBD, Auckland 1010 * Online Menu * Takeaway * Secure Online Payments * TOP SELLERS 虾卷 Prawn Rolls $15.80 腊味炒饭/面 Sausage & Smoked Pork Fried Rice/Noodle $20.30 TOP SELLERS 虾卷 Prawn Rolls $15.80 腊味炒饭/面 Sausage & Smoked Pork Fried Rice/Noodle $20.30 Menus PRE ORDER ONLINE Online Operating Hours Pickup LUNCH DINNER Thursday 10am to 3pm 5pm to 10pm Friday 10am to 3pm 5pm to 10pm Saturday 10am to 3pm 5pm to 10pm Sunday 10am to 3pm 5pm to 10pm Monday 10am to 3pm 5pm to 10pm Tuesday 10am to 3pm 5pm to 10pm Wednesday 10am to 3pm 5pm to 10pm REVIEWS I believe this is a Chinese dinner opening for some years. My first time visit here for a quick lunch, turns out a disappointing one. By looking at the posters on the wall, I had some expectations to my order. When it was served I was speechless because basically it's just some chopped roasted ducks soaking in a bowl red chilli oil, with a few veges, and that sells $25. If it's delicious I would totally feel okay because it's worth every penny you paid. Unfortunately, it's not the case. Well, I still finished all simply didn't want to waste my food since I already paid for it. But, there won't be a next time though. Eric Chou奧克蘭寶哥 Place: The ambience was lovely and it was clean (though I ate there during off-peak hours). Staff/Counter/Waitress: She is bubbly and helpful. She thought I don't know how to use chopsticks and so kind of her to offer me a fork. 🤣😛 Thanks miss! Food: I ordered 2 dishes, they are: 1. ND05 - Sour and spicy potato noodle (NZ$11.80) Not that bad, but not so good. Well, apart from the plum vinegar which gave the sour taste and the dried chilli with overflowing chilli oil on it that gives that spicy flavor, nothing much special with it even if there are minced pork and bean sprouts. 2. SF01 - Pork and Cabbage Fried Dumplings (NZ$14) I was surprised when I saw the dumplings as soon as it was served, the dough ends (wrapper) was light green and it smells pandan and definitely it was! Nice catch for that one but I don't think it goes really well with the filling and plum vinegar. There are 19 pieces but quite small compared to the usual and less filling inside thus what can you say with those 19 pieces, haha🤣. (PS: They just serve plum vinegar with it and when I asked for chilli and ginger, the staff said they do not have and she seemed puzzled why I will put ginger in it. Well, in my stay in Singapore, that's how they eat it and also my Chinese friends will nod to that too!) I didn't get to take photo of the dumplings because I actually forgot about it and awed with the colour. Debbie Reyes Very tasty mixure of Chinese foods. My favorites are the Chinese burger and the Chongqing xiao mian. They usually have Chinese TV shows on the TVs way too loud and if you don't speak good Chinese they tend to just take your order card and do it before you can verify some things you have ordered. As a result I have had the wrong thing more than once. David Lots of choices of Chinese food and beverages but unfortunately when I visited, there were also a lot of them marked temporary unavailable. The food did not disappoint though, good portion and very tasty. The menu is conveniently in both English and Chinese and there is a bell on each table when waiter attention is needed. Overall, the experience was pleasant and I’ll go back again to try more! Debby Wei PREV NEXT LOCATION × Average Customer Rating 3.8 I believe this is a Chinese dinner opening for some years. Kebab Kitchen Rotorua This restaurant offers a diverse menu with a focus on Turkish cuisine. They specialize in a range of delicious dishes, including Kebab Turkish Wraps, which feature succulent, well-seasoned meats wrapped in warm, fluffy flatbreads. Customers can also savor Rice Dishes that are cooked to perfection, combining flavorful rice with various toppings and ingredients. For those seeking a heartier option, the menu includes Chip Meals, providing crispy and satisfying French fries paired with a choice of protein or toppings. Additionally, diners can enhance their meals with a variety of Extras, such as sauces, dips, and other delectable sides. The restaurant offers a selection of fresh and vibrant Salads to accompany these dishes. With a combination of traditional Turkish flavors and modern twists, this eatery is a go-to destination for those looking to enjoy a diverse and satisfying Mediterranean dining experience. name: meltingpotnz.com
homepage_content: Japanese Korean Fusion | Tauranga Asian Restaurant Skip to content Tauranga Asian Restaurant - Korean & Japanse Cuisine - Asian Fusion Restaurant located in Mount Maunganui and Papamoa. Welcome We Serve Fusion Asian Food and Drink. The Melting Pot offers customers Korean-Japanese fusion food . Our menu includes donburi, curry, udon, ramen and Korean style fried chicken. In addition, we also run cafe serving various cold drinks and more. Donburi is a rice bowl dish in Japanese and it's served with fish, meat, vegetables. For people looking for one square meal, donburi is a great option. Korean style curry is a hearty, comfort food. it is lighter and kids also like it. Curry is cooked with meat and vegetables and it's served over rice. Udon and Ramen are both noodles. They are originally from Japan. Udon noodles are thicker than ramen noodles. Korean style chicken is crispy but not too greasy. We serve it with chips. If you like fried chicken, we strongly recommend our chicken dishes. No one eats it once. If you want to see our menu, click here. More About Us Hours Papamoa Monday - Saturday | 11AM - 7PM Sunday | Closed Great Location! We are located in Mount Maunganui and Papamoa Order Online! You can pre-order your food online and visit our restaurant for picking it up. Cafe! We operate cafe and serve bubble teas and other cold drinks. Donburi | Udon | Ramen | Fried Chicken | Curry Seafood Donburi Chicken Ramen Chicken Katsu Udon Chicken Katsu Curry Sweet Chilli Chicken Previous Next Papamoa 80 Parton Road, Papamoa Beach, Papamoa 3118 Scroll Up

Located at 118 Broadway, Newmarket, Auckland 1023, this elegant dessert destination is a must-visit for ice cream lovers seeking premium quality and indulgent flavors. MÃ¶venpick is globally renowned for its commitment to using natural ingredients, ensuring each scoop is crafted with pure cream, exquisite Swiss chocolate, and sun-ripened fruits. The Newmarket store presents a delightful range of flavors, from the velvety Swiss Chocolate to the refreshing Passionfruit & Mango sorbet, all made without artificial additives. Mini Homestay | New Zealand - Auckland 77 Fitzroy street Papatoetoe, 2104 Auckland, New Zealand (See map) ➤ Mini Homestay | Auckland Situated just 5.3 km from Auckland Botanic Gardens, Mini Homestay features accommodation in Auckland with access to a garden, a shared lounge, as well as a shared kitchen. This property offers access to a terrace and free private parking. The homestay has family rooms. At the homestay, the units are equipped with a outdoor furniture and a flat-screen TV. Featuring a shared bathroom with a walk-in shower and slippers, units at the homestay also feature free WiFi. At the homestay, each unit is fitted with bed linen and towels. Howick Historical Village is 12 km from the homestay, while Mount Smart Stadium is 13 km from the property. The nearest airport is Auckland Airport, 6 km from Mini Homestay. From 14:00 to 22:00 What is the check-out time at Mini Homestay ? From 04:00 to 10:00 Guests are asking... Is there an extra cost for an 8 weeks old baby? Coming from Hamilton for a wedding so would like to check in early, during the morning like 10am. Hi there, The baby under 2 years old can sleep on the same bed with parents or on his/her separate bed with a fee of $12/night. We can provide early checkin depending on the checkout time of previous night guests. For your case, we can offer early check how far to train station? Hi, It takes 5 minutes drive to Papatoetoe train station. Regards, Tarcy do you have shuttle bus Hi, we do not have shuttle bus however you can use Air bus, very convenient and cheap. Kind regards Tracy hiya, does the use of kitchen etc come with the rooms ? Hi, yes, it's Regards, Tracy Can I ring you today if so what is your number we have a reservation for 1st to the 4th Hi, yes. thank you Tracy Is there a TV in the room to watch the 6 0 clock news or is it the shared TV in the lounge, Thanks? HI, yes there is a TV inside the room. Kind regards, Tracy Hi Tracy, we are coming to Auckland for a family funeral. As the funeral is at 2pm in Pukekohe is there any chance we can book in at 12pm? Hi there, We can arrange an early checkin for you around 12:00-13:00. Kind regards, TRacy Hi, can I book for tonight please Hi there, Yes, it's Regards, TRacy hi there my name is Puti we are booked in for tonight just needing Tracys mobile number Hi there, Hi, im wanting to make a booking 25-27/06 8adults & 4kids. Would we be sharing with others? & is it extra cost for under 1s? Hi, The house has 5 bedrooms & 3 bathrooms. Currently we have 2 gentlemen in the house. So your group will share bathrooms/kitchen with them. They are very quiet and polite. The house is large and beautiful so your group will be very comfortable. Hello please can a booking only tonight I’m finish at 9 tonight please Hi, yes, it's fine. Thanks Tracy Is there (free) luggage storage available if we book the hostel for one night each at the beginning and end of our trip in New Zealand and want to leave our large suitcases in the Homestay? HI, yes we provide free luggage storage. Kind regards, Tracy Our flight arrives at 11.45pm, would this be too late to check in at your accommodation ? Thank you Hi there, Yes, I can arrange self checkin for you. Thank you Tracy Hi There, We would like to know if, we have negative test results received today for one adult and a kid above 12 with only one vaccination for both of them then, would they be allowed in your accommodation? Beyond these 2 people's we have 3 adults with v Hi there, We are happy to offer accommodation to your group as you mentioned. Thank you. Tracy wheelchair accessible Hi there, yes our homestay is wheelchair accessible. Thanks Tracy is this available in january yes, it is Hi there, are we able to checkin around 9am pleas? Hi there, The guest of previous night will checkout at 10am. So the earliest time we can arrange for your checkin is after 11am. Please contact TRacy 022 4666479 to have more details. Kind regards, Tracy Are there nearby shops and restaurants in walking distance? Hi there, The takeaway, bread shop and dairy shop are 4-5 minutes walk. New World supper market and lots of food shops, pizza are 15-20 minutes walk. Thanks Tracy hi, we're on a flight that lands at 5am in Auck, would we be able to check in at 6am if pay for the night before? (land 5am 23rd, pay for 22nd night?) Hi there, Yes you can book and checkin as you mentioned. Thanks Tracy Planning to book on 17th to 18th of this month, Just wondering if I only need a negative covid test before coming as I haven’t been fully vaccinated including kids Also is there any other payment that needs to be made on arrival I have 2 kids one i Hi there, A negative test is fine with us. The payment will be made on arrival at the property. A small extra charge for the kids. THanks Tracy 100% real reviews of Mini Homestay Check the opinions of our clients New Zealand Mapu 8,0 Very good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Mini Homestay Have recommended to other family members already. Short stay was relaxing and comfortable The maintenance of all common areas; kitchen/bathroom were exceptional. Very satisfying to see the hygiene standards were excellent! Although a bit of a mix up with the room booking for first night, we felt secure with the extra security of having cameras in all main common areas - were able to leave room doors open when popping out for a few minutes. Felt safe When others 'stomped' around like herd of elephants - some people just are not aware of how heavy-footed they are, but this is to be expected given the amount of travelers that came through the mini-homestay while we were there Denmark Susanne 9,0 Very good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Mini Homestay Wonderful Nice and cleen Place. The host was friendly and accommodating. Nothing. Canada Tracy 8,0 Very good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Mini Homestay Very Good Very spacious bedrooms and kitchen. The bathrooms were very up to date with nice showers. New Zealand Radha 7,0 Good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Mini Homestay Was great night Everything Everything Spain Alexandra 8,0 Very good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Mini Homestay Nice service and facilities The situation, so close to the airport. Good WiFi and facilities I found it expensive United States of America Kathryn 8,0 Very good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Mini Homestay Mini Homestay They let us check in early which was very helpful. It was a shared house which I didn't understand when I reserved it. It was fine but not my favorite way to travel. The owner and the other guests were nice. It was not the most expensive so we probably got what we paid for. The sunrooms was nice. There were kitchen facilities. We used the refrigerator but I didn't feel super comfortable cooking there. There were three bathroom all with showers that were very nice. I am not a fan of sharing living space with strangers. If that doesn't bother you the place was great. A but old and out dated export the bathrooms, they seemed new. They were very nice. United States of America Pleh 7,0 Good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Mini Homestay Good Fan The bed France Isabelle 9,0 Very good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Mini Homestay Wonderful Very conveniently located, a short bus ride to and from the airport at a fantastic price. Friendly welcome, very clean and comfy. Free tea and coffee. If you don't have a car, it's really not close to any restaurant. There's a rather greasy take-away nearby and that's all. But the excellent value for the l8cation really make up for it. New Zealand Chanchal 7,0 Good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Mini Homestay Ni e Nice The rooms should have AC and heater . When we enter house there was very bad smell of cooking sea food or meat. We are vegetarian. They should consider for every kind of guest . Germany Scherr 7,0 Good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Mini Homestay Good It’s a good opportunity to stay the night after arriving in Auckland. - New Zealand Esha 9,0 Very good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Mini Homestay Will stay again Everything was perfect Nothing United Kingdom Caoimhe 9,0 Very good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Mini Homestay Wonderful Great location near the airport for our early morning flight with free private parking and the kitchen was well stocked with everything we needed for cooking. We got a free upgrade to a bigger room for 3 people which we really appreciated. Czech Republic Katerina 8,0 Very good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Mini Homestay Very Good Good location if you need to go to the airport. The whole house was super cold!!! There was no heating system, we took all the blankets we found in our room but it was still cold. We could hear the other guests talking in the room next to us. China Huijia 9,0 Very good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Mini Homestay very nice homestay the location is very good, it is very convenient for people to go to the airport! room is very clean and have a TV. nil New Zealand Mia 9,0 Very good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Mini Homestay Very homely, great price. Will definitely stay here again. Great experience. Host was friendly. Place was amazing. Clean. Showers were great. Definitely be back. New Zealand Ninagastreich 8,0 Very good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Mini Homestay Just a few thoughts to improve Like the location in proximity to where I was working. Easy parking off the road. Clean rooms and really comfortable beds. Had all what was necessary. Great space for outside sitting Easy to communicate with management Would stay again Nobody really visible as office staff/staff as no office hours in the stay, [but mobile contact option which was great], Very few crockery and cutlery items for all visitors to go round, bring your own for specific Didn't find the house locked at anytime-question security-has cameras on grounds though. During my stay, I had a few noisy guests after quiet times. Nothing that the owners could check, I suppose. New Zealand Ann 7,0 Good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Mini Homestay it was a place to stay loved the old house beautiful floors. the bathrooms weee lovely. floor were noisy hearing everyone walking around.. beds were really hard Malaysia Kerri 9,0 Very good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Mini Homestay Wonderful Property very clean Host very friendly Kitchen very good none United Kingdom Adam 7,0 Good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Mini Homestay Nice staff but needs all new linen and furniture Great facilities, large rooms and large kitchen area. The furniture and bedding was really outdated. Pillows were more like couch cushions and there was no heating in the room available. The road was incredibly noisy too. New Zealand Viv 7,0 Good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Mini Homestay Good I liked the space, numbers of bathrooms, and cleanliness. The people were friendly too. It was cold. name: naumainz.studyinnewzealand.govt.nz
homepage_content: Home | NauMai NZ NAUMAI NZ 'Nau mai' is a Māori phrase of invitation and welcome. As an international student this is your place to learn about Aotearoa New Zealand, find the information and advice you need, and connect with and explore your new home away from home. Join the community Create goals for your time in New Zealand Video Learn about Māori culture What can we help you with? Studying in New Zealand To make this time as valuable as possible for you, we have put together a bit of a knowledge base. Here you'll find anything from what you need to know 'Before your arrival', the general 'Study experience' and also why you should 'Create goals' during your time here. Studying from overseas Distance learning means you can study for a globally recognised qualification that will enable you to succeed in your career while remaining in your home country. You can also enjoy the benefits of a more flexible schedule by joining a global community of online learners. Health and wellbeing Your health & wellbeing are very important to a healthy life. Find out how to stay happy, healthy and safe as an international student in New Zealand. Discover New Zealand Discover cities & regions of New Zealand, aspects of life & culture as well as what it is like living and working in Aotearoa. More NauMai NZ has more to offer. Here you can join our community and connect with other international students, find helpful tips to get started and learn about NauMai NZ. Aotearoa Explore a region Auckland Christchurch Dunedin Hamilton Invercargill Napier-Hastings Nelson New Plymouth Palmerston North Queenstown Rotorua Tauranga Wellington Whanganui Whangarei Join the community Goals to create during your time in Aotearoa Get a part time job Do you want to get career experience, meet new people or learn about New Zealand workplace culture? Whatever your answer, here are a few things you can do to get that part time job! Improve English language skills Do you know there are small things you can do every day to improve your English language skills? You'll be surprised at how much you can achieve in a short amount of time. Learn about Māori culture Do you know Māori culture and language are essential to the identity of modern day Aotearoa, New Zealand? Learn how our indigenous culture shaped our past and inspires our future. Make new friends Do you want to meet people to share experiences and have fun with? There are some easy things you can do today to start building relationships. Live like a local What does 'live like a local' mean to you? Finding cool places to eat, knowing clever ways to save money or feeling at home in your new city or town? Whatever your answer, here's a few things you can do to make progress – fast!

name: lotusindianhavelock.co.nz
homepage_content: Lotus Indian Takeaways Albany Auckland | Order Online at 12/21-23 Corinthian Drive Welcome To Lotus Indian Takeaways Order Online Welcome To Lotus Indian Takeaways Order Online Previous Next Entree Explore a world of taste with our diverse range of entrees Mains Elevating mains to an art form, one plate at a time Contact Us Questions, comments, or just want to say hi? Contact us! About Us Welcome to Lotus Indian Takeaways Lotus Garden Restaurant, nestled in the heart of Havelock North, New Zealand, invites diners on a culinary journey through the flavors of the East. Located at 14 Te Mata Road, this gem of a restaurant offers a serene and inviting atmosphere, perfect for a relaxing meal with family and friends. With a focus on authentic Asian cuisine, Lotus Garden boasts a menu that tantalizes taste buds with a diverse selection of dishes, ranging from traditional favorites to innovative creations. Whether you're craving the bold spices of Szechuan cuisine, the delicate flavors of Japanese sushi, or the aromatic herbs of Thai dishes, there's something to satisfy every palate. The restaurant's commitment to using fresh, locally sourced ingredients ensures that each dish bursts with vibrant flavors and wholesome goodness. Accompanied by impeccable service and a warm ambiance, dining at Lotus Garden is an experience to savor. Whether you're seeking a casual dinner or a special celebration, Lotus Garden Restaurant promises a memorable dining experience that transports you to the bustling streets of Asia, right in the heart of Havelock North. Genuinely one of the nicest butter chicken's I've ever had. I also attribute it to eating around some really important people in my life kaia thompson Lovely people, food is quality and great service. These guys will make the meal exactly how you want it. Give them a try. Paul in Havelock. Paul Bucks Outstanding Indian food - authentic in flavour and presentation. The best in the Village! Neil McCorkell Review Us Contact Us 14 Te Mata Road, Havelock North 4130, New Zealand 06 877 1999 Opening Hours Monday: 11:30am - 1:30pm, 4:15pm - 9:00pm Tuesday & Sunday: 4:15pm - 9:00pm Wednesday To Saturday: 11:30am - 1:30pm, 4:15pm - 9:00pm Â© all rights reserved. homepage_content: New Day Cafe & Indian Restaurant Entree Main Contact Us New Day Cafe & Indian Restaurant This restaurant offers a delicious selection of entrees, rice dishes, desserts, and chicken meals. Customers can enjoy a variety of entrees such as beef or vegetarian Malai Kofta, Butter Paneer, or Mixed Vegetable. The restaurant also offers a range of flavorful rice dishes including classic Basmati Rice or Zeera Rice. For dessert, customers can indulge in sweet treats such as Gulab Jamun or Mango Kulfi. The star of the menu, however, is the mouthwatering chicken dishes, including Butter Chicken, Chicken Korma, or Chicken Jalfrezi. Whether you're in the mood for a hearty meal or a sweet indulgence, this restaurant has something to satisfy every craving. name: nzcamping.com
homepage_content: Caroline’s outback camping ground | The New Zealand Camping Guide This website requires JavaScript! Please enable JavaScript in your browser and reload the page! Caroline’s Outback Camping Ground Google Rating (out of 5): 4.4 Review Summary: Caroline’s Outback Camping Ground offers a serene getaway surrounded by stunning landscapes. Customers on platforms like Google Reviews and TripAdvisor have highlighted the peaceful atmosphere and well-maintained facilities. Many appreciate the friendly staff who provide helpful tips about local hikes and sights. The camping spots are spacious, allowing for a more private experience. On the downside, some visitors have noted that WiFi is limited, which can be a drawback for those wanting to stay connected. Others mentioned that road access could be tricky during wet conditions. Overall, Caroline\'s provides a charming camping experience for nature lovers, though improvements in connectivity would enhance the stay. Last Update: 29/04/2025 Google Reviews Link: Google Reviews Link Address: 181 Somme Parade, Aramoho, , Whanganui, Manawatu, North Island DESCRIPTION: The camp is directly behind the Caroline's Boatshed Bar and E atery and TAB and beside the river and the railway line. The cluster of permanent living caravans and house buses, and the back yard bits and pieces around the place give the camp a lived-in, rather than a holiday feel. The ablutions and kitchen are basic. Bruce is the on-site manager. homepage_content: Hearing Tests and Checks | Hearing Aids | Upper Hutt & Wairarapa Hearing Tests, Services and Hearing Aids Local personalised hearing care, continuity and support Clinics in Upper Hutt and Carterton Hearing Tests & Assessments FREE 30 min hearing check Full hearing tests and assessments Civil aviation assessments Hearing Aids, Fittings & Accessories Now available – $0 hearing aids Hearing aids and fittings Hearing aid accessories and batteries Assistive listening devices Hearing Support Services Access funding for hearing aids Hearing aid repairs and retuning Ear moulds Ear wax removal by micro-suction Our Google Reviews Excellent Oracle Hearing Limited Based on 46 reviews See all reviews review us on Joel C. I was able to book an appointment the same day I enquired and the staff were welcoming and friendly. Shantanu was efficient and competent and talked me through everything he was doing, as well as explaining how I can continue to look after my ear health. Will definitely recommend to others 😊 Edwin C. Great service and people - Will continue to use Oracles services. Sue W. Great place to go even if you just want some reassurance or have questions. Felt in safe hands. The hearing aid service was comprehensive and I feel I can go back with any queries in the future. ropeti T. Shantanu and the team were amazing, easy friendly service and very professional. I visited for an ear check and wax suction which has made a world of difference in my hearing, I highly recommend to all! Karen W. I had a hearing test and based on Shantanu recommendations I got hearing aids. The whole process felt thorough and professional without the hard sell I had experienced elsewhere. I found it easy to ask questions and was able to make more appointments for follow ups when required. Highly recommended. Loisetta F. I was was having some issues with my hearing I was always turning my TV up so high could not hear good out of my right ear hear a little out of my left so I decided to try aracle 2.0 I am so glad I did my hearing is much better now I was always writing my appointment down wrong but my life has changed now I have a nice time watching my TV and don't have to pick my remote to adjust it all time a great price 99:00 for a pair they are awesome I a thinking about getting another pair for backup. invade I loose they are very conformable to wear I would not trade mine every one that get them love that why I got mine I read the reviews before I got them I highly recommended them to anyone if you are having issues with your hearing they are on sale now. Andrew D. Have been before and very satisfied with results. Unfortunately this time tried to make an appointment and was told nothing available after 4pm. Ken G. I had a fantastic experience with Oracle Hearing Upper Hutt. Shantanu and Minoti were both friendly and very knowledgeable. They made the process of getting my new hearing aid actually quite enjoyable. After support has been good also with Shantanu helping fix up a minor issue that I was having with a blocked filter. Highly recommend. Marco M. It was my first time doing an earwax removal, and all I can say is that it was fast, not painful at all and really pleasant! And the prices are super convenient!!! Recommended Tracey and Craig S. Very good service. I use their ear wax removal service and its very quick and efficient. I would highly recommend them. Now Available – $0 Hearing Aids For those that are eligible for the Government Hearing Aid subsidy. Our team will help you apply and access this funding. Book Now! Your free hearing check Our Approach At Oracle Hearing we take great pride in providing a professional and friendly service. Our aim is to help you get the very best from your hearing. Our small team of specialists will take the time to understand your hearing concerns, and undertake the appropriate diagnostic tests to determine the best solution for your situation. With the latest in hearing aid technology, our high-quality audiology service, combined with our latest testing equipment, we can advise and assist you on your journey… for a better quality of life through improved hearing. Why choose us… it’s all about our care A small family-based, local business providing the utmost in expertise and care. Continuity of care with the same clinician. We take the time to listen, understand your concerns, and tailor our service to meet your specific requirements. Providing a friendly and caring practice, that offers excellent service at reasonable prices. We truly understand the importance of having quality hearing, and how it impacts on all aspects of your life. Access funding for hearing aids Why is maintaining your hearing so important? Hearing well is integral to our well-being. It allows us to communicate with the people around us and connects us to our environment. Hearing loss can happen due to several factors, the most common of which is ageing and the other is exposure to loud noise. An untreated hearing loss may be detrimental to our health. It can lead to a sense of isolation and reduced social contact. It can significantly affect the quality of our life. Research also indicates that there is an association between hearing loss and dementia. When is it time to get your hearing tested? Often hearing loss happens gradually over a number of years so we often don’t realise that we are not hearing as well. Here are some key indicators for you, as a quick self-assessment: You are concerned that you are not hearing as well as you used to. You need to turn up the volume on your TV or radio while others in the room complain that it’s too loud. Your family and friends are making comments about your hearing. It sounds like people are mumbling. You have to ask people to repeat what they said. You are having difficulties hearing during meetings at work. You are finding it difficult to hear in situations where more than one person speaks at a time. If some of the statements above apply to your situation, please contact us to arrange your free 30-minute Level 1 quick hearing test. Contact us today The solution may be easy | Hearing Aids The solution may be easy… With the latest modern range of hearing aids and devices you may be pleasantly surprised at how well it restores your gift of hearing. No more loud TVs, improved ability to easily communicate and socialise with your family and friends. At Oracle Hearing we take the time to assess your hearing requirements and will guide you on the best hearing solutions to improve your quality of life and lifestyle. Talk to us today to arrange your free 30-minute Level 1 quick hearing check We offer a wide range of modern hearing aids and hearing devices. Hearing devices to assist with TV viewing, phone conversations, plus other lifestyle requirements. Custom Fitted and Programmed: Modern hearing aids are custom fitted to suit the type of your hearing loss plus the shape of your ear canal. The output of the hearing aid is also measured and adjusted at various frequencies of sound. Book Now – Your free 30 minute hearing check We can help you access funding from various agencies: Disability Support Services Hearing Aid Subsidy Scheme Disability Support Services Hearing Aid funding Scheme ACC (Accident Compensation Corporation) for Noise Induced Hearing loss, Hearing loss due to medical misadventure or hearing loss due to trauma. Veterans Affairs WINZ may sometimes assist with the purchase of a hearing aids via interest-free loans

name: paradiseonthestrand.com
homepage_content: Paradise on the Strand | Oceanside, CA Luxury Beach House Rental PARADISE ON THE STRAND Oceanside, CA Beach House Rental  Oceanfront  6br & 6.5ba  Sleeps 14 Book Now PARADISE ON THE STRAND Oceanside, CA Beach House Rental  Oceanfront  6br & 6.5ba  Sleeps 14 Luxury At The Beach Stunning Oceanfront Home w/ Rooftop Spa & Dual Master Suites Paradise on The Strand is by far the most spacious vacation rental in Oceanside. This 5,168 sqft 3-level home features an elevator for ease of use and contemporary style architecture beautifully furnished and decorated. Located just across a one-way street from the beach, the endless ocean views will mesmerize you. It’s the perfect spot to watch the sunset or turn on the fiber optic lighting after dark for ultimate relaxation. Featuring custom paintings by local Oceanside artist Mark Jesinoski, the house welcomes you with splashes of color inviting you into the oceanfront retreat. Dual Master Suites The upper level master bedroom has amazing ocean views through the soundproofed glass wall that overlooks the living room below. Rooftop Deck & Spa Relax on the rooftop deck while soaking in the 6 person Caldera spa listening to your favorite music through the Bluetooth capable speakers. Guest Suites We have your comfort in mind with luxury linens on dreamy king size beds, blackout drapes, Samsung flat screen TVs, and cove lighting. Yellow Suite Features a beautiful view of the ocean and Oceanside Pier, a full bathroom with shower, a closet, a Smart TV, and a stylish ceiling fan. Plum Suite Decorated with a beautiful sunset picture and accents in shades of purple with a full bathroom with tub/shower combo, a large walk in closet, a Smart TV, and a unique ceiling fan. Upper Level Kids Room The kids will love hanging out in the upper level kids room with 2 bunk beds, each with twin on top and full futon on bottom sleeping 4 and a TV with Blu-ray DVD player. Main Level Bunk Room Features a full size memory foam mattress on the bottom and a twin mattress on top, an armoire and drawers for storage, and a balcony with a peek-a-boo ocean view. Gourmet Kitchen This kitchen will bring out the chef in you with all the best tools and Viking appliances to create amazing meals with service for 16 or more. Dual Tech Desk Large office area with easy and free high speed WiFi connection and printer lets you take care of business in style. Ocean Deck Watch for dolphins, whales, surfers, and stars while you unwind around the fire table with seating for 6 on the patio or BBQ and watch the interesting people and cars pass by on The Strand. “Just as advertised! Could not imagine being in a nicer house so near the ocean! Would recommend highly!” atspeed / Feb. 2021 “This house is an amazing location and utterly unique. Tons of great interior well kept space. A great area to lunge cook and just watch waves and surfers. We loved it.” Nicholas C. / Dec. 2020 “We were celebrating our new marriage together with immediate family and friends. We loved the location, the house is beautiful and the views are to die for! Lots of beach equipment in the storage outside which we were pleasantly surprised to find!” Amanda P. / Sep. 2020 “This is such a great home. Super clean and extremely well stocked. Could not have asked for more. Monique was great!” Donna B. / Jan. 2021 “This was the best property we have stayed at. The house was fully equipped with everything we needed. Monique was wonderful to work with. Would love to stay here again!” Sirarpi O. / Oct. 2020 “Our entire family loved the stay at this home. It was so wonderful to wake up and go to bed listening to the ocean. We spent each morning enjoying our coffee on the balcony and watching the waves and dolphins. The home was very clean and had everything we needed. Our family will be back again!” Erika B. / Sep. 2020 Amenities  No Smoking  Elevator  Heater & A/C  Children Welcome  High-Speed Wifi  Hot Tub  TV / Cable  Washer & Dryer  Garage Parking Safety Features Safe Fire extinguisher Exterior lighting First aid kit Carbon monoxide detector Smoke detector Deadbolt lock General Telephone Local and domestic long distance service available from land line. Air Conditioning Heating Linens Provided 700-1000 thread count luxurious bedding for all king beds including duvet covered comforters and coverlets. Twins and full beds have high thread count sheets and blankets. Washing Machine 2 LG High Efficiency Steam Washers. One on the main level and one on upper level. Clothes Dryer 2 LG High Efficiency Steam Dryers. One on the main level and one on upper level. Fireplace Parking 3 parking spaces in the garage for vehicles up to 6’6″. 1 EV charger. Garage 3 car garage *maximum height 6.5′ Internet Free high speed Wi-Fi and wireless printer Towels Provided Luxurious towels for all bathrooms and beach towels for all guests provided Safe Wireless Internet Iron & Board Hair Dryer Paper Towels Shampoo Basic Soaps Toilet Paper Elevator Living Room Plush leather sectional, 60′ flat screen tv with surround sound, electric fireplace, ceiling fan, and sliding glass doors to the patio. EV car charger Dining Seating for 16 People Dining Area Dining Glass top dining table with 5 microfiber chairs and bench seat for 5 with additional barstool seating for 6 at center island. Outside Balcony Balconies off of Main Level Master and Main Level Bunk room. Beach Chairs Beach Towels Deck/Patio Breathtaking views with seating for 6 around a propane fire table with BBQ and sun umbrella. Outdoor Furniture Fire pit Location Type Waterfront Ocean views from almost every room. Beach View Just steps away from the sand. Beachfront / Ocean View Dolphins, seals, whales, surfers. Just a few things you may see. Oceanfront Location, Location, Location! Water View Watch the waves crash on the rocks at high tide. Kitchen Dishwasher High efficiency European style dishwasher Refrigerator French door refrigerator with inline filtered water dispenser and bottom drawer freezer with icemaker Stove 5 burner gas stove Oven Double ovens Microwave Center island drawer microwave Grill Coffee Maker Keurig coffee maker 12 cup coffee maker french press coffee maker Toaster Cuisinart toaster oven Blender Coffee Grinder Ice Maker Lobster Pot Pantry Items Essential supplies provided Dishes & Utensils Service for 16 Kitchen Fully equipped with top of the line Viking appliances and service for 16 or more Kettle Entertainment Television Samsung Smart TVs Satellite/Cable DVD Player Blu-ray DVD players in the Media room, Living room, Upstairs master and upstairs Bunk room. Games Various card games, board games, puzzles and books in the hall closet. Games for Kids Music Library All TV’s are equipped with Samsung Smarthub feature for apps like Pandora, Spotify, etc. Toys Sand toys Boogie boards (4) Video Library All TV’s are equipped with Samsung Smarthub feature for apps like Netflix, Hulu, Amazon, etc. Access many movies on our Amazon Prime account. Video Games Sony PlayStation 4 & Xbox One with a few games and 4 controllers each. Onsite Services Massage Private Chef Concierge Housekeeper Optional The house is located on S. The Strand which is a one way street that is an easy walk to downtown Oceanside and the pier. The Strand is alive with excitement and in the middle of all the action. The street is excellent for walking, jogging, bike riding, rollerblading, skateboarding, people & dolphin watching! At high tide the waves can crash on the rocks. We recently converted the planter box in front of the house to a sandbox. At low tide there is plenty of sand to play on right in front of the house. Just a 5 minute walk closer to the pier and there is sand to play on at any time. There is also a park with play structure for kids and lots of grass and very close to the pier, another play structure right in the sand! The Beach Is Calling Book Your Stay! Make Paradise on The Strand your next home away from home and you’ll understand why we call it Paradise … Book Now Reach Out (760) 277-7875 Name Email Address Message Send Message BOOK NOW

name: pieceacakenz.blogspot.com
homepage_content: Piece a Cake skip to main | skip to sidebar Piece a Cake Monday, January 11, 2010 This cake was 3 different flavoured tiers, choc mud, caramel mud and vanilla. The two bottom layers had dark choc ganache underneath the RTR icing and the vanilla had white choc gananche. The finished effect was very elegant and the bride said it was beautiful. Posted by Piece a Cake at 1/11/2010 No comments: This gorgeous white choc mud cake was made for one of my best friends Julie for her 40th birthday. She is a big fan of yellow roses and so it was a perfect choice for her. I was really pleased with the outcome and so was she! Posted by Piece a Cake at 1/11/2010 No comments: Sunday, December 13, 2009 Poker cake This cake was made for a young guy that is into poker. His Mum brought me a B&W pic for a cake that she had goggled. I was pretty pleased with the outcome and had fun doing it. Hope the birthday boy enjoyed it!! Cheers Tracy Posted by Piece a Cake at 12/13/2009 No comments: Terry's 60th cake I love this cake and so did Terry's wife. The horse was on the invitations so I transferred it (took me 3 attempts to ice it!!) The red icing was from Sandra at KiwiCakes, Bakels brand, so I din't have to colour it which was a god-send! Always fun to do something a bit different Cheers Tracy Posted by Piece a Cake at 12/13/2009 No comments: Wednesday, December 9, 2009 I made this cake for a lovely young lady for her 21st, looked really pretty with some of the edible glitter sprinkled on the stars (bit hard to see in the pic) Thanks to Sandra from Kiwicakes I now seem to be back 'online' with making posts!! Busy busy with lots a cakes at the mo and counting down those days till Christmas. Cheers Tracy Posted by Piece a Cake at 12/09/2009 1 comment: Tuesday, November 10, 2009 Well last week was hectic with our birthday celebrations. The articles in Scene mag and The Leader were both great and have certainly brought lots of new faces through the doors which was great to see. We gave away lots of cake, coffee and gorgeous cookies to our lucky customers, and everyone was very appreciative. All my staff performed outstandingly and I was very proud of them. The week finished with me having 4 cakes to ice on Friday, WOW what a way to finish the week! I've been having fun with the cupcakes this week decorating them and using some of the fantastic edible glitter that I got from Kiwicakes, the colours are AMAZING! And the chocolate wrap that I'm now getting the hang of is very cool. There are so many 'toys' out there to buy if you are into cake decorating. Who needs clothes and shoes??? LOL Tracy Posted by Piece a Cake at 11/10/2009 No comments: Sunday, November 1, 2009 Our 1st Birthday I can't believe that we have been at the cafe for a year! It has gone so fast, filled with lots of highs (and some lows!). Posted by Piece a Cake at 11/01/2009 No comments: Older Posts Home Subscribe to: Comments (Atom) Followers About Me Piece a Cake Whangarei, Northland, New Zealand Hi my name is Tracy and along with my husband Neil, we own Piece a Cake, a Cafe and Cake Specialist store in Whangarei. I am a trained pastry chef having competed 2 years fulltime study at AUT in Auckland, coming top of my class both years! We opened the cafe in Oct 2008. My passion is good food (and wine) but I particularly love baking and decorating cakes. Ask those around me, I show my love through food! I love creating cakes for people and seeing their reaction when they come to pick it up. WOW!! is usually what they say, it gives me a great sense of satisfaction. Check out my photos of some of my work and don't hesitate to call into the Cafe or give me a call. Cheers Tracy View my complete profile Subscribe To Posts Atom Posts All Comments Atom All Comments

Million Dollar View | New Zealand - Auckland 33 London Street St Marys Bay, 1011 Auckland, New Zealand (See map) ➤ Million Dollar View | Auckland Set in Auckland and only less than 1 km from Masefield Beach, Million Dollar View offers accommodation with sea views, free WiFi and free private parking. This holiday home features air-conditioned accommodation with a terrace. The property is non-smoking and is situated 1.2 km from Hamilton Beach Reserve. The holiday home is located on the ground floor and is fitted with 1 bedroom, a flat-screen TV with streaming services and a fully equipped kitchen that provides guests with a dishwasher, an oven, a washing machine, a microwave and a toaster. Towels and bed linen are offered in the holiday home. For added privacy, the accommodation has a private entrance and soundproofing. In the warmer months, you can make use of the barbecue facilities and dine on the private balcony. Guests at the holiday home can enjoy fishing nearby, or make the most of the garden. Popular points of interest near Million Dollar View include Sentinel Beach, SKYCITY Auckland Convention Centre and Sky Tower. The nearest airport is Auckland Airport, 22 km from the accommodation. Hi, we’re staying in Auckland night on Friday 16th April in our own campervan (7m long) Do you still have space available for campervans that night? Hi there - yes we do have space for you. Not sure how you found us on this portal! Please confirm that you will stay here and I will block it out. How can I get to the closest beach from the property? The closest beach where you can swim, is about a 15 min walk from our house. 100% real reviews of Million Dollar View Check the opinions of our clients United Kingdom Martyn 9,0 Very good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Million Dollar View A good place to vase yourself for exploring Auckland The location and the view The traffic noise from the motorway below Germany Ute 9,0 Very good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Million Dollar View Beautiful accommodation in a nice area of Auckland, but permanent noise from motorway-like road The view, of course, was really outstanding, the house was well equipped and furnished with a cat to cuddle and care for, if you liked. The 'old English' style surroundings were great, with nice restaurants and shopping nearby. The house is situated above a very busy motorway-like road, which runs right between the marina area and the originally very beautiful and quiet housing area. Used to quiet surroundings we were not happy with the permanent noise, particularly at night. Australia Eric 10,0 Excellent Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Million Dollar View Relaxation on a busy city Location Location Location. And the view. It was so relaxing. Just like a home. It was very hot in Auckland and the AirCon struggled to distribute cool air to the rest of the house. India Sidhantjain 8,0 Very good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Million Dollar View great views the views were fantastic, the house is done up in a very beautiful way. we were provided with very stale bread and spoilt eggs in the "breakfast supplies" Macau Ying 10,0 Excellent Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Million Dollar View A wonderful holiday! A very lovely and comfortable house to stay like home United States of America Jadson 10,0 Excellent Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Million Dollar View beautiful stay with an incredible view in a great location for a very reasonable price the view was sensational nothing United States of America Maria 6,0 Good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Million Dollar View Good view, great kitty, great location, but price was too high for the space Great location! Wasps on the balcony, so we couldn’t use it, and their sweet kitty Ruby was locked out of the house. There’s no mention of her in the description of the house and we were concerned about her safety. It was wonderful to have her inside with us!! However, I could see some guests being uncomfortable with allergies and keeping her outside in the cold. There was a cockroach in the fridge but we killed it. name: raylandmotel.hhotelss.com
homepage_content: Rayland Motel - Hotel in Auckland Rayland Motel 🌎 12 Lakewood Court, 2241 Auckland, New Zealand Book a room Arrival Departure Adults 1 2 3 4 5 6 Children 0 1 2 3 4 5 6 Check Availability Reliable info:Guests say the description and photos for this property are accurate. Rayland Motel is located in Manukau City, next to Rainbow's End and Westfield Shopping Mall. It is a 15-minute drive from Auckland city center and 10 minutes from Auckland International Airport. There is a good choice of spacious studios and larger, family units. All units have kitchen facilities and private bathrooms. The family apartments are split-level and offer a separate living area. WiFi access is available. The motel offers free parking. There are restaurants and a cinema within walking distance of the motel. After hours check-in can be arranged, strictly upon prior arrangement. Couples in particular like the location – they rated it 8.0 for a two-person trip. New Zealand Anonymous 8,0 Very good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Poolside Haven Approachable hosts. Very clean and comfortable room with lovely aspect. New Zealand Anonymous 10,0 Excellent Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Poolside Haven Our stay was wonderful and exceeded our expectations. United Kingdom Gael 8,0 Very good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Poolside Haven Michelle was a very pleasant host. Room was large and bed was very comfortable. I understand the problems with cooking facilities so not suggesting that - just a box of cereal and a toaster with a couple of pieces of bread would suffice. Or even a couple of bowls and plates so you could provide your own food but still eat something before leaving. We required an extra roll away bed which was provided with a full mattress (not a thin one as is usual on a roll away bed) and made for a very comfortable stay. The area was very quiet and felt very safe. Location is super convenient, close to the train station. Accommodation is modern, warm and fresh. Very clean and well presented. Didn't realise that there was no TV or cooking facilities, would have expected them when you are booking what amounts to a 3 bedroom house. Bed in the middle room was very uncomfortable. Germany David 7,0 Good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Restawhile It was clean and nicely decorated. It had 3 bedrooms, good for a family. Very good value and was quiet. Thanks New Zealand Carolyn 8,0 Very good Purpose of trip: Leisure trip What would you highlight about Restawhile The place on the whole was very comfy, very welcoming There were four of us staying in a three bedroom unit and there was only enough hot water for two quick showers. Restawhile is a house with 3 bedrooms. Two double beds and one king size single. One and a half bathrooms. The cleaniless is exceptional as are the hosts Tight parking space. It's a room in this guys house. It feels like you're instantly his roommate, so it's very comfortable. He has a cupboard of food he shares with all visitors and he upgraded our room because the room we had booked - the people before us had extended their stay. That was very nice of him! Also, I've never seen a place so cheap before! great price! I honestly didn't care too much but this is his HOME. name: ripecoffee.com
homepage_content: Small Batch – Ripe Skip to content Cart Search for: Press Enter / Return to begin your search. close search form Our flagship cafe in the heart of Petone Situated a short walk down the Petone esplanade, you’ll find us at Small Batch . We’re right on Waione Street with great parking options and plenty of room to secure your bike or buggy. We serve consistently brewed espresso, filter, cold brew and drip coffee (roasted across the road at the old Unilever factory), with fresh daily baking, cabinet food and a seasonal menu (weekdays only). We have the coffee, the craic and great company so pop in, let us look after you, and leave with a smile. 22 Waione Street, Petone, 5011 Monday – Friday: 7am – 2.30pm Saturday: 8am – 1pm Sunday: Closed see menu

name: roselodgetirau.wixsite.com
homepage_content: HOME | Rose Lodge top of page This website was built on Wix. Create yours today. Get Started WELCOME to Rose Lodge Bed & Breakfast ​ Conveniently situated just off SH1, in the lovely rural town of Tirau. ​ ​ ​ Rose Lodge is a great base for visiting the Central North Island being 40 minutes to Rotorua, 44 minutes to Tauranga, 40 minutes to Hamilton and 1 hour to Taupo. We are just 19 minutes, 22km away from Peter Jacksons Hobbiton Movie Set, 19 minutes, 21km from Matamata, 8 minutes, 9km to Te Waihou, Blue Springs Walkway and 11 minutes, 14km from The Red Barn Wedding Venue. ​ Quiet and relaxing Rose Lodge is central to some wonderful walks, cycling tracks, river trails, golf courses and much more. ​ Set within a Grand Villa are two beautifully appointed rooms with queen beds and private bathrooms, with original features of a bygone era. ​ A breakfast of fresh fruit, freshly baked pastries, cereal, yoghurt and fresh juice serves for good start to the day. ​ Enjoy relaxing in the cottage garden , on the deck or take a 3 minute walk into town and enjoy some fantastic shopping and have lunch in one of the many fabulous cafe’s. ​ We look forward to making your stay in Tirau one you’ll want to revisit time and again. Rooms OUR ROOMS Quiet and inviting, private bathrooms with large bath to relax and unwind in. Visit Rooms Reviews Sept 2022 Absolutely stunning Wonderful generous immaculate accommodation. Huge room with gorgeous seperate bathroom, everything you need is here. Hosts are amazing, very welcoming and friendly. Love all the little touches genuinely very impressed and highly recommend 10/10 ​ Sheryl ​ February 2023 Beautifully Perfect Beautiful rooms & facilities. Easy to find. Hosts were very friendly & hospitable. Breakfast was perfect. We would definitely stay again. Tirau is a great place to stop as an alternative to the bigger towns. ​ Sandi January 2023 Excellent value for money Excellent value for money! On our way back to Auckland we found this true gem and we're sure to return here for a long weekend later this year. The room we had was beautifully appointed, very spacious and had access to a deck and the garden, it had an equally spacious bathroom and a private tea/coffee station in the adjacent corridor. Lovely little touches like the bath salt, biscuits and chocolates as well as a sumptuous breakfast made us feel very well looked after. To us, this was a 5-star experience for a very reasonable price. Highly recommended ​ Lindy L March 2023 Many many thanks for the accommodation at Rose Lodge last week when we up for the Rowing. The Nikau Room with the attached lounge room was ideal, especially for our longer stay. And your Continental Breakfast was excellent as far as the Menu & Quantity was concerned. Needless to say that next time we need accommodation in the area, Rose Lodge will be the first place we shall call. And please feel free to use this letter as our recommendation. All our very best, and kind regards John & Vandra Harper GALLERY GALLERY Rose Lodge Tea Garden Tea Garden press to zoom Front Gate press to zoom Front Entrance press to zoom 1/11 SEE & DO THINGS TO DO Blue Spring Walk the Te Waihou Walkway and visit the beautiful Blue Spring. Shopping Take a stroll through town and explore Tirau's boutique shops and cafes. Hobbiton Visit Peter Jackson's Hobbiton movie set, only a 15 minute drive. Waikato River Trails The combined cycle and walkway offers views of the mighty Waikato river. Iconic Architecture Take a selfie in front of Tirau's quirky corrugated Sheep and Dog buildings. Rotorua Tourist hotspot, Rotorua, is a mere 40 minute drive. Contact bottom of page
