name: foodforthought.co.nz
homepage_content: Free school nutrition education backed by Foodstuffs 555-555-5555 In-person and digital nutrition education Empowering healthier futures More Info Food for Thought - Empowering Healthier Futures NEW : We’ve introduced an exciting digital learning component called ‘Food for Thought: Nutrition Quest’ . This interactive online resource is designed to support classroom learning and can also be used independently, giving students another engaging way to explore healthy eating habits. Food for Thought is a FREE school-based nutrition education programme for Year 5 and 6 students. Students learn valuable skills to make informed food choices through inquiry-based learning. Sessions take place both inside and outside the classroom with a trip to your local New World, PAK’nSAVE or Four Square supermarket to put learnings into practice in a real-world setting. Food for Thought makes for a unique and fun nutrition education experience. Our qualified Nutritionists have been spreading knowledge across Aotearoa New Zealand since 2007, reaching more than 266,000 tamariki since the programme’s inception. 10,500+ CLASSES NGĀ AKOMANGA 280,000+ STUDENTS NGĀ ĀKONGA 17,000+ ADULT HELPERS NGĀ KAIĀWHINA Find Your Nutritionist Our Programme Food for Thought is governed by the Food for Thought Educational Trust, a New Zealand-registered charity. ﻿ Our Board of Trustees ﻿ The programme is proudly supported by Foodstuffs in both the North and South Islands and is delivered in partnership with the Heart Foundation. PAK'nSAVE, New World and Four Square supermarkets all back the programme to help educate our tamariki. For over a decade, the Heart Foundation has been proud to deliver the Food for Thought programme to schools across Aotearoa New Zealand. Learning about food is important for our health, and starting early ensures students have the best opportunity to build on and practise this knowledge throughout their lifetime. quotesArtboard 1 "The presenter was great and had an excellent relationship with the children, they were fully engaged and interested in the content" ~ Classroom Teacher Button "This is such a cool initiative and I love that it ties it into our local community supermarket so the kids can see how they can actually use the information they learned in the real world!" ~ Classroom Teacher, Discovery School Button “I really really really really really really hope that you can come back again. I love learning about food because it’s food, who doesn't like food, you need food to survive” ~ Dustyn, Lower Moutere School Button Share by:

name: founderspark.co.nz
homepage_content: Kia Ora & Greetings Menu Home Our Attractions Must See Highlights Explore Our Displays Our Artisans What's On In Founders Venues For Hire The Granary The Jaycee Room The Energy Centre Old St Peter's Church Full Park Wedding Hire Conference and Events Our Collection Re-Org Project Collections Online Planning your Visit Getting Here & Getting In Other Nelson Heritage Experiences Useful Heritage Links Contact Us Welcome, adventure seekers and history enthusiasts! Brace yourselves for an epic family escapade at our heritage park – where the past meets playground! Picture this: a whimsical afternoon strolling through a village straight out of storybooks, surrounded by quirky character buildings and gardens that have clearly earned their green thumbs-up. It's not just a walk; it's a journey through time, with displays that spill the beans on Nelson's rich heritage, tales of local legends, and a chance to high-five our resident artisans who turn history into masterpieces. Pack your curiosity, bring the fam, and get ready to explore, learn, and maybe even time-travel a little. Adventure awaits at our heritage park – where the past has never been this fun! Founders Heritage Park Virtual Tour Founders Annual Book Fair Ride The Train What's happening Opening Hours Exciting arts and crafts made on-site are available at our reception area. The Windmill Founders Store, open 7 days 10am-4.30pm. Venues to Hire A variety of venues cater for every event. I soon became so busy in my own "little" business that I had to buy another van and start employing staff. I eventually sold a portion of the area I owned to serve my customers' expectations better. I look after half of Palmerston North with the surrounding areas of Feilding, Bulls, Sanson, Marton, the northern Manawatu district, and across some Whanganui areas. I'm sure you would have seen my distinctive sign written van zooming around the district. Both my partner Chris and I are very involved in the community and enjoy a stroll around the Palmerston North golf course together whenever we can. I support our local golf club by sponsoring an annual golf tournament known as the Harrisons Carpet Open Day, a very popular event.I believe my strength is listening to what my customers want and trying my best to deliver to their expectations so they can be delighted with their experience dealing with Harrisons. But the rest dishes were all good. By the way, the restaurant should clean the toilet more often! Vicky Huang Ordered the Suzhou braised meat noodles, Sichuan noodles with peppery sauce and Shanghai fried noodles. Good size portions and the flavours are really unique and delicious. Reasonably priced noodles. Went back the following night and ordered dishes to share. Booking is essential at night time and I suggest to go early at 5.30pm. Less people and less wait time William Lin 10/10 wonderful food. Make sure you try their chilli oil and soy sauce with every dish it takes it to the NEXT LEVEL. Love this place. Super affordable. Fast service. What more do you want. Samantha Singh This place is a secret gem. The food is 12 out of 10. The service is also really friendly. Highly recommended Rita Huang this restaurant has legit Shanghainese home dishes. I've been there twice to taste hometown flavor. The air dried pork belly in the yanduxian soup was excellent, I lingered around the aftertaste after going back home. drinken fish fillet was very competitive to some restaurants in Shanghai. Standing out aroma of rice wine and tender fish fillets got a big attention. And drunken chicken was legit too. The braised pork belly I had last time was out of gate, this is actually a usual dish in most Chinese restaurant. However this place got the unique flavor of east China. Almost every Shanghainese signature dish I tried here can be scored 9-10 out of 10. Staff here were nice but usually crazy busy, so help yourself if you can. homepage_content: Geneva Motor Lodge Geneva Motor Lodge Geneva Motor Lodge Home Booking Contact Us Rotorua Activities Geneva Motor Lodge Geneva Motor Lodge offers spacious self-contained units with either indoor or outdoor spa tub. It is located in central Rotorua, opposite the Rotorua Racecourse. Free parking on site and free Wi-Fi access are provided. All rooms at Geneva Lodge Rotorua are spacious and comfortable. Each comes with a spa bath in the en suite bathroom or a hot tub in the private courtyard. Kitchenette facilities, a DVD player and a flat-screen satellite TV are included. Off-street parking and guest laundry service are provided. The tour desk can help arrange visits to local attractions. There is an internet kiosk at reception. Whakarewarewa Thermal Village and the Redwood Forest are a 5-minute drive away. It is a 20-minute walk to Rotorua Events Centre, where many major sports events, conventions and shows are held. Child Seats We have the following Child Seat types - Rear facing Front facing Booster Installed and Convenient GPS Navigation Find where you're going and take the most convenient route with our GPS Navigation System. Welcome to Whanganui. Located 196km from Wellington, the capital of New Zealand, Whanganui sits on the banks of the magnificent Whanganui River, surrounded by lush national park and the Tasman sea. Your hire car is the ticket you’ll need for an exciting exploration of this beautiful part of the world. There’s no place quite like Whanganui. Grab a car and explore this charming town with an abundance of history, art, culture and nature to be discovered. Have a blast at Kowhai Park, perfect for families and those that are young at heart. You’ll find one of the world’s most unique playgrounds here, where kids can climb through an octopus or slide down a dinosaur’s back. There’s a whole playground of quirky adventures to be had, a water maze, a miniature railway and lots more to explore. Virgina Lake is another must-see, come feed the ducks and wander the Winter Garden – perfect at any time of year despite the name. There’s playgrounds and a beautiful bird aviary to explore amongst the beautifully landscaped garden. In the evening the Higginbottom Fountain in the middle of the lake comes alive with a light show sure to delight all viewers. If you’re looking for a slower pace experience, jump aboard the Waimarie paddle steamer, which has been cruising the river since 1899. With a guided tour you’ll learn all about the paddle steamers of bygone eras while you take in the ever-changing views. Te Awa o Whanganui (The Whanganui River) is the longest navigable river in New Zealand and there’s lots of different ways to explore it, from luxury charters to intrepid kayaking trips and a high-speed jet boat for those who really love adrenaline. Get back into nature and enjoy the spectacular nature walks and hikes throughout the surrounding Whanganui National Park. Discover more about the fascinating Maori culture, an important element of the park experience, the lush forest, and uncover hidden gems, like the stunning Bridge To Nowhere. For panoramic views of the town, the stunning west coastline, the lush forest and surrounding snow-capped mountains, take the elevator up to the Durie Hill War Memorial Tower. Built in 1919, this underground elevator is unique to New Zealand and the southern hemisphere. Visit the St Pauls Memorial Church in Putiki, a spectacular building featuring mesmerising Maori tukutuku (weavings) and lattice designs that give us a little sample of the history of the region. The church spot dates back to 1842, but the church standing today was built in 1936. Of course if after all of that you’re in need of some rest, there’s also plenty of stunning beaches to explore – for fishing and surfing try South Beach, or for a lazy day on the sand the gentle waves of Kai Iwi Beach are perfection itself. If you’d rather a walk along windswept cliffs with stunning views, then Castlecliff will be the place to go – whatever you choose, spectacular views and a chance to forget your everyday worries is yours to enjoy here. Whanganui is surrounded by beautiful and intriguing places to explore in every direction. You can head towards Wellington and stop at Taranki on the way – its picture perfect mountain and glassy lake are sure to have you reaching for you camera. There are a number of amazing walks through this area suitable for all members of the family, or you can visit historic homesteads and immerse yourself in culture and fine dining. Your Whanganui adventure awaits, and our hire cars can get you there. Related Articles Make the Most of Whanganui Destination Guides See all articles

name: heriotlane.com
homepage_content: Heriot Lane City Apartments, Dunedin NZ HERIOT LANE CITY APARTMENTS 30 Heriot Row, Dunedin Central, Dunedin 9016, NZ Welcome to Heriot Lane City Apartments, Dunedin, Otago, New Zealand. Surrounded by the Town's Green Belt, and nestled between Olveston and Ritchie Heritage Houses, stay in central Dunedin within our private, quiet, spacious, sunny, and warm environment. Enjoy our three bedroom apartments, with room to sleep 6 persons, keep you warm with two heat pumps and double glazed windows, provide two bathrooms with full laundry facilities, and one separate toilet. Park your vehicle in the secure designated space in front of your apartment. Enquire about our one bedroom and studio apartments featuring modern amenities, double glazing, and heat pumps. All motel apartments are serviced and have free wireless internet. Each apartment has a private courtyard and garden furniture. Be within 500m to the city centre, Meridian Shopping Mall, Public Library, Otago Museum, Otago University, Dunedin Public Hospital; Medical, Dental, and Pharmacy Schools; Knox Church and Moana Swimming Pool, not to mention being near the historic Olveston House. We are a University of Otago approved accommodation provider. You will be within walking distance to Mercy Hospital, Otago Polytechnic, Toitu Otago Settlers Museum, Dunedin Public Art Gallery, Taieri Gorge Railway, Dunedin Railway Station, Botanical Gardens, Forsyth Barr Stadium at University Plaza and Logan Park Sports grounds and more. Explore Dunedin's art, fashion, wildelife, excellent restaurants, and rich heritage, and make our apartments your headquarters overlooking the city. Whether your travel to Dunedin is for business or pleasure we are happy to host you and offer a home away from home. We appreciate direct bookings via the reserve button above. Thank you for supporting local economy.

The menu consists of Appetizers, Party platters, Bento boxes, Sushi, Sashimi, Tempura, Japanese Curry, Domburi bowls, Ramen and Udon. name: indian2niterestaurant.co.nz
homepage_content: Indian2nite Indian Restaurant Palmerston North | Palmerston North Indian Restaurant and Takeaway Entree Mains Book Now Contact Us Indian2nite Indian Restaurant Dinein & Takeaway Palmerston North Indian2nite is an authentic north Indian restaurant in Palmerston North located in George Street with fantastic dine in or takeaway menu options. Fancy Indian tonight? When it comes to this particular eatery, we always know the answer.Serving up a roaring selection of Indian classics and authentic eats, Indian2Nite is out to impress. Immense tiger portraits patrol the walls, placing you in the heart of India's vast wilderness whilst an orange glow pervades the entire establishment with familiar warmth. Perfect for a special occasion or just a chilled supper, tonight's plans are sorted. The menu itself is extensive with something for every craving. Seafood fanatics are treated to the likes of butter prawn, fish masala and seafood masala whilst meat-lovers can indulge in any of their aromatic chicken, lamb or beef curries. Go West with the Punjabi chicken, opt for the royal treatment with the lamb saagwala or head south for the beef madras. Vegetarians are treated to nourishing daals, creamy paneer concoctions and the hearty Malai kofta which will undoubtedly put you in a cosy food coma. Pair your choice with the Indian2Nite special naan; it's stuffed with fruits and nuts for that irresistible crunch and squidge. A truly unique bread, you definitely won't find it elsewhere. We can't wait for tonight's plans. We offer home delivery and takeaway service Order Takeaway Online Order Online Now BOOK A TABLE Contact Phone: 06-353 7400 Address: 22 George Street, Palmerston North 4410 Opening Hours Monday : 4:30â9:30pm Monday - Sunday : 11:00amâ2pm, 5:00â10:00pm Order Online Now

name: kopicafechicago.com
homepage_content: Kopi Cafe Cart 0 Scroll Kopi, A Travelers Cafe "Kopi's my favorite. Since 1991. I feel I've traveled my whole life to get here. The coffee, superb. The staff, spot on. The boutique, hip and chic. Breakfast, lunch and dinner. Open early. Open late. The menu's serious if you're hungry, hilarious if you're not. Mostly vegetarian. Vegan and gluten free friendly. The wines, dignified. The cocktails, knock out. The pastries...oh, you will eat pastries. The music's cool swing, and here's the thing--the people at the tables, they are talking to one another. They are smiling and laughing and being together. And sometimes they fall in love. Even if you're by yourself, you're not alone at Kopi. People are here to be not with their machines, but with each other. Imagine that. Now stop imagining and go. You don't need a passport to hang at Kopi, but if you're there, you've probably got one." - M. Bordenave Order Online Phone (773) 989-5674 Location 5317 N Clark St Chicago, Illinois Hours Monday: 10am–7pm Tuesday: 10am–7pm Wednesday: 10am–7pm Thursday: 10am–7pm Friday: 10am–8pm Saturday: 10am–8pm Sunday: 10am–7pm Order Online

name: kampungstyle.co.nz
homepage_content: Kampung Style Malaysian Cafe | Glen Eden | ORDER ONLINE | Takeaway | TuckerFox NZ Welcome to Kampung Style Malaysian Cafe PRE ORDER ONLINE Welcome to Kampung Style Malaysian Cafe Order Online from Kampung Style Malaysian Cafe Malaysian Cuisine * 145 W Coast Rd Glen Eden, Auckland 0602 * Online Menu * Takeaway * Secure Online Payments * TOP SELLERS Curry Laksa Chicken 咖哩呖沙鸡丝面 Curry laksa soup with noodles with shredded chicken, bean curd, and egg $20.90 Beef Rendang with Rice/Roti 干咖喱牛肉饭 / 抓饼 Malaysian style dry beef curry, served with rice or roti $21.90 TOP SELLERS Curry Laksa Chicken 咖哩呖沙鸡丝面 Curry laksa soup with noodles with shredded chicken, bean curd, and egg $20.90 Beef Rendang with Rice/Roti 干咖喱牛肉饭 / 抓饼 Malaysian style dry beef curry, served with rice or roti $21.90 Menus PRE ORDER ONLINE Online Operating Hours Pickup LUNCH DINNER Thursday 11am to 2:15pm 5pm to 8:30pm Friday 11am to 2:15pm 2:15pm to 8:30pm Saturday 11am to 2:15pm 2:15pm to 8:30pm Sunday 11am to 2:15pm 2:15pm to 8:30pm Monday Closed Closed Tuesday 11am to 2:15pm 5pm to 8:30pm Wednesday 11am to 2:15pm 5pm to 8:30pm REVIEWS I have been trying to visit this place for soooo long, but it always seems to be a Monday, and unfortunately they are closed. But today was my lucky day, this restaurant is located in the old Glen Eden station building, so it is right next to the current Glen Eden train depot. Upon arrival, I was informed of lunch specials and once order decisions were made, you go to the counter, place your order and pay. Food come out quickly and was absolutely delicious and good portion size. Paired with a couple of refreshing iced drinks, made for a perfect lunch. Parking in central Glen Eden can be tricky, but if you get the chance to visit here, i recommend it. cheekybulls The best Malaysian-style fish fillet curry laksa I have ever had. My friend dines here often and he highly recommended I try their food, it was my first time. Our conversation was cut short once the food arrived, there was no time to talk but eat and enjoy every mouthful as my taste buds were having a party! Inside the cafe it's rather small and intimate, I counted 20 seats available inside, they have tables outside but it's too cold to be dining outdoors in autumn and winter is just around the corner. It wouldn't be ideal if you were after a space to have private and confidential conversations because nearby tables and customers can hear you. The staff are friendly, polite and helpful and I will be back for more curry laksa. Thank you for a delicious, mouth-watering experience. Zandea Lee I can’t believe I haven’t reviewed this Malaysian restaurant yet! It’s the only Malaysian spot in the area since I moved here, and it has never let me down. The staff is always kind, and the food is consistently delicious. I can’t pick a favorite dish, but I’ve had many Nasi Lemak and Seafood Curry Laksa—both are amazing! Dokyun Kim Generous portions ensure delightful satisfaction without breaking the bank. Meals are so substantial that they can easily last for two days. The convenient location makes it easy to stop by. The staff provides exceptional service, creating a welcoming atmosphere. It's a true value for a satisfying dining experience. name: hestiacafe.co.nz
homepage_content: Hestia Cafe | Petone | ORDER ONLINE | Takeaway | TuckerFox NZ Welcome to Hestia Cafe PRE ORDER ONLINE Welcome to Hestia Cafe Order Online from Hestia Cafe Vietnamese Cuisine * 225 Jackson St Petone, Lower Hutt 5012 * Online Menu * Takeaway * Secure Online Payments * TOP SELLERS Fried Pork Dumpling (10 Pcs) $14.00 BBQ Pork on Rice Fried egg, cucumber, tomato, pickled carrot, and fish sauce $18.00 TOP SELLERS Fried Pork Dumpling (10 Pcs) $14.00 BBQ Pork on Rice Fried egg, cucumber, tomato, pickled carrot, and fish sauce $18.00 Menus PRE ORDER ONLINE Online Operating Hours Pickup Thursday Closed 10am to 4pm Friday Closed 10am to 4pm Saturday Closed 10am to 4pm Sunday Closed 10am to 4pm Monday Closed 10am to 4pm Tuesday Closed 10am to 4pm Wednesday Closed 10am to 4pm REVIEWS Dropped in for the first time on Mother’s Day at lunchtime and they were pretty busy. Fortunately, we managed to get a table. There were probably only 3 to 4 staff so service was a little slow but not overly bad. They do have the usual Kiwi style breakfast and also the traditional style Vietnamese food and drinks. The Vietnamese coffee was great however it would be nice to serve with an extra side of hot water as the condensed milk might seem overly sweet for some. Food was tasty and generous portions which we ended up taking some home. There are 2 toilets available and I have to say that they are pretty clean. The only letdown were the flies. We are nearing winter and there were easily around 10 flies buzzing around, so I would expect summer to be much worse. This would be something that’s easily taken care of so would definitely be back for more meals. Eugene T Peaceful piano music was very relaxing. This place has quite an insane menu - they literally have everything. It’s got all the canteen type food pies, chips fried chicken burgers etc then it also has all day breakfasts and a sirloin steak, plus a full range of Vietnamese delights! Plus shakes and smoothies - something here for everyone - and at friendly prices. Great for a family lunch basically! Jules Longdin-Prisk Very clean, big portions with an affordable price, and friendly staff. Loved the iced matcha latte with whipped cream covered by matcha dust for $7.5, I recommended to leave for 5-10 mins to get to the iced cold temperature. Beef noodle soup is very good, generous portions for me and even my toddler to share. She slurped to the last drop. Kelly Clark Was there during quiet time not much client around. Choice is slots plus u can have up 10pax sitting if you are having family gatherings since they do have more food choices for rice , noodle or sandwich type. I had Vietnamese spicy noodles which were sort of expensive due to the portions is big and can be up to 2 pax sharing if u are a small eater. It call spicy but not spicy for me as . Cleaning I would say depends as some people save it very clean but unfortunately I was there when the table wasn't really clean and oily which I don't think it's a big if your purpose is to eat and go . I did not wait that long as I got my order in 10min and left in a hurry as well. Catherine Zeitouni Indulge in the finest iced mocha in town priced at $6.80, boasting a perfect balance of sweetness and unparalleled flavor! It’s the ideal kickstart to your day. The noodles come along with generous amount fresh herb. Plus, the service is exceptional and welcoming. The café might not catch your eye from the outside, but trust me, it’s got all the goods, from great food to awesome service. JoJo Sexton

name: kelvinhotel.co.nz
homepage_content: Home - Kelvin Hotel Skip to content Check Availability Stay, Dine, & Unwind Situated in Invercargill’s bustling city centre, we offer more than just a place to stay. Check Availability An Invercargill Gem About the Hotel Located in the heart of Invercargill, The Kelvin Hotel offers quality accommodation. Consisting of 61 well-appointed rooms, the hotel includes; King deluxe suite, 2 superior suites with separate living rooms, classic rooms and 3 bedroom apartment. We also offer conference and wedding venue options, as well as an on-site restaurant and bars: Level One is set in contemporary décor and offers a wide range of menu options using the best southern cuisines. the kelvin hotel Our Hotel's Facilities From dining and drinks to business and leisure, The Kelvin Hotel provides an extensive range of facilities to cater to all your needs. ROOM SERVICE Central Location Bar & Restaurant 24 hour reception Valet Parking Luxury Comfort Our Rooms & Suites Consisting of 61 well-appointed rooms. All rooms have high speed broadband, good sized work desks, and SKY TV, and complimentary valet car parking is offered to all Hotel guests. 3 Bedroom Apartment King Suite Superior Suite Premium King Room Premium Queen Room Classic Queen Room Classic Triple Room Classic Double Room Classic Twin Room Food & Drink Delicious Dining & Inviting Bars The Kelvin Hotel offers a range of food and beverage experiences. Our restaurant provides an elegant setting for delicious meals, our bar serves up a chic spot for cocktails, and our sports bar offers a fun place to watch your favourite games. Restaurant & Bar Level One New Zealand is very much on the menu. Featuring top-quality cuts of meat like rare venison, pork belly, South Island lamb and beef, you couldn’t do better for a celebratory steak night. Learn More Book Now Bar Editor's Cut Invercargill’s only inner city sports bar. Offering exceptional street appeal and café windows to let the sun in, it’s an ideal place to meet friends for a well-earned drink. Learn More Chef's Creations Meet at the Kelvin Functions & Conferences Host your next event in style at The Kelvin Hotel Invercargill. Our versatile function spaces and dedicated team ensure a seamless experience, whether it’s a small meeting or a grand banquet. Functions Our six versatile function spaces provide a tasteful, relaxed ambience and can be configured for interviews, training seminars, boardroom meetings, banquet settings, and almost anything in-between. Learn More Weddings Let us be part of your special day. Our experienced, dedicated and professional team who pride themselves on ensuring you have the perfect wedding, your big day is sure to be the highlight of your life. Learn More Connect with us Facebook Instagram Facebook Instagram Kelvin Hotel 20 Kelvin Street, Invercargill, New Zealand. Telephone : 03 218 2829 Freephone : 0800 802 829 International : +64 3 218 2829 Kelvin Hotel 2024. name: frankscafe.co.nz

Customer Reviews Wow! This is the best breakfast I've had anywhere in NZ! Buy the massive breakfast and get ready for the best eggs, bacon or everything on that plate, divine! Honestly! Far exceeded my expectations. Isla T. – Google Review I have no words other than amazing. Would give 6 stars but am limited to 5. Will definitely be my local brekkie stop. Sammie H. name: masterofindia.co.nz
homepage_content: Homepage Master Of India We would like to welcome for dine in with excellent service and mouth watering taste. Order Online Reservations Welcome to Master Of India Master of India takes you on a tasty exploration right to the very heart of Indian Cuisine which has the ability to provide a cosmopolitan melting pot of cuisine. We strive to bring you the most Authentic in Indian Cuisine complemented by traditional Indian decor and elegant yet warm service. We are also specialized in “Balti and Goat”. We have been consistently rated #1 restaurant in the whole of Taupo for the last of two years on Tripadvisor and also #1 in Indian Cuisine in the whole North Island. This is what the judges of the recent Awards held in Taupo had to say about our restaurant “I would rate this as the best of the Indian restaurant I experienced. Hard to fault. Decor great, Authentic and warm. The staff was very attractively dressed and groomed.” We have been recently nominated for “Events Capital Best Hospitality Business” for the town centre Taupo Excellence Awards – come to dine and see why!!! Lunch Timings We are open for contactless Takeaway and delivery 11:00 am to 4 pm for lunch Dinner Timings Monday to Sunday: 4:00pm to 9:00Pm Special offers For Christmas Special offers, visit Master of India at 47 Ruapehu Street, Taupo. view more Master Of India Tandoori Retuarant and Bar welcome for all functions, lunchons and dinner and parties for any occasion.All you nedd to tell us is what sort of function it is, what sort of food you like served, and how many guest you are expecting as we can prepare a meal to suit your needs. Master Of India seats up to 80 people indoor and 20 people outdoor of the restuarant. To make an enquiry please fell free to contact us. We are more then happy to help you. Our Best Dishes Tasty exploration right to the very heart of Indian Cuisine BUTTER CHICKEN The most famous Indian dish, Overnight marinated BBQ boneless chicken cooked in mild tomato sauce. CHICKEN SPECIALITY BIRYANI Your choice of beef, lamb or vegetable stir-fried .... DIVINE RICE Featured MANGO LASSI Lassi Mango (Yoghurt Drink) BEVERAGE CHEF'S BALTI SPECIAL Grounded Himalayan spices on onion & tomato based sauce CHICKEN SPECIALITY Featured SEEKH KEBAB BBQ minced lamb with onion and spices STARTERS (NON-VEG.) HIMALAYAN HUNDY Our own creation on grandmother recipe Main-course Browse Our Menu Call Us for ORDER NOW Master of India takes you on a tasty exploration right to the very heart of Indian Cuisine which has the ability to provide a cosmopolitan melting pot of cuisine. Our Address 47 Ruapehu Street Taupo, New Zealand Queries 07 377 0041 Contact Us Opening Hours We are Open 7 days a week. Lunch Timings Monday to Friday: 10:00 am to 4:00 pm Saturday & Sunday: 09:00 am to 4:00 pm Dinner Timings Monday to Sunday: 4:00 pm to 10:00 pm Call Us Now! We strive to bring YOU only the very best authentic INDIAN CUISINE…

All apartments have been designed with comfort, relaxation and that special touch of luxury including large showers, pod coffee machines, air conditioning, dishwashers and much more! We are kiwi owned and operated and have extensive knowledge of Rotorua and what our amazing city and surroundings has to offer and our hospitality is the best you could find.. Electric Vehicle Charging Read More Electric Vehicle Charging Read More Gallery View Gallery Gallery View Gallery Facilities to enhance your relaxing stay Our rooms offer guests a relaxed and comfortable Rotorua accommodation experience perfect for short or long stays. Our serviced apartments range from large studios to sleep 2 people to 1 bedroom and 2 bedroom apartments sleeping up to 4 and Tahi house to sleep 8 people with plenty of space. Our 1 bedroom and studio apartments offer private decks with your own spa pool, BBQ and outdoor furniture! Everything you need to unwind, relax and recharge. All rooms have an Electric Vehicle charging point and we also have a Tesla destination charger and commando plug to cater for every electric vehicle, free overnight charging for our guests. name: mercermotel.co.nz
homepage_content: Mercer Motel - Accommodation in Mercer Home About Rooms Attractions Book Here Contact Us Home About ACCOMMODATION ATTRACTIONS Contact Us Book Now Home About ACCOMMODATION ATTRACTIONS Contact Us Book Here Contact front desk WELCOME Stay with us at Mercer Motel learn more Book here About Us High-quality, riverside accommodation close to Auckland City and the Waikato MORE ABOUT US Stay With Us Mercer Motel provides studio rooms ideal for couples and interconnecting studios with a bunk room for families. All rooms have Sky TV and WIFI access to internet. Our motel has an adjacent bar and restaurant which all our guests may use. ACCOMMODATION DETAILS EXPLORE OUR ACCOMMODATION VIEW Studio Units Each room has its own super king bed that can be split for twin accommodation, plus an ensuite and kitchenette. View details VIEW Ensuite Rooms If youâre travelling in a group, then we have interconnecting studio units which join onto a bunk room that can sleep an additional three guests. View details VIEW Camping Facilities Located right next to the motel on a grass section we have motorhome berths with power and tent sites available. There are also three sleep-out cabins available for larger groups. View details Local Attractions Local activities include the award-winning Mercer Cheese Shop next door, Pokeno ice-creams, and the Mercer Art and History Museum celebrating the life and times of Caesar Roose on the Waikato River. If youâre after something more adventurous, thereâs Hampton Downs Motorsport Park for motorsports and go-karts or Mercer Airport for flying and skydiving. VIEW ATTRACTIONS Conveniently located adjacent to the Mercer Service Centre and Waikato River on SH1 Book Here Contact Us Home About Accomodation Attractions Â© Mercer Motel Website by GummyBear

homepage_content: Jeff Cafe | Wellington | ORDER ONLINE | Takeaway | TuckerFox NZ Welcome to Jeff Cafe PRE ORDER ONLINE Welcome to Jeff Cafe Order Online from Jeff Cafe Chinese Cuisine * 163 The Terrace Wellington 6011 * Online Menu * Takeaway * Secure Online Payments * TOP SELLERS Pan Fried Pork Dumplings 锅贴 (5 Pcs) $7.00 Sweet & Sour Pork Nuggets 甜酸猪肉 $18.50 TOP SELLERS Pan Fried Pork Dumplings 锅贴 (5 Pcs) $7.00 Sweet & Sour Pork Nuggets 甜酸猪肉 $18.50 Menus PRE ORDER ONLINE Online Operating Hours Pickup LUNCH DINNER Thursday 11am to 2:15pm 5pm to 8:45pm Friday 11am to 2:15pm 5pm to 8:45pm Saturday Closed 5pm to 8:45pm Sunday Closed 5pm to 8:45pm Monday 11am to 2:15pm 5pm to 8:45pm Tuesday 11am to 2:15pm 5pm to 8:45pm Wednesday 11am to 2:15pm 5pm to 8:45pm REVIEWS Friendly down to earth staff, good prices and excellent food. A smallish place tucked into the bottom floor of an apartment. Perfectly cooked traditionally madr food and HEAPS to choose from too. Some of the best I've had outside the mainland hometown. Ant Last I am so glad I believed the other reviews. Clearly prepared using fresh, high quality ingredients, and very tasty indeed. One of the best takeaway meals I have ever had. Mark Braggins The surroundings are austere, but the food is outstanding - if you are a meat eater (they also have a wide rage of vegetarian dishes) I would recommend the Brisket, it has a touch of aniseed, and would be my personal favourite if it wasn't for the Spicy Ribs, they make my jaw lock just thinking about them. The Orange Beef is good and the deep fried Squid is to die for. There wouldn't be a food establishment in Wellington or probably NZ where you can get great food and great service for $20 a dish. I recommend you go with a few friends, select a dish each and share - you won't be disappointed. Patrick Great chinese food cooked very well. No frills but great value 👍 Lloyd Spence One of the best Chinese restaurants here in Welly! All the food taste really good and feel like home. Reasonable price and decent portion. Quick service. Very clean. Really recommended this place Winnie Felicia Gunawan PREV NEXT LOCATION × Average Customer Rating 4.6 Friendly down to earth staff, good prices and excellent food. The Orange Beef is good and the deep fried Squid is to die for. There wouldn't be a food establishment in Wellington or probably NZ where you can get great food and great service for $20 a dish. I recommend you go with a few friends, select a dish each and share - you won't be disappointed. Patrick Great chinese food cooked very well. Very clean. Really recommended this place Winnie Felicia Gunawan

name: lanahresidence.com
homepage_content: Lanah Residence NZ | Queenstown Accommodation & Luxury Getaway Menu Luxury Accommodation Located on the Lake Edge CHECK AVAILABILITY Luxury Accommodation Located on the Lake Edge CHECK AVAILABILITY CHECK IN & CHECK OUT 20 Nov 2025 ADULTS 2 CHECK AVAILABILITY Welcome to the Lanah Residence Quietly tucked away on the lake’s edge The Lanah is the perfect Queenstown getaway location. Relax and enjoy this exclusive residence surrounded by magnificent mountain views from every angle. SEE THE SUITES Deluxe Suite Executive Suite Owners Suite The Lanah Residence Suites AWARDS Lanah Residence wins Architecture Now Magazine Award. Read more here. Prime Location The Lanah Residence is spectacularly situated on the edge of the lake in Kelvin Heights, Queenstown. The property offers mountain and lake views in every direction and is a short distance from Queenstown’s main central area. The prestigious Kawarau Village is arguably one of the sunniest and best positions in Queenstown. Boasting views of Lake Wakatipu, the Kawarau River and The Remarkables mountain range… LEARN MORE 65m 2 bed bath lake smoke Deluxe Suite With spectacular views of Lake Wakatipu, The Remarkables and Coronet Peak, this spacious suite is the perfect place to relax. With a 65 square meter floor space encompassing the bedroom, kitchenette area, and bathroom. The king-size bed is placed to give you the best mountain views. The bathroom boasts a large shower, soaking bathtub and a separate toilet. Read More CHECK AVAILABILITY 65m 2 bed bath lake smoke Executive Suite This grand suite has a 3.40-meter-high ceiling, spectacular views of the lake and surrounding mountains. The spacious suite has a King Size bed, large working table, kitchen facilities, and bathroom. The shower overlooks the rockface behind the residence, large soaking bathtub and separate toilet. Read More CHECK AVAILABILITY 70m 2 bed bath lake smoke Owners Suite This prestigious, exclusive access suite showcases the best of the best. Enter from the ground floor in a private elevator into 180-degree views of Lake Wakatipu, Coronet Peak, and The Remarkables mountain range. A large king-size bed and window lounge area provides you all the serenity you need. With a large dining table and kitchenette. The spacious bathroom has a large bathtub, separate toilet, and complimentary robes. You will also have direct access to a private sunroof and panoramic Jacuzzi tub. Read More CHECK AVAILABILITY About Lanah Residence The Lanah Residence is spectacularly situated on the edge of the lake in Kelvin Heights, Queenstown. The property offers mountain and lake views in every direction and is a short distance from Queenstown’s main central area. The prestigious Kawarau village is arguably one of the sunniest and best positions in Queenstown. Boasting views of Lake Wakatipu, the Kawarau River and The Remarkables mountain range. The Lanah Residence is located within easy walking distance to the popular Wakatipu Grill and other restaurants nearby. The Queenstown Ferry wharf is a short walk away connecting you to the Queenstown Marina the CBD. Queenstown’s golf courses, the Queenstown Airport, shopping centres and cafes are located not far from the residence, within walking distance or a short taxi ride away. Read More → Your Hosts Han Suqing Previously Han was an outstanding professional softball player and of the founders off the XIN JI SHI Restaurant in Shanghai. Today, she collects art, travels the world, experiences unique hotels and restaurants and strives to create boutique tourism and art projects. Read More → Jean-Pierre Dosse A highly regarded expert in the hotel world, My Jean-Pierre Dosse was Regional Vice President of Four Seasons Hotel Group and General Manager of the Four Seasons Hotel Shanghai. He has been responsible for several classic projects at home and abroad, in the development of luxury resorts and management models include Halekulani Hotel In Honolulu & Beverly Wilshire in Los Angeles . Read More → Raymond Peynet (Nov. 16, 1908 – Jan. 14, 1999) Raymond was a French cartoonist. He is known for having created the couple of lovers in 1942 “ Les Amoureux de Peynet ”. In 1930, he married Denise Damour whom he had met during his childhood. The “ lovers ”, the poet and his childhood sweetheart, were created by Peynet in Valence, inspired by a music kiosk known since then as the Peynet kiosk. Ruth Dorrit Yacoby (1950 - 2015) Ruth is an international artist, painter and poet who lives in the south of Israel near the Dead Sea at the edge of the Judean desert. Woman offering her soul Through the figure of woman Yacoby expressed her freedom and her ability to fly or to risk falling, to attain to new experiences of redemption in a new firmament, to free herself of burdensome impurity by baptism, by self-purification, by birth. The soul’s self-extrication from the material that surrounds it—the body: that is the sacrificial victim’s way of coming closer to God. Raymond Peynet (Nov. 16, 1908 – Jan. 14, 1999) Raymond was a French cartoonist. He is known for having created the couple of lovers in 1942 “ Les Amoureux de Peynet ”. In 1930, he married Denise Damour whom he had met during his childhood. The “ lovers ”, the poet and his childhood sweetheart, were created by Peynet in Valence, inspired by a music kiosk known since then as the Peynet kiosk. homepage_content: Mr Lobster Private Kitchen | Henderson | ORDER ONLINE | Takeaway | TuckerFox NZ Welcome to Mr Lobster Private Kitchen PRE ORDER ONLINE Welcome to Mr Lobster Private Kitchen Order Online from Mr Lobster Private Kitchen Asian & Chinese Cuisine * 301 Lincoln Rd Henderson, Auckland 0612 * Online Menu * Takeaway * Secure Online Payments * TOP SELLERS Steam Prawn Dumplings 龙虾皇虾皇饺 $18.80 Tomyum Steam Prawn Dumplings 泰式小笼包 $13.80 TOP SELLERS Steam Prawn Dumplings 龙虾皇虾皇饺 $18.80 Tomyum Steam Prawn Dumplings 泰式小笼包 $13.80 Menus PRE ORDER ONLINE Online Operating Hours Pickup LUNCH DINNER Thursday 10:30am to 2:30pm 5pm to 7:30pm Friday 10:30am to 2:30pm 5pm to 7:30pm Saturday 10:30am to 2:30pm 5pm to 7:30pm Sunday 10:30am to 2:30pm 5pm to 7:30pm Monday 10:30am to 2:30pm 5pm to 7:30pm Tuesday 10:30am to 2:30pm 5pm to 7:30pm Wednesday 10:30am to 2:30pm 5pm to 7:30pm REVIEWS Recently had dinner at this Chinese restaurant. The highlight of the meal was the roast duck. The meat was incredibly tender, and the skin was perfectly crispy, just the right balance of flavor and texture. The staff were attentive, and made sure we had everything we needed throughout the meal. We didn't have to wait long for our food, and everything came out piping hot and fresh. M R Always busy here. But we were able to get a table without waiting long. They are very efficient and courteous. The food is well prepared, presented, delicious and generous. Price is a bit on the high side but again generous servings. Ordering is a breeze with the QR code system and you know what you are paying for. Just make sure tea charging is for the right number of people. I have to say again they are very efficient! ENKI'S FUN TECHNO STUFF (EnkiTrillionaire) We visited Mr Lobster’s Private Kitchen a few weeks ago with a group of family and friends (there were nine of us). We made a booking in advance and were seated at a large table with a lazy Susan, which made sharing easy. We ordered a range of dishes from the menu—everything sounded amazing, and each dish had its own unique flavour. The standout for us was definitely the Peking duck. The crispy skin, juicy meat, and the combination with the wrap and veggies were just perfect. We also really enjoyed the green beans, roast pork, spicy chicken, and BBQ fried noodles—they were all packed with flavour. The only downside was the slow service. It seemed like dishes were being made and served one table at a time, which is understandable, but with so many other groups there, it meant we waited over 30–40 minutes before the food started arriving. A bit longer than we’re used to, even at busy places. That said, once the food came, it was worth the wait—just something to keep in mind if you're heading there during peak hours. Sang Hyun Kim Probably the best yum cha spot in Auckland! The food quality here is definitely a step above other well-known places. We came for a Saturday brunch with my family and my wife's family, and the place was already busy right from opening at 11am. Every table was full by lunchtime, so I was glad we had made a booking! Ordering was super easy using their QR code system, which showed clear photos of each dish. It was really helpful for choosing what we wanted. We ordered quite a variety, including their popular black truffle dumplings, steamed prawn dumplings, Mr. Lobster deep-fried prawn paste in shredded pastry, deep-fried spicy beans for salad, and a lobster congee to share, along with a few more dishes (not all pictured). Dish highlights: - Black Truffle Dumplings: Absolutely my favourite! There are two versions, and both were rich, fragrant, and full of truffle aroma - a must-try. - Steamed Prawn Dumplings: Fresh, juicy, and perfectly cooked - classic done right. - Deep-Fried Prawn Pastry (Mr. Lobster): Super crispy on the outside and beautifully tender inside. Loved every bite. - Spicy Beans for Salad: Crispy, flavourful, and surprisingly addictive. - Lobster Congee: Smooth, comforting, and generous with lobster - perfect for sharing. Even though the restaurant was packed, the staff were friendly, quick, and attentive. They took the time to answer our questions and made sure we had everything we needed. I have been here a few times now and have never been disappointed. They do yum cha only in lunch time, so it was important to us meeting in lunch time. The only downside is that prices are higher than other yum cha places, but the quality and flavour kinda justify it. Highly recommended, and make sure to book ahead. Michael Kang We have been several times for yum cha and once for dinner. The staff are very friendly and speak English. For yum cha you order on an app which has pictures and is in English and Chinese. They do have a physical menu but encourage to order on the app. There is no trolley service. Food is very tasty and a great variety. Pictures only show the few items we had. Highly recommend yum cha. You must book. The carpark can get busy but u can register your car with the restaurant to avoid getting towed or a ticket. Dinner is also very good with great service. homepage_content: St John's Court Motel | In historic Milton BOOK NOW +64 3 417 7777 BOOK NOW BOOK NOW Stay. Relax. Enjoy. Welcome to St John's Court Motel. Located right in the heart of historic Milton, New Zealand, we offer more than just a place to stay – it's a gateway to the rich heritage and natural beauty that defines this South East Otago gem. Relax in the tranquility of our accommodation while being just moments away from Milton's historic landmarks, and the breathtaking landscapes of the region. Whether you're here for business or leisure, St. John's Court Motel invites you to experience the warmth of Kiwi hospitality in a location steeped in history. BOOK NOW In historic Milton We offer a range of accommodation options to suit every traveller's needs - from studios to two-bedroom units. With easy access to the region's stunning landscapes and historical treasures to convenient amenities, we provide a welcoming home base for adventurers and relaxation seekers alike. Discover the perfect blend of tranquility, convenience, and natural beauty right here in the heart of South East Otago. name: lighthousewanaka.com
homepage_content: Light House Church Wanaka - Light House Church Wanaka Home Messages Bedroom Poetry – WEEK 1 Hold the Sun — Part 1: When Time Stood Still Hold the Sun — Part 2: When God Turns Back Time Beyond the Steeple The Churches Underbelly Mind Gremlins Jesus' Worst Sales Pitch WTFaith? Part 2 Soul Sriracha Fake Plastic Trees WTFaith? Part 1 Ikigia, Part 1 - What gets you up in the morning Ikigia, Part 2 - What gets you up in the morning Bex's story Join the Loop About Give Online The Light House Church believes in the teachings of Jesus, we believe in being culturally relevant, creative, and inclusive. We've created an environment that's far from a traditional religious setting, a culture that reflects Wanaka and it’s contemporary community. TELL ME MORE ABOUT IT Join us this Sunday (Nov 23) for Bedroom Poetry: The Bible’s steamiest book and why it matters today. Desire. Consent. Boundaries. Before marriage, before rules, before shame — the Song of Solomon shows us a picture of passion and longing that’s honest, poetic, and sacred. We’ll talk about what it means to navigate sexuality with integrity in a modern world — without guilt, fear, or legalism. You’ll laugh, maybe blush a little, and definitely see the Bible in a way you haven’t before. The Big Story: Christianity 101 — Week 4 , This Thursday, 6:30 pm | The Lighthouse, Wanaka . Join us for Part 4 of The Big Story — our four-week crash course on what Christianity is really about. Every Sunday 6-7pm service | 28 Reece Crescent , Wānaka (Walk right to the back of the car park behind Guthrie Bowron & up the flight of stairs, follow the signage) There is way to much beauty in Wanaka to not enjoy those delight hours in Gods creation. We find a short punchy night service to be exactly what people love. One hour long with a hangout after, is plenty of time for some amazing worship and a short punchy message. A message that is relevant for people weather they have been in church there entire life's or maybe don't even believe in God but still come as it's a fun space to be. We can't wait to meet you and make you feel really welcome. Grab a free beverage, take a seat on a couch and enjoy the ride! FAQ Where and when is the service? Every Sunday 6-7pm service | 28 Reece Crescent , Wānaka (Walk right to the back of the car park behind Guthrie Bowron & up the flight of stairs) What do you do in your service? The service is only 1 hour. The band plays a few songs & different people might chat. Then for 20 minutes we have a professional communicator talk around a topic that is practical from the bible or life. After the service we hang out, catch up and meet new friends. There are complementary drinks (beer, cider, coke etc) in the fridge for during or after the service. What should I wear? Whatever, most of us are super casual. We are more concerned about you being comfortable and relaxed than the clothes you wear. Do I have to give money? Certainly not, if you are a guest the service is a gift to you. We do encourage our regular community to give but it is never pressured. Do I need a bible or something? Most people these days just download YouVersion on the app store. But all the bible scriptures used in the service will be on screen anyway. What do you do for the kids? We encourage older kids to enjoy the service and certainly all kids to enjoy the music. Many younger teenagers love the service as the speaking is interesting, often funny and certainly helpful. For the younger kids (when we know they are coming) we feed them dinner free of charge during the 20 minute talk. Your kid can either stay with you or eat with the other kids and make friends. Whats the music like? We have a full band and although all our songs are about faith they are played in a relevant way. Many of them have a distinct Reggae/Grunge New Zealand vibe to them. Got a Question? LOCATION Sunday 6pm 28 Reece Crescent , Wānaka What people Are Saying Greenwood Absolutely love this church. Super relaxed and chill yet totally about Jesus and loving others. Felt really welcoming and accepting. The worship was so good and loved the atmosphere. The sermons are amazing and really relevant to everyday life. Would highly recommend this church to anyone. Naomi Awesome church, great music, heaps of young people, really funky space and a super relevant message. Definitely will be coming back Pete Awesome presence of God! name: paeroacollege.school.nz
homepage_content: Paeroa College Welcome to Paeroa College Nau mai haere mai ki te kura tuarua o Paeroa. A very warm welcome to Paeroa College. Nestled in the heart of the charming rural town of Paeroa, Paeroa College is a state co-educational secondary school (years 9-13) with a rich history dating back to 1958. Our expansive grounds boast a beautiful campus of modern classrooms and specialised facilities, all designed with an intentional environmental focus. Paeroa College is an integral part of the local community inspiring our students in the classroom, on the sports field, and throughout their lives beyond school. Our school motto, "Mahi Tahi Kia Kaha," encapsulates our core value: through dedicated teamwork and hard work, we achieve remarkable things. At Paeroa College, we prioritise academic excellence while fostering individual growth. We prioritise strong partnerships with whānau and uphold the principles of Te Tiriti o Waitangi. This ensures every student's learning journey is personalised and tailored to their unique needs and aspirations. Our flexible and integrated curriculum places student needs at the forefront of every learning experience. This personalised approach empowers all students to achieve their NCEA goals and confidently pursue their desired pathways, whether it's further education, vocational training, or entering the workforce. Our dedicated team of Deans, Counselors, Nurses, and Careers Advisors collaborate closely to provide comprehensive pastoral support for all our young people. This holistic approach ensures they receive the care and guidance necessary to thrive academically, socially, and emotionally. Beyond academics, Paeroa College thrives on sporting and cultural excellence. Our Kapa Haka group is a treasured tradition, both for the school and the wider community. We boast a strong sporting legacy, with successful teams in rugby, touch, football, basketball, netball, motocross and lacrosse. These teams consistently achieve high standards, often claiming top spots in local Hauraki and Thames Valley competitions. Our four Houses – Tara, Ngakotu, Rapiri, and Maru – are the heart of our school spirit. The House competition fosters a vibrant school culture by recognising all aspects of school life, from attendance and academic achievement to sports and community service. It provides every student with valuable opportunities to contribute and celebrate their daily successes. Paeroa College is deeply connected to our community. We actively engage in service projects and strive to be positive contributors to the town we call home. While we may be a smaller school, we possess a big heart and a strong sense of pride in both Paeroa and our college. Ngā mihi nui Andrew Cameron - Principal / Tumuaki Social Media LIKE Paeroa College on Facebook

Walk-ins are welcome. To reserve a table online please click our calendar to the left. You can also email us using the button below, call us on 09 909 7215, or text us on 027 215 2447 If our booking system shows the spot you want as unavailable, please call us as we may be able to assist. Please note email and text reservations are not confirmed until we have contacted you to confirm. For bookings of over 8 people, please email or phone the restaurant. At the request of our customers, all children in a booking must be aged 5 years and over. For details of our Booking Terms & Conditions and our Privacy Policy please click here Send an Email Private Dining, Events & Wine Cellar | One Tree Grill Epsom One Tree Grill offers purpose built dining facilities to suit both small groups and larger functions of up to 102 people. Make an Enquiry Whether it is a wedding, birthday or corporate event, we believe the key to a good function is the right blend of excellent food, a tailored environment and attentive but unobtrusive service. It is with these three key points in mind that we approach all our functions, no matter the size. If you would like a detailed functions pack, please use the 'Make an Enquiry' button and one will be emailed to you immediately. We have a range of areas to choose from including our private dining room, the courtyard through to the entire restaurant. Seven Reasons to Book Your Function or Event with Us: Professional – skilled, experienced staff take care of you from start to finish Detail focused – we take care of all of those annoying but important small details. Purpose built – the restaurant has been designed to cater for large bookings Customizable – we are more than happy to create individual menus & wine lists Private – we have three separate private dining areas available Location – within 10 minutes drive of Newmarket, Penrose and the airport Car parking – over 200 free car parks within 2 minutes walk Set Menus We recommend set menus for bookings of 10 or more persons. We have three set menu options available (vegetarian courses also available): $120 three course set menu $135 four course set menu $145 six course degustation menu We are more than happy to work with you to create a menu to match your occasion. Either way, you will be delighted with the dishes created by our highly regarded team of chefs. Click here to see our One Tree Grill video Other Services We also offer to arrange to have flowers for anniversaries or birthdays More Info For more information please contact our functions manager Tim Perry on: [email protected] or call 09 909 7215 Make an Enquiry Gift Vouchers & Dining Offers | One Tree Grill Auckland The perfect gift for those food and wine lovers in your life Exclusive Offers | One Tree Grill Our Story | One Tree Grill Restaurant Epsom outstanding, down-to-earth dining, every time Consistently ranked as one of Auckland’s top ten restaurants, One Tree Grill is a relaxed, upmarket suburban bistro where fine wine and outstanding food meet. We blend uncompromising quality with exceptional service - all without the unnecessary formality often associated with this style of dining. Located in Epsom, One Tree Grill has been an understated cornerstone of the Auckland restaurant landscape since 1996, and is far enough away from the hustle and bustle of the city to ensure a free car park only metres from our front door but still close enough to be just a matter of minutes from the centre of town. This central location also works well for functions, for which we have a choice of spaces to use. The menu is modern European / New Zealand cuisine and is characterised by uncomplicated flavours and fresh ingredients carefully sourced by our chef from the best suppliers we can find. Coupled with our extensive list of cellared wines, there’s always a perfect match to be had. With an increasing awareness of our environment, we have taken a full circle approach by not only composting our food waste but recycling it back in to our kitchen gardens. Our service is attentive but unobtrusive, our food exceptional but not architectural. We do believe in great flavours and a relaxing experience. We don’t believe in unnecessary ceremony or overbearing formality. One Tree Grill is a place that anyone can enjoy, whatever the reason or occasion and we look forward to sharing our One Tree Grill experience with you. Click here to see One Tree Grill video Careers We are always looking for talented and enthusiastic people to join our team. name: pattisandcream.co
homepage_content: Patti's and Cream Small batch, handmade ice cream & burgers We craft delicious, small batch, handmade ice cream & hot grilled burgers. Established in 2018, we are locally owned and operated in Dunedin, New Zealand. Dunedin’s best Hot grilled burgers Try our delicious gourmet hot grilled burgers, made with tasty milk buns, crispy iceberg lettuce, bread & butter pickles, caramelised onions and only the best quality, locally sourced meats and produce. All about the sauce • All about the burgers • All about being delicious • All about the sauce • All about the burgers • All about being delicious • All about the sauce • All about the burgers • All about being delicious • DELICIOUS SEASONAL, CLASSIC & LIMITED EDITION FLAVOURS DISCOVER OUR ICE CREAM FLAVOURS Mint chocolate chip Birthday cake Kūkū Coffee and cream Pear & blue cheese 3 Choc Lemon curd & marshmallow Rum & raisin Banana & roasted white chocolate Salted caramel ribbon Cookies & cream Spiced pear and chocolate Double fold vanilla Rose & pistachio Apple & oats No dairy cherry (V) Chocolate coconut & Raspberry (V) Boysenberry Swirl Blueberry & Banana Sorbet (V) Peppermint Patti Ice Cream Taco The Diner Visit The Diner at 412 George Street, Dunedin North 9016 for American inspired dining, serving our gourmet range of sides, milk bun burgers, handmade ice cream and desserts. Reservations are accepted via Eats (top right hand corner link on the page or on our google profile) or give us a call ( 03 425 9846 ). We accept reservations for groups of 4 plus. The Scoop Shop The Scoop Shop offers ready to order desserts, ice cream scoops to go, take-home ice cream tubs and our delicious range of sodas & shakes. Drop in for a scoop at 176 Eglinton Road, Mornington 9011. Where's Betty? We have retired our food truck after 6 long years of service. Come see us at our two shops Locations

name: formosagolfresort.co.nz
homepage_content: Home - Formosa Golf Resort World class 18-hole championship golf course Tee off on our stunning world class 18-hole championship golf course, designed by legend and 1963 Open Championship winner, Sir Bob Charles. Breathtaking shorelines views are yours to savour, making your game or casual round a memorable experience – with a host of options available during your experience with us. Weekly Specials Monday Mates Rates $45 for 9 or 18 holes all day Tee Time Tuesday $45 for 9 or 18 holes all day Contact our golf team to book: [email protected] | +64 09 218 3870 Sign up to our Newsletter By subscribing you accept our Privacy Policy Auckland WEATHER Follow us on social Tee off on our stunning course, then take time to wander the nearby coastal walkways or relax at Maraetai Beach, just minutes from the resort. This pocket of East Auckland is made for exploring with the whole family in mind. Whether you’re here to play, unwind, or simply take in the scenery. Book your stay now on our website. Looking for a slow afternoon treat? Our high tea by the sea is calling. From tiramisu and cheesecake twirls to mini quiches and savoury scones. Settle into your afternoon with a high tea full of delicious, traditional bites designed to share, all enjoyed with coastal views you can’t resist. Book your high tea now on our website. *Bookings are essential. Dreaming of a coastal wedding? Tucked along the Pohutukawa Coast, our elegant venues look out across peaceful, open sea views, creating the perfect and effortless setting. Our mid-week and winter weddings come with exclusive benefits that make planning simpler, smoother, and even more enjoyable. Whether you’re hosting an intimate gathering or a full celebration, our team is here to make your day beautifully memorable. Ready to start planning by the sea? Find out more on our website. 📷: Jesse and Jessie Weddings Excited to know our winner for the perfect summer day? Congratulations @cpminto! 🎉 We hope you’re ready to enjoy a day out on the course with family and friends. Please drop us a message with your email address and we’ll be in touch to arrange your visit. A huge thank you to everyone who entered. We loved hearing how you'd spend this summer at Rydges Formosa Golf Resort. Last-minute end of year plans? Swap the boardroom for the golf course and make your end-of-year celebration one to remember. From relaxed rounds to creative team-building exercises, Rydges Formosa Golf Resort is the perfect play to wrap up the year. Find out more on our website. Celebrate Christmas Day and leave the cooking to us. Join us for a festive buffet lunch at Nineteen Restaurant & Bar and celebrate the season. Indulge in all your Christmas favourites including baked ham, roast turkey, lamb, seafood, and festive desserts, all with sparkling views of the Hauraki Gulf and Rangitoto Island. Thursday 25 December 2025 | 12pm – 2pm Adults $145pp | Children under 12 $65pp Pre-booking essential. Limited spaces available. Book your table today on our website. Live Jazz, ocean breeze, and great views. Join us this Sunday with Big Kahuna Burger and unwind to the smooth sounds of live jazz from 12:30 to 3:30 PM. It’s the perfect way to spend your Sunday afternoon. Great food, great music, and an unbeatable view. Make the most of the longer days. Whether it’s a couples getaway or a weekend with friends, Rydges Formosa Golf Resort is your spring escape by the sea. Practice your swing, soak in the views, enjoy lunch at Nineteen Restaurant, or simply relax in your private villa. Book your next stay with us: https://tinyurl.com/mw8s4n33 As the warmer season rolls in, the sun glints off the ocean and the greens call you out onto the course. Longer days mean more time to perfect your swing, enjoy the fresh air and share a round with friends and family. This season, we’re giving one lucky person the chance to win the ultimate day out at Rydges Formosa Golf Resort with a round of golf for four players and two carts included. To enter, comment what you’re most excited about this summer. The best answer takes home the prize. Winner announced 01/11/2025. T&Cs apply. School holidays are here. Time to get the kids out and about! Just 40 minutes from the CBD, Rydges Formosa Golf Resort is the perfect place for fresh air, open spaces, and family fun. Have a swing on the course, admire the stunning views over the Hauraki Gulf, and round out the day with a family meal at our on-site Nineteen Restaurant. Make a day of it or stay with us for a family getaway by the coast. Find out more about our course and villas here: https://tinyurl.com/mr3see8b Celebrating love doesn’t get better than this at Rydges Formosa Golf Resort. Introducing our Wedding Giveaway winners, Rebecca and Carl. The day began in the villas before moving outside for a ceremony surrounded by their nearest and dearest. Swaying palm trees, a gentle ocean breeze, and sunny skies set the scene on the coast. As the evening drew in under golden skies and breathtaking sunsets, family and friends gathered to share in their special moment. A beautiful day shared with laughter and joy. Congratulations to Rebecca and Carl 💍❤️ 📸: PiaPhotography Only at Rydges Formosa Golf Resort will you find an 18-hole championship course overlooking sweeping coastal views, just 40 minutes from Auckland. Whether you’re planning a weekend getaway, a wedding by the water, or a corporate retreat, Rydges Formosa is the destination. Learn more about our one-of-a-kind venue through our website. Just a 40-minute drive from Auckland’s CBD, Rydges Formosa offers conference venues for up to 280 guests. With natural light and stunning coastal views, our versatile spaces are ideal for everything from celebrations and presentations to planning sessions. Equipped with state-of-the-art AV, high-speed Wi-Fi, flexible seating, and the support of dedicated event planners, every detail is designed to ensure your event runs seamlessly. Find out more about our corporate spaces today through our website. Unleash your inner artist and join us for an afternoon of sipping and painting! With the talented Paint & Chill team to guide you, you’ll create a stunning piece of art while enjoying drinks and great company. Sunday 5 October 2:30 PM $59 per person including a glass of wine, prosecco, or beer on arrival. All materials are provided. Spaces are limited—reserve your spot now! Link in bio. Thanks to everyone who came out on Saturday! A great first edition of the Mudslingers golf comp! Our villas boast striking coastal and garden views, right from your doorstep. Spend a night or make it a weekend getaway. Enjoy your stay with rounds on our championship golf course, coastal explorations, or simply unwinding in complete comfort with amenities designed just for you. End the day with a sunset as breathtaking as the morning sun. It doesn’t get any better than this. Your coastal escape awaits. Chasing a golf getaway or a peaceful coastal escape? Wake up to panoramic views of the Hauraki Gulf from your private villa - designed with contemporary style and thoughtful touches that refresh. From plush beds and cosy lounge areas to spacious bathrooms with walk‑in showers, baths, and skylights - every detail is made for comfort. Step out onto your patio to take in the scenery or enjoy direct access to the golf course, all just 40 minutes from Auckland’s CBD. name: oceansideapartments.co.nz
homepage_content: Waihau Bay East Cape Accomodation | Oceanside Apartments Home Our Accommodation The Area About Us Contact BOOK NOW This summer - come enjoy one of New Zealand's best kept secret gems! WAIHAU BAY BEACHFRONT ACCOMMODATION Beachfront accommodation perfectly located for renowned Waihau Bay fishing, exploring the East Cape region, or relaxing in an idyllic beachside setting in this beautiful bay. We are situated on the safe and sandy beach (pictured) considered to be perhaps the best in the East Cape area. After settling into your self-contained spacious apartment, relax – enjoy the fishing, amazing ocean views, or exploring the beach - then finish your day soaking up the spectacular sunsets of Waihau Bay. View Accommodation Options SEASCAPE UPSTAIRS APARTMENT SEABREEZE DOWNSTAIRS APARTMENT THE BACH REAR ONE ROOM APARTMENT CENTRAL LOCATION One and a half hours drive east of Opotiki along the scenic State Highway 35, Oceanside is well placed for exploring the areas around: Whanarua Bay, Cape Runaway, Lottin Point, Hicks Bay, Te Araroa, and the road to East Cape Lighthouse – all within a 45 minute drive. Waihau Bay is a small coastal bay with everything you might need, yet still isolated enough to be removed from the hustle and bustle of modern day life. Petrol, a country store and hotel bar in the village nearby. MAKE A BOOKING TODAY BOOK NOW Waihau Bay Fishing We have boat parking available onsite, and we welcome your enquiries. name: portershotel.co.nz
homepage_content: Accommodation Napier, Hastings | Best Accommodation Hawkes Bay Check in for a season full of wine, art, food & events BOOK HERE *Terms & Conditions Apply Luxury accommodation in the heart of Havelock North Village. Porters Boutique Hotel offers 4.5 star accommodation located near Hastings and Napier, New Zealand Step into a world of luxury, comfort and relaxation. Porters Boutique Hotel offers unique boutique accommodation near both Napier and Hastings cities in Hawke’s Bay, New Zealand, based in the charming Havelock North Village. Unwind in elegantly appointed guest rooms, complete with plush, classic furnishings and adorned with original local artwork. Enjoy attentive service within a stylish, intimate space that reflects the beauty and grandeur of the breathtaking Hawke’s Bay region. Porters Boutique Hotel is also the perfect venue for your conference or corporate event. With the latest facilities in modern surroundings, our team will ensure your function is a success. Book Luxury Accommodation in Havelock North Great savings with our Harvest Hawke's Bay 2025 Package Check it out Enjoy luxury surrounded by good company in Porters Apartment. The Porters Apartment is located within the Village Exchange in the heart of Havelock North Village offers sophisticated accommodation which is perfect for those that want to pair luxury accomodation with good company. Boasting floor to ceiling living room windows offering views towards Te Mata Peak and Mt Erin, the Porters Apartment features 3 double bedrooms with individual ensuites, an open plan dining and living room along with fully equipped kitchen & laundry facilities. Luxury Serviced Apartment Porters Apartment Porters Apartment is located within the Village Exchange in the heart of Havelock North Village and offers sophisticated accommodation for discerning travelers. With floor to ceiling living room windows offering views towards Te Mata Peak and Mt Erin, the apartment features 3 double bedrooms with individual ensuites, an open plan dining and living room along with fully equipped kitchen and laundry facilities. The apartment can also be configured as a 2 bedroom option . Decorated with high-end furniture, and gorgeous natural wood tones, the apartment gives off a warm but sophisticated atmosphere. The apartment is in easy walking distance to many of Havelock North’s restaurants, cafes and bars along with boutique stores offering high end fashion, galleries, bookstores and beauty therapy. Book Now. Rooms & Suites Experience the ultimate in luxury comfort in our beautifully decorated, spacious guest rooms and suites. Porters Boutique Hotel offers superb comfort and quality for business travellers visiting Hawke’s Bay. Luxury accommodation in New Zealand at its best. Learn. name: palmaccommodation.co.nz
homepage_content: Palm Accommodation – Welcome to Palm Accommodation! Nestled in the picturesque Hokowhitu neighborhood of Palmerston North, our hostel offers a warm and comfortable stay for all our guests. With fully furnished rooms equipped with a Heat-Pump and TV in each one, you can relax in style after a busy day of exploring the city. Come experience the warmth and comfort of our hospitable hostel and make your stay in Palmerston North an unforgettable one! Skip to content Home The Palm Accommodation Secure and Fully Furnished, Short and Long Term Options Available Hokowhitu - Palmerston North CLICK HERE FOR PRICING features of our accomodation Welcome to Palm Accommodation, where affordable and convenient city living awaits. Our 15 fully furnished rooms provide a comfortable retreat, complete with Wi-Fi access, a heat pump, and office amenities for work or study. Security is paramount with surveillance cameras in place. Our room rates cater to both short-term and long-term stays, starting at $260 per week, including electricity. Weekly cleaning for long-term guests is a bonus. We offer additional services such as room reservations, parking, luggage storage, and laundry facilities. Paying rent is simple, and moving out requires a two-week notice period. Enjoy included amenities like free Wi-Fi, comfortable couches and tables, modern bathrooms, and a 24-hour TV lounge. Long-term accommodation options are available, with a seamless application process. Feel at home at Palm Accommodation, where warm, inviting living meets city convenience. For inquiries, reach out via our Contact Us Form – we’re eager to welcome you! Learn More 24/7 CCTV Fully monitored public areas for your piece of mind and safety Fully Furnished Rooms 15 fully furnished rooms with individual heat pumps for a comfortable environment Quiet Location Located in the quiet suburb of Hokowhitu Close to Public Transport Easy access to transportation

name: residence.co.nz
homepage_content: Residence – Quality studio accommodation, great lifestyle, right price Hit enter to search or ESC to close A smart place to live Quality studio accommodation, great lifestyle, right price. Welcome to Residence, providing smart studio accommodation in great locations. Our modern co-living solution gives you the comfort, privacy and security you need to let you get on with living. Our generous ensuite studios start from $350 per week, including all your bills. Move in tomorrow. Stay as long as you like. Our flexibility makes it easy. Comfort Rooms from $280 per week Your home away from home Our modern, light and airy buildings are designed to make your life easy. A comfortable and secure ensuite studio is your own private space, while shared facilities, including a full kitchen, lounge and laundry, are light, modern and professionally maintained. We provide Sky TV, power, and water, so there are no hidden costs. High-speed internet is available in all buildings. Your studio room comes with an ensuite with shower, fridge, bench, closet with drawers and enough space for you to make it your own. Convenience Everything at your doorstep Our buildings are carefully located in great urban main streets, giving you everything you need right outside the door. Transport, food, entertainment, exercise – are all right here! If you feel like staying in, high quality TV and internet connections mean you can relax and entertain your way. With the concept of co-living exploding around the planet, more and more people are choosing the convenience of private studios with additional shared facilities in better locations. Why be stuck down a back street miles away from everything, when you can be here instead! You also have the flexibility of moving on at any time with just 48 hours notice. Security No worries It’s important to feel safe, and at Residence you will. Swipe card security for your personal space, our on-site managers keeping an eye on everything, and camera monitoring throughout allow you to relax and feel safe and secure . “ Residence studios are warm and clean, fantastic city fringe locations, and I’m meeting likeminded people. Lauren, 24yrs, Account Executive Less travel time means more you time Paying for what you need not what you don’t Residence Locations Auckland, New Zealand All of our properties are convenient to transport, shops, entertainment and recreational activities. name: sandsbbk.co.nz
homepage_content: Home - The Sands Brewery Bar and Kitchen Home Events Menus Wine List Gallery Contact Us Reservations View our menus The Sands Brewery Bar and Kitchen The Sands Brewery Bar & Kitchen is a Monteiths themed brewery bar specifically designed for good times, great beer and awesome hospitality! Located directly opposite Nelson’s famous Tahuna beach on Rocks road in the Sands Apartments building with the sunniest court yard in town and plenty of parking. Food is available all day. Start the day with a fabulous breakfast from 7am, stick with us and roll into lunch until 5.00 pm, followed by dinner menu items designed to satisfy everyone’s appetite. Just wanting coffee by the beach? Serving Halo Coffee have in or takeaway. What can we offer you to drink? Traditional Monteith’s Beers on tap such as Original, Golden, Radler, Pilsner, Black, Mid strength & of course the very popular Apple Cider. Unique to the Montetihs Brewery Bars is the Monteiths Brewer Series craft range. Currently we have American Pale Ale & the Southern Pale Ale. Ever popular Heineken & Heineken Light are also on Tap along with assorted bottled brewer series beers & ciders. Local Wines from around the Nelson/Tasman region. We are open 7 days (with no surcharge on public holidays). Bookings are welcome but not essential. To make a reservation Click here . Our friendly staff will only be too pleased to make your day/evening experience a great & memorable one. Also we have courtesy van operating 7 days a week so call us and book your ride. Book your next mid winter christmas function with us now!! set menu to suit So come on down & enjoy Nelson's newest pub by the beach. We are open christmas day!
