name: raviz.co.nz
homepage_content: Raviz Indian Eatery Restaurant Auckland City | Home Delivery & Food Takeaway | Best Indian Restaurant Auckland About Raviz Indian Eatery Hobson Street Raviz Indian Eatery, located at 61 Hobson Street in Auckland's central business district, has been a cornerstone of authentic Indian dining in New Zealand since its establishment in 2000. Founded by Ravie Singh, the restaurant aims to provide patrons with a genuine taste of India's rich culinary heritage. The menu at Raviz is extensive, offering a variety of traditional dishes that cater to diverse palates. Signature items include the Chicken Tikka Raviz, various biryani selections, and an array of tandoori specialties. Vegetarian options such as Karahi Paneer and Navratan Korma are also available, ensuring that all guests find something to their liking. To complement the flavorful curries, a selection of naan breads, including garlic and Peshwari naan, is offered. The restaurant's ambiance is enhanced by traditional Indian music and vibrant dÃ©cor, creating an inviting atmosphere that transports diners to India. Whether you're dining in, opting for takeaway, or utilizing their meal delivery service, Raviz ensures a memorable experience with attentive and friendly staff. For those seeking an authentic Indian culinary journey in Auckland, Raviz Indian Eatery on Hobson Street stands as a testament to traditional flavors and warm hospitality. WHAT WE'RE OFFERING At Raviz Indian Eatery â Hobson Street, we offer authentic Indian dishes, including rich curries, sizzling tandoori, aromatic biryanis, and fresh naan. Enjoy dine-in, takeaway, or delivery for a flavorful experience. ENTREES Start your meal with our delicious Indian entrÃ©es, featuring crispy, spiced, and flavor-packed delights. MAINS Delicious, authentic Indian mains, from rich curries to sizzling tandoori dishes, crafted with tradition. RESERVATION Reserve your table at Raviz Indian Eatery Hobson Street for an authentic Indian dining experience today! Sub Continental Cuisine Authentic Subcontinental flavors with rich spices, aromatic curries, and tandoori delights for a true taste experience. ORDER ONLINE Indo - Chinese A flavorful fusion of Indian spices and Chinese techniques, creating bold, aromatic, and savory dishes. ORDER ONLINE Desserts Indulge in rich Indian desserts like Gulab Jamun and Mango Kulfi, bursting with authentic flavors. ORDER ONLINE This is where you go in Auckland for indian food that will blow you mind, tender delicious. Clean spotless, excellent service. Iâm a chef my mates a chef we are both highly impressed and we are hard bitten fussy old blokes. This is Professional recommendation not just a Joe blow. ORAC ENSOR First time ordering here. Food was great & staff were friendly, I highly recommend if you're in the CBD. Not too sure why there's so many negative reviews? if you're after good quality Indian Cuisine then give them a go, l couldn't fault the service or the food....it was great. Dan M Good place in the CBD to have Indian food. Initially thought it was a Pakistani restaurant due to the name, so I was avoiding this restaurant because I was looking for Indian style food. But then I tried one time and found the name is based on managing director Ravie. The food was authentic Indian and tasty. YOGESH KUMAR Rice Fragrant, fluffy, and perfectly cookedâour rice pairs beautifully with curries, stir-fries, and grilled delights. ORDER ONLINE Side Dish Perfectly spiced and flavorful, our side dishes complement every meal with authentic Indian taste. name: rossmotels.co.nz
homepage_content: Ross Motel 0 Ross Motel West Coast, New Zealand Book Your Stay Family-owned and pet-friendly Welcome to Ross Motel! We are a family-owned and operated motel right on the doorstep of the West Coast Wilderness Trail. Make yourself at home and enjoy the comfort and facilities of our motel units. Studio Unit - 2+ people - $140 per night ( +$20 per extra person ) Classic Room - 2+ people - $170 per night ( +$20 per extra person ) 2 Bedroom Unit - 2+ people - $170 per night ( +$20 per extra person ) West Coast Wilderness Trail Voted the number one cycle trail in New Zealand, the West Coast Wilderness Trail begins or ends right on our doorstep. Spend the night with us before you pedal off the following day to explore our Untamed Natural Wilderness. Explore Ross Beach The West Coast is famous for its vibrant sunsets. After a meal at The Historic Royal Empire Hotel, take a stroll along Ross Beach, take in the views of the Southern Alps, and enjoy a sunset for yourself. Experience Gold Mining History Ross is a town steeped in gold mining history. The Ross Goldfields and Information is just a two-minute stroll from the motel. Try your hand at gold panning or take a walk along the historical water race track. About Your Hosts Joseph is a retired engineer, Catherine was a nurse. One day while living in Riwaka, they spotted a motel for sale in Ross on the West Coast of New Zealand. They were ready for a lifestyle changer, so here they are.

Dinein and Takeaways About Shiraz About Shiraz Indian Restaurant The very first Shiraz Indian restaurant was opened in 1996 in Whangarei. name: seaviewmarina.co.nz
homepage_content: Compass Coffee Home > Retail > Compass Coffee Monday to Friday 7:30am - 3:30pm Saturday and Sunday 8:30am - 3:30pm Compass Coffee has been open at Seaview Marina since 2017. Starting out on the roadside by the Lowry Bay Yacht Club the café has grown in size from one caravan to an additional container, deck and jetty, to a 3m x 9m portacom kitchen and servery. Being substantially bigger, this new space has given Compass Coffee the opportunity to extend their food range as well as provide total shelter and comfort when ordering in this very unique facility. In the meantime our little fire in the Container Coffee Lounge is operational and the pontoon is a real feature with vessels of all sizes coming alongside for coffee, thus truly making Compass Coffee at Seaview Marina the very first drive thru cafe for boats in New Zealand. Angelique Jackson and Michael Fenton —Compass Coffee

With a range of accommodation options available, including motel units, 2-bedroom family units, self-contained units, affordable cabins and powered campsites , our campground has all the amenities and facilities you need for a relaxing break. See our extra special deals on our already competitive prices in our hot deal specials at the bottom of this page. Accommodation Choose from a motel unit, 2-bedroom family unit, self-contained unit, kitchenette unit or ensuite unit or cabin. Alternatively you can pitch your tent or park your campervan on one of our sites. We offer a range of accommodation to suit all group sizes and budgets . Facilities Our accommodation has everything you need including a swimming pool and spa, a communal kitchen and BBQ area and tidy shower and toilets. Fishing Enjoy fishing in the nearby streams or head out onto Lake Rotorua. Our on-site tackle shop has everything you need to catch a good haul, and we have fish filleting station and ice available back at the camp. Attractions Our campground is conveniently located for most of Rotorua's best tourist attractions and we are just a short walk from Ngongotaha Village which has shops, a supermarket, a cafe, takeaways and much more. homepage_content: Food Trip Ltd | Matamata | ORDER ONLINE | Takeaway | TuckerFox NZ Welcome to Food Trip Ltd PRE ORDER ONLINE Welcome to Food Trip Ltd Order Online from Food Trip Ltd Filipino * 77 Broadway Matamata 3400 * Online Menu * Takeaway * Secure Online Payments * TOP SELLERS Pork Bao Buns (2 Pcs) $11.20 Pan Fried Dumplings (10 Pcs) $15.70 TOP SELLERS Pork Bao Buns (2 Pcs) $11.20 Pan Fried Dumplings (10 Pcs) $15.70 Menus PRE ORDER ONLINE Online Operating Hours Pickup Thursday Closed 11am to 8pm Friday Closed 11am to 8pm Saturday Closed Closed Sunday Closed Closed Monday Closed Closed Tuesday Closed 11am to 8pm Wednesday Closed 11am to 8pm REVIEWS This was such a special place. The food was great, love me some Filipino food. My friends and I had a great experience eaten in also. Friendly and helpful staff. Took home some amazing ube cake. Would recommend, especially if you havent had Phillipino food before 🙌🏽 Jayden Fairbairn-Lowe (Jayden) Filipino vibes. We were hesitant at first as there were no customers. But the staff and owner is friendly. We had sisig, kare-kare, lumpia, pancit and 2 drinks (frappe and blue curacao). I just have one problem with the lumpia rolls, it was a bit bland without the sweet chili sauce. But everything was delicious! Different delicacies of Pinoy foods 🤤 We took home buco pie and puto, I can tell that the puto was days old. But buco pie was yummy! We hope to go back and explore Matamata again soon. Katherine Rose Huizo It was quite warm in the restaurant. The lady who served us was friendly and chatty. The food was pretty good but small portions though. It is worth a try if you are in the area and craving for Asian food. STP I am Filipino, and I can confidently say that the Filipino food at Food Trip tasted great! The service is warm and friendly. Would 100 percent go again, in fact we went twice during our stay at Matamata because it was just that good! Learn More Previous Next Nau mai Haere mai - Welcome one and all Tahuna Pod Hostel is located in the heart of Queenstown, New Zealand and offers affordable, premium accommodation for adults over 18 in a relaxed atmosphere. Our facilities are modern, clean and spacious. We have onsite parking, free WIFI and offer a variety of single and queen pods as well as private rooms. This well-established hostel also features a large balcony area with stunning views overlooking Queenstown. Guests have access to shared bathroom facilities, located on every floor. Please note we only accept guests aged 18 and above. Learn More Attractions KJet Queenstown Get ready for an insane 60 minute Queenstown Jet boat ride thundering across three waterways travelling at speeds of up to 95kph in the fastest and meanest Jet boats in town. Blast across Lake Wakatipu and down the world-famous Kawarau and Shotover Rivers with 45km of unforgettable thrills, 360 degree spins and adrenaline in one of the worldâs most stunning locations. Departing every hour on the hour from Central Queenstown, come and experience the worldâs first Jet boat ride with Kawarau Jet (KJet) from the Main Town Pier or Frankton Marina. Learn More Coronet Peak Welcome to Coronet Peak , the home of the Southern Hemisphereâs longest maintained mountain bike single-track, measuring 1200m from top to bottom and an alpine adventure playground for all. Some of our summer activities on offer: Peak Gondola to the summit of Coronet Peak for world-famous views Mountain Bike trails with over 1200m of vertical descent Mountain Bike shuttle and bike hire CafÃ© 1200 - catch a drink and a snack with one of Queenstown's best views NZ's highest Disc Golf course Learn More AJ Hackett Bungy Experience the thrill of a lifetime with AJ Hackett Bungy in Queenstown, the birthplace of commercial bungy jumping! Leap from the iconic Kawarau Bridge or push your limits with the world-famous Nevis Bungy, standing 134m high. AJ Hackett offers more than just bungyâtry the exhilarating Nevis Swing, the worldâs biggest swing, or glide above Queenstown with the Ledge SkySwing. For adrenaline junkies or first-timers, these experiences promise unmatched excitement and breathtaking views. Challenge yourself and feel the rush with AJ Hackettâs unforgettable, high-adventure experiences in the stunning landscapes of New Zealandâs adventure capital! Learn More Time Tripper Queenstownâs only underwater experience takes you on a journey through time and legend beginning many millions of years ago. Head down two flights of stairs under Lake Wakatipu into our underwater theatre. The famous fish, diving ducks and slinky eels are visible until a large cinema screen descends and you begin your time travel journey. As you wait for the next time jump window to open, youâll get to see the beautiful love story and MÄori Legend of Lake Wakatipu. Your time travel pilot will guide you back 90 million years, through the time of the dinosaurs, take you to when New Zealand was formed, fly you deep into the earth when the Southern Alps were created and through the glacier that carved out Lake Wakatipu. Ending in present day Queenstown, you then experience adventure activities you can do â all from the comfort of your rumbling seat! You then experience 15 minutes of underwater viewing where we feed the famous diving ducks, slinky eels and rainbow & brown trout that lie beneath. name: ruapehuviewsmotel.co.nz
homepage_content: Accommodation at Ruapehu Views Motel, Ohakune, New Zealnd 06 385 8729 Welcome to Ruapehu Views Motel, Ohakune Accommodation The Ruapehu Views Motel is the perfect Ohakune accommodation for the Turoa ski field for some superb winter skiing, walking the world-famous Tongariro Crossing or simply for exploring the Tongariro National Park. Situated at the bottom of Mt Ruapehu in the Ohakune township, the Ruapehu Views Motel offers fantastic views of the mountain from all 8 upstairs units, free off-street parking, a laundry, drying room and a spa pool. About Us A 14 unit motel situated in Ohakune's town centre consisting of various sized modern, clean and comfortable units, all serviced daily. Upstairs units have great mountain views. Facilities include, WiFi, off-street parking, spa pool, laundry and drying room, friendly and helpful staff. Owners: Scott and Dara Graham. Reviews Basic Accommodation with a Great View Reviewed 24 Nov 2015 Although this motel is quite basic it had everything we needed for our one night stay. We had an upstairs room with a magnificent view of Mt Ruapehu where we relaxed on the balcony having a quiet drink soaking in the view. It was a short stroll to the restaurant area and there were quite a few to choose from. We enjoyed our stopover in Ohakune. HormuzV Great Customer Service! Reviewed 20 Jul 2015 Pleasant stay, nice and quiet. The rooms are basic but very clean and comfortable. After a day on the mountain we loved a soak in the hot tub. The hotel is located about five minutes walk to the town centre. Reception was very welcoming and friendly. They went out of their way to accommodate our needs. I would definitely stay here again. xAnjax Good Clean Accommodation Reviewed 22 Sep 2014 We were away on a lads trip away. The Accommodation was nice, clean and comfortable. We didn't spend a lot of time here but definitely served its purpose as a place to stay and play for a group of lads. Bed, hot showers and clean towels... All we needed. We had four rooms and each room was a little different with layout and beds, some had cooking facilities and some didn't. This wasn't a problem for us, I'm sure you can ask for any type of room you require here. We ate out so we only needed basics. Motel a 2min walk to main centre of town with supermarket, restaurants, cafés and bars, great location. Try the kebabs!! barty11 Current Weather In Ohakune Ruapehu Views Motel on Facebook Contact Ruapehu Views Motel ENQUIRE BOOK NOW

If you are looking for luxury hotel accommodation, then St. Luke’s is your answer to Queenstown luxury hotels, the perfect location for easy access to Queenstown ski areas, wineries, outdoor activities, shops & restaurants. Queenstown is an internationally renowned holiday destination that offers ample choice for those who visit. The way you choose to spend your time in Queenstown is up to you, if you would like to relax and breathe in the fresh mountain air whilst sipping on some local wine, or get active on the variety of internationally acclaimed ski fields, the choice is yours. name: smithandsmith.co.nz
homepage_content: Windscreen Repair Manukau Auckland | Windscreen Replacement Manukau Auckland Please wait while we work on your request. This might take a while… Manukau Branch 22C Cavendish drive, Manukau, Auckland Book Now 0800 48 33 88 How to find us We are located at 22C Cavendish drive, Manukau . Opening hours Mon 8:00am - 5:00pm Tue 8:00am - 5:00pm Wed 8:00am - 5:00pm Thu 8:00am - 5:00pm Fri 8:00am - 5:00pm Sat 9:00am - 4:30pm Sun Closed Whatever piece of glass has been damaged on your vehicle, the highly-skilled team at Smith&Smith® Manukau can help. Book an appointment with us for your vehicle glass repairs or replacements. Our friendly team at Smith&Smith® Manukau can help repair a chip in your windscreen or replace your damaged vehicle glass. We are New Zealand's leading vehicle glass repairer and preferred supplier to most major insurance companies. We can make your claim hassle-free by looking after the paperwork and getting you back on the road fast. Why choose Smith&Smith® We recycle more glass than any other repairer. Our workmanship on glass installations is guaranteed for the lifetime of your vehicle and we have over 7,000 customer reviews so you know you can trust us. Find out more How to take photos of your glass damage We need your help to ensure we have selected the correct glass for your vehicle. Please follow the instructions that apply to your glass damage below for taking photos. Damage Type: Windscreen Crack or Shattered Windscreen Take a photo of the safety stamp. This is often found on the bottom edge of the windscreen. Take a second photo of the area behind your rear view mirror from the outside. We use this to identify the sensors your screen has. Take a third photo of the dashboard to the right of the steering wheel. This will indicate if your windscreen is heated. Examples of the photos we would like you to send. Please note that photos in landscape mode are preferred. Windscreen Chips Place a $2 coin next to the chip Take two photos using the images below as a reference. Photo 1: Close up photo of the coin and the chip. Photo 2: A photo of the entire windscreen with the coin next to the damage. Examples of the photos we would like you to send. Please note that photos in landscape mode are preferred. Side Glass Take a photo of the safety stamp. This is often found on the bottom edge of the window on the opposite side of the vehicle to where the glass was damaged. Take a photo of the side of the vehicle where the damaged glass is located. Examples of the photos we would like you to send. Please note that photos in landscape mode are preferred.

name: taupoaccommodation.co
homepage_content: Taupo Accommodation | the best holiday home apartment rental in Taupo, CNN's best places to visit Riverside Apartment dining and living area with views over the Waikato river Riverside Apartment's master bedroom waterfront views Riverside Apartment, Watermark Villas, Taupo Pool available October holidays through to Easter Riverside apartment. Three-bedrooms, stunning water views No obligation booking request Looking for a holiday home to rent in Taupo? Riverside Apartment was the winner of the 2023 THA Oceania Travel and Hospitality Award for best waterfront apartment in the Waikato region. It has also been reviewed as one of the 'ten must-see New Zealand Airbnb spots' by the New Zealand Herald. Book directly with us for the best rates, guaranteed. Here's why we were reviewed so highly. Watermark Villas apartment with panoramic riverfront views Perhaps the first thing you will notice when you arrive at your Riverside Apartment are the amazing views. Floor-to-ceiling double glazing allows panoramic vistas of the wide, blue Waikato River passing below and across to the green open space of the domain. These views can be taken in from the kitchen, dining, living area, balcony and the master bedroom - they are truly spectacular. Riverside Apartment - 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms Tell me more Sleeps up to six people Two queen sized beds are complimented by two single beds in the third bedroom. A portacot is also available. The master bedroom takes in the same magnificent view that the living and dining areas overlook. The living area is wonderfully arranged all on one level making living easy. Spacious, beautifully finished and furnished you'll feel at home immediately. Spread out, enjoy the space and relax so that you truly enjoy the view that the apartment offers over the river to the tree-lined domain. Kick back on the balcony to enjoy the late evening sun and enjoy the serenity that this tranquil riverfront apartment can offer. Stunning water views and fully self-contained Self catering, well-appointed kitchen and dining area You can prepare meals in the fully appointed kitchen and savour a glass of wine while taking in the relaxing, views of the river gliding past the front of the apartment. The kitchen is fitted with oven, ceramic hob, range hood, microwave oven, fridge/freezer, Nespresso machine and other small appliances. Or, a ten minute stroll finds you in the centre of Taupo township, with its many restaurants, bars, cafes, boutique art galleries and shops. Riverside Apartment is conveniently placed close to Taupo town but enjoys absolute tranquility, away from roads and noise. Taupo and Lake Taupo - The Tongariro Alpine Crossing and much more Found on the shore of Australasia's largest fresh water lake, Taupo is world famous as New Zealand's North Island playground. Adrenaline-pumping activities include bungy-jumping, jet boating, white water rafting and skydiving. If that's just a little too much excitement you can bike the lake trails, hike through native bush or explore the many cultural and historical sites in the area. Check out the many things to do including the famous Tongariro Alpine Crossing . Home to a series of events (mostly in summer) the Taupo domain and amphitheatre is literally just across the river from our apartment - so you can open up the sliding doors and listen to concerts for free and from the comfort of the apartment! Check out our events page for more information on future concerts and we also have some Taupo kid-friendly activities that we can recommend. The thermal wonderland that surrounds Taupo offers a glimpse into its fiery origin. Lake Taupo was predominantly created by a volcanic blast some 26,000 years ago - geysers, boiling mud pools and warm, geothermal hotpools are all within easy reach of Riverside Apartment. Wind down in one of the town's many cafes, bars or restaurants - or indulge in perhaps the best view of all from the lounge of our apartment and plan what lies ahead for tomorrow. Free Wifi, free Netflix and more. Riverside Apartment has, in addition to the curved TV, free and unlimited wifi (a high-speed fibre connection). A blue-tooth sound system is available for your listening pleasure. Complimentary Netflix is also enabled for our guests. Heated swimming pool onsite The Watermark Villas complex has a heated swimming pool - heated from October (School Holidays) to April (Easter) available for use by our guests. Perfect for a relaxing daily swim and of course and the kids will love it. Please note that over the winter months the pool may not be available for swimming - please contact us to confirm availability if this is important. Stay at Riverside Apartment Your hosts are Linda and Greg, whose love for travel and their own experiences have led them to develop some of the best holiday accommodation experiences you'll find in Taupo. Whether you are a tourist on your first trip to this incredible region or a regular visitor they want to make your stay special and look forward to welcoming you to Riverside Apartment. Please contact us with your questions or make a booking request . (requires WhatsApp installed on your device) No obligation. No credit card required. Free quote. Choose your apartment to send us a booking request. Riverside One 3 bedrooms. Sleeps 6. Stunning river views. Two bathrooms. Full kitchen. Balcony. Free wifi and Netflix. Two car garaging. Free swimming pool (summer period). Free kayaks (year round). Washing machine. Dryer. Select Riverside Two 2 bedrooms. Sleeps 4+2. Stunning river views. Two bathrooms. Full kitchen. Large balcony. Free wifi and Netflix. Two car garaging. Free swimming pool (summer period). Free kayaks (year round). Washing machine. Select

name: trevelmond.com
homepage_content: About - Trevelmond Trevelmond Boutique Accommodation Home welcome About Who are we? Weddings your special day Events what’s happening Testimonials happy customers Contact get in touch Home About Weddings Events Testimonials Contact 027 4451988 06 8777157 About Trevelmond Villa, Lodge and Cottages are situated in a private country atmosphere only five minutes walk to the Village Boutique Shops and Restaurants and in the “Heart of Wine Country”. Havelock North is a quaint residential town, home to Te Mata Peak, surrounded by orchards and vineyards. Visitors can enjoy a number of New Zealand’s award winning wineries and restaurants or take a scenic drive to one of the many beaches. For those visitors wishing to unwind and relax, Trevelmond is the perfect location offering extensive gardens and park like grounds with views of Te Mata Peak. Trevelmond with its children’s playground at the front of the property, is also an ideal location for that perfect family holiday. Trevelmond has a variety of accommodation options from the five bedroom villa built in the early 1900s to the one bedroom cottage. The properties have been refurbished to provide boutique accommodation of the highest quality, with a variety of accommodation options to suit any guest. The Villa can accommodate up to 12 people, combine this with the Lodge and Cottages, and a number of people can stay in the same location. This means that friends and family can be based together to enjoy a group holiday. If you are planning a small event or family gathering, Trevelmond and the expansive grounds can also be hired. Each accommodation option has kitchen facilities (options ranging from kitchenette to full kitchens), TV (ranging from freeview to Sky), DVD players, wi-fi, electric blankets, laundry facilities and heating. Guests will also enjoy complimentary breakfast provisions on arrival, including Trevelmond’s fresh free range eggs. © Copyright 2025

name: tamarindofgisborne.com
homepage_content: Tamarind Indian restaurant and bar ,Gisborne Tehapara Newzealnd top of page WELCOME Welcome visitors to your site with a short, engaging introduction. Double click to edit and add your own text. Start Now Tamarind of Gisborne offers a one-of-a-kind dining experience, showcasing fresh, locally-sourced ingredients and the best of New Zealand cuisine. Whether you're planning a romantic dinner or a fun night out with friends, Tamarind is the perfect place to enjoy the vibrant flavors of Gisborne. Tamarind of Gisborne was founded by food lovers Pooja and CJ Singh, driven by their passion for creating and enjoying exceptional meals. This passion led to the establishment of a restaurant where the community can come together to enjoy unique cuisine and a warm atmosphere. Inspired by discovering at a wine and food festival how well Indian food pairs with certain wines, the idea took shape. We proudly feature vibrant local wines and the popular beer Gisborne Gold, created by my late friend Geoff. Supporting local suppliers is key to us, from tender lamb to fresh seafood provided by local fisheries. We’re grateful to our suppliers for consistently delivering the ingredients needed for our recipes. Freshness and creativity are at the heart of what we do. With a diverse menu and unmatched service, we offer a culinary experience like no other. Call us today to book your reservation! Experience the finest culinary events at Tamarind Gisborne. Enjoy delicious food and drinks while socializing with friends. Contact us for details! Receive a 10% discount on online orders. Enjoy 10% to 20% off with UberEATS and Delivereasy. Monday-Wednesday Dine-in and Takeaways Deal: $21 for all mains Don't miss out! Log In bottom of page

name: thorndon.org.nz
homepage_content: About Thorndon - Thorndon Residents Association About Thorndon Our neighbourhood is a unique mix of residential households (including Victorian era villas, workmen cottages and apartments) and government buildings and offices. We have two beautiful cathedrals, numerous educational institutions and important historic buildings and sites. Thorndon is the oldest suburb in New Zealand and lies at the northern end of Wellington’s central business district. It is flanked by the green town belt on Te Ahumairangi Hill to the west and the port facilities of Wellington Harbour to the east. We acknowledge with appreciation the funding support we receive from Wellington City Council. Thorndon’s History Thorndon is a suburb steeped in history. As well as being home to Parliament, it also contains several sites of particular significance in Wellington, such as Katherine Mansfield House, Old St Paul’s, and one of New Zealand’s oldest public houses, the Thistle Inn. Built in the 1960s, the Wellington Urban Motorway cut through Thorndon, separating its largely residential area with its business area. Close to the city centre, the railway station and motorway make the suburb’s heritage sites easily accessible. Thorndon also houses several embassies and consulates, such as the Australian High Commission, as well as the embassies of the Republic of the Philippines, Germany, and Cuba. It is also the official residence of the French Ambassador. Architecture Being one of New Zealand’s oldest residential suburbs, Thorndon has a diverse architectural history. Settlers surveying and building in Thorndon in the 1840s divided the land into one acre sections, which is still evident within the area today. Because of its steep landscape, parts of Thorndon has architecture unlike anywhere else in New Zealand. The social divisions of the 19th century are clear in the division between the large houses built on the flat land in the north of the suburb, and the workers’ houses built on the sloped landscape to the south. There was a surge in prosperity by the turn of the century, and many substantial homes were designed by leading architects. William Clayton – New Zealand’s first and only colonial architect – designed many significant buildings in Wellington, but is perhaps best known for designing Parliament buildings and Government House. He also constructed the first building in the country made of concrete, a house on Hobson St which has been incorporated into Queen Margaret College. Katherine Mansfield House is an example of houses built in the economic depression of the 1880s. Devoid of decoration, it lacks the ornamentation of houses in Thorndon that were built in more prosperous times. Ernst Plischke, an Austrian architect was one of the key figures to introduce modernism into Thorndon architecture after the Second World War, and worked on designs for housing blocks to be built in Wellington by the government. The Wellington Urban motorway cut through the area in the 1960s, which resulted in the destruction of about 400 houses. This led to a greater awareness of Thorndon’s heritage, and in the 1970s the Thorndon Society and Thorndon Trust were formed to preserve and protect the areas historic buildings. Remove Graffiti from Thorndon A Thorndon Residents’ Association communication initiative; collaboration between WCC and residents. The aim is to help protect the community from property vandalism in the form of graffiti. Vandalism locations, patterns and clean-up response stand-out when they are tracked on an interactive map. Click here to view the Safety and Graffiti map . Character Zone Because of Thorndon’s rich history, with many of its buildings providing a snapshot in time of the mid-nineteenth century, Wellington City Council has decided to ensure new buildings in Thorndon adhere to a code to protect its special character. The majority of buildings in Thorndon are over 90 years old, so the code have been prepared to ensure all buildings have a certain cohesiveness. The design guide provides the criteria for all prospective buildings, and although is flexible, it ensures all new buildings maintain the character of Thorndon. For more information on the planning codes, take a look at the design guide Learn more about us at Wikipedia Click here to be a Part of Our Community

homepage_content: Casual Dining - Vietnamese | Tryitout.nz | Auckland top of page OTAHUHU & EAST TAMAKI WE ARE BACK !! 7 DAYS A WEEK HOLIDAY HOURS 25/12 X-MAS DAY - CLOSED EVERY OTHER DAYS OPEN NORMAL HOURS BUN BO HUE Bún bò Huế is a hidden Vietnamese gem. It's a rich and spicy soup with deep layers of flavor. This Central Vietnamese soup is paired with tender slices of beef and pork, then topped with lots of fresh herbs FRIED RICE Stir seasoning liquid and add to fried rice, tossing to coat evenly. Serve fried rice sprinkled with cilantro or mint and dry-roasted peanuts PHO Pho (Phở) originated in the early 20th century in northern Vietnam. It is a Vietnamese soup consisting of broth, bánh phở (rice noodles), simple herbs and vegetables, and meat Menus Our Story Begins In The East Cuisine in this country of 70,000,000 people differs strikingly between the north, south and central regions, but two key features stand out. First, rice plays an essential role in the nation’s diet as it does throughout southeast Asia. But this is also a noodle-crazy population, regularly downing them for breakfast, lunch and dinner, in homes, restaurants and at roadside stands. Noodles are eaten wet and dry, in soup or beside soup, and are made in different shapes and thicknesses of wheat, rice and mung beans. Secondly, no meal is complete without fresh vegetables and herbs. A key portion of every meal, north, south and central, is a platter containing cucumbers, bean threads, slices of hot pepper, and sprigs of basil, coriander, mint and a number of related herbs found principally in southeast Asian markets. About "When you drink the water, remember the spring" Wisdom Contact Reservation bottom of page

name: trelawn.co.nz
homepage_content: Trēlawn Place | Boutique Accommodation near Queenstown NZ Relax in a beautiful place like no other Boutique Accommodation in a Unique Riverside Setting near Queenstown Welcome to Trēlawn Place. We warmly welcome you to come and relax in our boutique accommodations in a stunningly picturesque location just 4kms from Queenstown. One of Queenstown’s most popular and longest established boutique accommodations, we offer comfort, space and tranquility for you, your family, and your pets. Trēlawn Place is also a beautiful wedding venue. Our Accommodations Stay in our tranquil, boutique accommodation just 5 minutes from Queenstown. Our accommodations are both gay and pet friendly. Starting from $ $400 night Cherry Tree House Luxury Queenstown Wedding & Honeymoon Accommodation in The Cherry Tree House. Check Details Starting from $ 365 night Stone Cottage Self Contained Cottage Accommodation in our family Stone Cottage that can sleep four people. Check Details Starting from $ 330 night Garden Apartment Self Contained Apartment Accommodation in our Garden Apartment which sleeps two. Check Details Queenstown's Much-Loved Wedding Venue Surrounded by dramatic mountains with a private beach below the property, Trēlawn Place provides a magical setting that has been used for years as an intimate wedding venue , and is ideal for your honeymoon or wedding night accommodation. The landscaped gardens and stunning backdrop are ideal for wedding photos. A private spa pool provides romantic, beautiful views over the Shotover River and surrounding mountains, and the river is an easy walk. The Queenstown Coronet Peak ski field is the major part of our panoramic river view, and is only a 12 minute drive away, making us ideal for Queenstown ski accommodation. “A fabulous great wonderful amazing location to stay at in Arthurs Point. A great place.to stay for visiting all the surrounding locations, like Queenstown and Arrowtown. We felt very relaxed and welcome staying here, with great local knowledge of the area given by out hosts Michael and Nery.” Rob Wager Stay Stay Stay Play Stay Say Your Vows

name: kccafeandtakeaway.co.nz
homepage_content: KC Cafe And Takeaway | Te Aro | ORDER ONLINE | Takeaway | TuckerFox NZ KC Cafe And Takeaway Asian - Chinese - 4.5 39a Courtenay Pl, Te Aro, Wellington 6011 × Average Customer Rating 4.5 The stir-fried beef ho fun was incredibly fresh and flavorful — definitely a highlight of the meal. The fried chicken wings were a bit on the salty side for my taste, but still crispy and well-cooked. Overall, a very enjoyable dining experience. Highly recommended! 👍 Wu Simon KC has been around for a very long time and rarely closes. Their food is always consistent and they serve up till quite late in the night. Menu is extensive and you’ll often end up wanting to replace your initial choice as there’s too many to choose from! My favourite is the black pepper pork chop and deep fried squid (which you need to eat while it’s hot). The place is often packed so be ready to do takeaways or hang around till one is available. Toilets are at the back however do be careful as the floor might be a tad slippery. Eugene T This place is an institution. Huge menu but doesn't compromise on quality. Had a short wait for a table at 9pm on a weeknight but its always worth the wait. If there are better spring rolls in Wellington I haven’t had them. Luke Dienes Delicous chinese foods. They can cook 160 different dishes with only 2 chefs. Caters many customers. Many takeaways also. Their dishes are not so expensive. Joselyn Lim I can see why this place is a well-loved institution! Ordered our BBQ pork and rice and mi goreng and the food came out lightning-fast and tasted fantastic. Great value too. The amount of menu items is incredible - they really should make a t-shirt with the menu on it as a souvenir R Tran (River) × × - + ADD 0 ATTENTION × Are you sure you want to place this order for tomorrow?
